The restaurant team was outstanding, always attentive and friendly. We also loved the beach bar—great drinks and the perfect spot to relax. And of course, the pool quickly became our favorite hangout.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
From the very start of our honeymoon trip to our bungalow at Ceylon Tea Trails to the last day, we had such a wonderful experience. The views of the lake were gorgeous, and it was great taking the boat to our bungalow and back with the help of the very friendly staff. 

At the bungalow, our attentive butler Ajith and the other staff in the residence attended to us immediately and explained how everything works. They took really good care of us, and we appreciate all their efforts to answer all our questions. The days we spent here were so relaxing (and the gorgeous historic interior was another plus), and we were constantly wowed by the delicious food – we really appreciated Chef’s efforts to prepare local Sri Lankan dishes we missed. 

The food was delicious and we were never left wanting for more. 

We also enjoyed the tour of the tea factory, where we got to learn more about the tea making process, and even try a variety of teas. 

We had an unforgettable experience at Ceylon Tea Trails and we’re looking forward to our next trip there!
title: An unforgettable and luxurious experience

ownerResponse/text: Thank you very much Pulasthi for your warm feedback on your stay at Tea Trails! And for the shout out to several of our passionate team members. I hope that you left us rejuvenated and look forward to seeing you back, warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: This bungalows is in another world !!! A lush garden in full bloom filled the surroundings with a heavenly, serene charm. The gardeners tended with loving care, leaving the garden neat and fair. We had our afternoon cream tea at the patio before strolling around the beautiful garden.  The relatively big pool encircled by the green foliage is a real nice place to rest and relax . Blue mountains at a distance beautified the scenery from the pool side. The rooms are spacious and named after British and Scottish tea planters lived in Ceylon long before.. we stayed in one of the loveliest garden suites which was so spacious including all the necessary amenities. The management tried their best to keep the original structure to maintain its original colonial vibe. We ate our fill whilst dining in the patio area, enjoying the warmth of the heaters nearby. The dinner was scrumptious, super meals by the wonderful chef!! After dinner, I went to bed which was cushy and comfy with a hot water bottle tucked under the blanket. Following day , we did an informative tea factory tour with a tea tasting experience at the Dunkeld Tea Factory before setting off for Colombo. The staff at Tientsin Bungalow was outstanding and their service is commendable. Special thanks should go to Nilantha , Janidu and Tahanie. You guys took a good care of us !! Thank you..with heaps of love.
title: Unforgettable stay at Ceylon Tea Trails Tientsin Bungalow

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing experience at Ceylon Tea Trails, specifically at the Norwood Estate property! Comfortable rooms, great service, amazing views and the food was top notch - missing the scones from high tea along with the high-quality clotted cream and jams!
title: Excellent experience

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: What an amazing two nights at Tea Trails!  From the moment we arrived, we felt so relaxed.  We took the seaplane from Colombo (~30 minute flight) and landed on the lake right in front of Castlereagh Bungalow, where we stayed.  Our room was enormous, with a four poster bed and a large bathroom with luxurious clawfoot tub.  There is no "menu" for meals -- the chef comes to speak with you to propose a menu for each meal, which you can adjust depending on your preferences.  Food was delicious, we particularly loved the Sri Lankan hoppers for breakfast, and the afternoon high tea.  In terms of activities, the tour of the tea factory was extremely interesting and informative, there are lots of beautiful walks / hikes, and we also enjoyed kayaking on the lake.  Stunning views, ambiance and decor -- the whole experience felt like stepping out of time.  Would highly recommend!
title: Amazing experience at Tea Trails

I've previously stayed twice at the Norwood Bungalow (which is fantastic), but this time opted to try the one at Dundalk. It likewise was nothing less than an amazing experience. While the entire staff was just a joy to interact with, a special thank you goes to Samantha and Sathsara who consistently went out of their way to anticipate my needs and offer friendly, flawless, and extremely efficient service. From the private garden, terrific food, comfortable room, pool, hot tub, and peaceful setting, there's so much that makes this place special. If you're looking for an intimate, luxury lodging experience in Sri Lanka's Hill Country, I can't say enough good things about Ceylon Tea Trails.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Nach einer interessanten Zugfahrt von Kandy nach Hatton und weiteren 30 Minuten mit dem Auto erreichten wir den herrlichen Norwood Estate mit einigen wenigen exklusiven Suiten/Zimmern. Wir wurden freundlichst empfangen und drei Tage lang bestens betreut und versorgt. Jede Mahlzeit wurde im Vorfeld mit dem Küchenchef abgesprochen und jedes Gericht war vorzüglich. Zum all inclusive Paket gehört wirklich alles - auch Drinks in der edlen Lounge oder im Zimmer, Wäschereinigung und der Besuch einer Teefabrik mit Führung. 

Bei diesem Tagesausflug konnten wir zwei weitere Unterkünfte der Ceylon Tea Trails (Castlereagh und Dunkeld) kennenlernen. Diese waren genauso edel und stilvoll. Es gab viele Möglichkeiten, die Gegend zu Fuß zu erkunden, die wir ausgiebig nutzten. Die traumhafte Landschaft mit herrlichem Ausblick in die Teeplantagen und zum Castlereaghsee, die Ruhe, die gute Luft und die angenehmen Temperaturen machten unsere Zeit in den Ceylon Tea Trails zum Urlaub im Urlaub.
title: Gediegener Aufenthalt in der Teeplantage

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Absolutely amazing! We were a family of four (kids are 7 and 3) and we had an incredible time. We stayed in Tientsin Bungalow. Everything about it was great. The grounds of the Bungalow were absolutely beautiful, the hospitality of the staff was faultless and the food was some of the best I’ve ever eaten.  There were so many personal touches I appreciated, for example it was our son’s third birthday while we were there and they made a personalised chocolate cake for him, decorated the table and sung happy birthday. Also every morning at 6am they’d bring a coffee to the room as I would get up to go for a run through the tea trails. There was hardly anyone staying there when we were there so sometimes we had the place to ourselves. Would definitely recommend and would love to be back some day :)

The only thing I’d recommend is make sure if you use a private driver they know where your bungalow is . The bungalows are all located a few kilometres apart (which I did not realise) and initially we were taken to the wrong bungalow. This also happened to another guest.
title: Incredible experience

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for taking the time to review us- we are truly appreciative.

We are so glad you had a fantastic stay with us at Tea Trails and  that you enjoyed the old world charm.
We are also delighted that your felt well taken care of by our team including the chef and Janaka.

We look forward to welcoming you back soon!
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
There are five different locations making up the Tea Trails "hotel".  This review relates to the Castlereagh Bungalow only, we did not see the others.  We stayed two nights in a Garden Suite. 

There was some confusion on location and jhow to find the correct venue.  In fact we had to find Summerville Bungalow and were taken across the lake by private boat to the Castlereagh side, as apparently the road around is long, windy, and bumpy 

The charming bungalow has only five rooms (perhaps six). The vibe is old colonial and personal service.  There are no room keys for example, which is lovely. The stay is all inclusive including wine and spirits, and all designed to make you feel like you are a plantation owner 

The butler, Janaka, ensures everything is set up for a relaxing time and catering for your every need.   

The chef will suggest menus for lunch and dinner, and amend according to your likes and dislikes.  And he can cook well, we absolutely loved the Sri Lankan meal he created with nine different curry dishes. 

The decor, of the room and the public areas is fully old world charm. The views over the gardens and lake are beautiful.   

I can recommend the tour of the nearby tea factory, where the guide is knowledgeable and entertaining.  We learned a lot and were not bored in the slightest. 

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and hove no hesitation recommending Tea Trails
title: Fantastic old world charm, beautiful location, excellent service and food.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: We absolutely loved this property and would love to return. We stayed in a garden suite in Castlereigh which was just beautiful, I absolutely loved the private garden. The only thing I would change if possible is the room doesn’t have air conditioning, which being British, we struggled with as the Sri Lankan heat can be quite intense.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at the absolutely stunning Norwood bungalow. This was pure luxury.  The perfect way to relax. The place is nestled up in the hills rocked in the middle of tea plantations.  So serene and beautiful.  Every morning the chef would have a small chat and see what you would like to eat and prepare lunch and dinner accordingly.  Each dish was out of this world.  The high tea is a winner!Thank you chef Rangana and team.  You can also visit the other bungalows around the reservoir for a meal. They organized an informative visit to the Dunkeld Tea factory and the guide, Bernard, was like a walking Tea Encyclopedia. At the bungalow they have a lovely swimming pool and this stunning jacuzzi tucked away in the corner to give you added privacy.  The rooms are classy, well appointed and spotless and maintain the true heritage of the place.  
The staff are so attentive and ensure to cater to your every need whilst ensuring your privacy is not compromised at any time. Have to mention Dasun and his super team of Janaka, Wahed and Priya.  Just left no stone unturned turned in ensuring my every need was met and the stay was memorable.  Truly relaxing and allowed me to totally switch off and reset.  
Highly recommended. 

Look forward to coming back. Soon.

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for sharing your experience  at  Tea Trails with us.  We truly appreciate your kind  review. We are delighted your stay was amazing and that you felt right at home. and that you not only enjoyed the views but Summerville bungalow itself. 

It’s especially heartening to know that Sanjaya, Kumara and the entire team made a significant impact on your stay. We have shared your positive feedback with the team and thanked them on your behalf.

We look forward to welcoming you again in the future!
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure to try a variety of different foods, chef is very happy to take suggestions if what food you enjoy most!
text:
We had an absolutely amazing stay at Summerville Bungalow. From the moment we arrived, Sanjaya and his team went out of their way to make sure everything was just right. They really took care of us and made us feel so welcome.

I have a severe nut and sesame allergy, and I can’t say enough about how well the kitchen team handled it. Every meal was carefully planned, and they always came up with something exciting for lunch and dinner. I even got to pick the entire menu twice, which was such a treat! The chef and his team truly deserve a lot of credit for their attention to detail.

A special shoutout to Kumara, who looked after us every evening at dinner. His service was next level, and his cocktails wonderful. His friendly and attentive nature really made a difference to our overall experience.

The bungalow itself is well-kept with a simple yet elegant design. The views of the reservoir are stunning, and the pool is a lovely place to unwind—though the water was a bit on the cooler side! One small thing to mention is that, like at other Resplendent properties we’ve stayed at, the beds are quite firm. Ours seemed to be two mattresses pushed together, so there was a small gap in the middle—not a huge deal, but something to note for those who prefer a softer bed.

The activities on offer were enjoyable, but we were a bit surprised to see a $30 charge for kayaking around the reservoir on your own, especially given that this was an all-inclusive stay. In most other hotels and resorts we’ve been, kayaking is nearly always included.

All in all, we had an unforgettable time and truly appreciated the warmth and hospitality of the entire team.
title: Cosy Sri Lankan Homely vibes

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Must be one of the best hotel experiences in the world. We stayed in Castlereagh a 5 bedroom tea planters 1930s bungalow set in fabulous lawns and gardens with views over the lake. Each room had a private garden as well. Meals are all prepared specially for you after discussion with the chef. The service was incredible- special mention to Singh and Aruna, food delicious. All meals and drinks included in the price. We booked through luxurious Lanka.

The tea tasting with Bernard is not to be missed. He is a fund of great stories and knows all you could ever want to know about tea
title: Quintessential English Charm amidst the Tea Plantations

placeInfo/address: Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Bellwood Manor was such a delight! The estate is beautiful and the rooms are large and comfortable. It was nice having a small electric heater fireplace in the room as the weather was chillier than expected since you are up in the mountains. A very different climate than we came from in Colombo. The experience feels like being a guest in the home of a friend (a very well-to-do friend) more than a hotel because the stay is so warm and welcoming. 

Every meal in the restaurant was a delight. (You must try the Sri Lankan breakfast.) Janaka provided wonderful service and we were always given way more food than we could eat but wished we could finish it because the flavors were so good. Not just the taste but also the presentation of each dish was well done. 

The private sauna experience in the spa was a nice, relaxing surprise. While I did not personally take advantage of the other spa services, my husband enjoyed his Vietnamese massage. 

The ability to communicate with the staff via WhatsApp proved very convenient and Staicy was always prompt, polite, and helpful in her responses. 

Since we visited during the rainy season we hired a car to drive us around to the tea plantations and waterfalls. If we had wanted to walk to town, it would have only been a short 10 minute walk but we wanted to see some of the sights a bit further out. 

I highly recommend Bellwood Manor on your next visit Nuwara Eliya.
title: A world class stay in the misty mountains of Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent hotel and even better staff. I had my doubts about the hotel despite excellent rating. 

Ambience 
In the middle of the Nuwara Eliya yet peaceful. Most points / places to visit (except tea estates and farms) are walking distance. 

Rooms
Spacious airy. Modern yet with old colonial charm.
Rooms have most amenities available in regular hotels.

Staff 
Courteous, friendly and caring. A big shout out to Stacy and Janaka who made our stay even more comfortable. Stacy is helpful, knows her brief and whilst toeing hotel policies still manages to make your stay more comfortable and fun. Janaka was always around - he followed our food requests to the T. 
Irshad without hesitating subscribed to a channel we wanted. It was amazing no questions asked - you are our guest you want it we will get it (for reasonable requests).

Food and Restaurant 
The best hoppers I have had ever. Super light and delicious. Our first time experience of 4 course breakfast - local fruits, granola with curd, hoppers with 4 curries and 2 sambals least course tea/ coffee/milk. 
We were asked our food preferences / dietary restrictions they were followed. 

The three course dinner was amazing! 

Only down side they don’t have 24 hour kitchen - so if you are the kinds who has food cravings middle of the night not sure if this place is for you. 

Amenities 
Plunge pool cum jacuzzi, steam room and sauna room. All three are situated in the out house with the spa. Only issue we faced was that the pool, steam and sauna were in such a small area that the steam from the steam room hits you on the face (whilst in plunge pool) if anyone opens it’s door.

I would not recommend the jacuzzi being on if you have young children who are also going to enter the pool with you. As the chlorine in the water and pressure from the jacuzzi spouts can make their eye really burn.

They have bicycles and also offer horse riding for a price. 

The horse rides and horse care takers were both very good. The first say they took us up the single tree mountain and next day they offered to take us on a different route through the race course and ‘forest’. The price u thought was high but after enquiring rates at tourist points it wasn’t that bad plus these horse rides are with people known to the hotel sand arranged through themso it’s better.

Conclusion 
Worth a stay if you don’t have young children with you.
title: Surprisingly amazing

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Unser Aufenthalt im Uga Bay war insgesamt sehr angenehm und erholsam. Die großzügig geschnittenen Zimmer sind geschmackvoll eingerichtet und bieten ein hohes Maß an Komfort. Besonders positiv hervorzuheben ist der ausgezeichnete Zimmerservice – Wünsche wurden umgehend umgesetzt, und auch unsere Zimmerpräferenzen wurden individuell und sehr aufmerksam berücksichtigt. Der direkte Zugang zum traumhaften Sandstrand und das gepflegte Resortgelände sorgen für echtes Urlaubsfeeling. Kleine Abstriche gab es bei der Getränkeauswahl, insbesondere bei Sonderwünschen, auf die zunächst nicht eingegangen wurde – dies wurde jedoch nach Rücksprache freundlich gelöst. Insgesamt war die Getränkeauswahl zunächst sehr limitiert und es wird kein aktiver Service am Pool oder Strand angeboten. Auf Nachfrage war man aber auch hier sehr bemüht.
Verbesserungswürdig ist aus unserer Sicht die Sauberkeit im Bad: Kalkrückstände an Armaturen und stellenweise ausgefranste Frottierwaren passten nicht ganz zum ansonsten hohen Standard. Insgesamt dennoch ein sehr schönes Resort mit viel Potenzial und einem zugewandten Team – wir würden wiederkommen.
title: Entspannter Luxus mit kleinen Abstrichen – dennoch sehr empfehlenswert

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Потрясающий отель! Спасибо большое! Прекрасные завтраки, всегда есть свободные места на пляже. Очень вежливый и внимательный персонал. Очень отзывчивый и приветливый! Угадывают желания клиента , всегда рады помочь! Спасибо большое! Обязательно вернемся еще!!! Рекомендуем!
title: Лучший персонал! 5 звёзд отелю. Все на высшем уровне!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sajeev will become your new best friend. He's a superstar (as are all of the staff)
text:
If there is one place I could choose to return to, Uga Bay would be it. Quite simply the most beautiful hotel you could wish to stay. Where do i start.....

Location - stunning and tranquil setting with unspoilt ocean views from every view. The journey to the east coast is well worth the effort, and forgotten as you step through the door.

Facilities - quietly understated, but exceptional quality and simply luxurious. Quiet and secluded rooms tastefully spread across manicured grounds adds to a feeling of total peace and relaxation. Attention to detail ensures everything you could need is provided (and those that you didn't think you needed!)

Food - mind-blowing - creative dining with an expansive ever-changing menu; prepared with care and attention by the most creative and friendly team of talented chefs; presented consistently beautifully; and with a quality and range of flavours that was a delight to enjoy at every meal.

But what makes this hotel truly special are the staff - every member of staff goes above and beyond to make each guest feel welcome. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by welcoming smiling staff, to the time we left and they gathered to wave us off like part of the family, each member of staff goes far beyond their roles. Special mention needs to go to Sajeev for his care and attention to us both throughout our stay. And also a big thank you to Santha, Usara, Yassa, Rasini and Sathiya, but while those are only the names we remember, I am grateful to every member of the Uga Bay team - you have created a unique environment that helps create memories that will last.

Will we return? Without hesitation. Sajeev and team, we will see you again soon!
title: The closest place to paradise

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The room was spotless, stylish, and extremely comfortable. The cleanliness throughout the hotel was top-notch, including the bathroom, which was modern and impeccably maintained. Room service was fast, friendly, and efficient.

Truly, every detail from the ambiance to the hospitality was pretty, pretty, really, really, incredibly good. I couldn’t be more impressed. This place sets a high standard, and I can’t wait to come back.

Highly recommended!
title: From the moment I arrived at Uga Bay, everything exceeded my expectations. The service was absolutely incredible every

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our fifth holiday at this beautiful resort and each time it keeps getting better and better. From the reservation team in Colombo, notably Mr Jacques Anandappa and Mr Jithendra Abeysinghe and the reception team at the hotel, Professionalism was the order of the day. All arrangements were seamless and smooth and we left after a three nights stay with further unforgettable memories. The Ocean Studio King room where we stayed was spacious and luxuriously furnished with all modern amenities and has a direct view of the ocean. To start the day with a stroll on the   pristine white sandy beach and watch the Sun rise simply takes your breath away. During your stroll you may have the good fortune of meeting the local fishermen, hauling in their overnight catch. Boat rides and water sports are on offer from private companies. The pool is very inviting with crystal clear water and blue as the sky. The pool bar serves up some mouth watering bites and delicious cocktails. The food that is served in the restaurant is unbelievably delightful. The breakfast buffet is sumptuous and caters for all palates with English, continental and Asian cuisine as well as a Sri Lankan corner. Nothing is too much for the Staff. If you need something extra, all you have to do is just ask Ramani, the restaurant Hostess, who will do her utmost to produce it for you. The dinner buffet's are no different with live stations displaying the chefs culinary prowess. In a hotel where all staff were courteous, friendly and very helpful, it is difficult to single out individuals for praise. However, during this stay, there were a few staff who stood out for us, we  would like to mention by name. Chef Hismath who was very obliging and produced the most wonderful Dosa for me. Chef Thusal, Trainee chef Sanuji  and waiter Munas were the others who were very helpful and obliging. Hostess Ramani with her cheerful smile was always there to welcome us into the restaurant and attended to all our needs. Last, but by no means least, Mr Neranjan Morais the General Manager who was very helpful and always visible in the background. 
All in all. it was another wonderful holiday for my wife and I, and counting the days when we could go there again.
title: Memorable Holiday at a Luxurious Beach Resort

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at Uga Bay for 15 nights. It’s a fantastic hotel in a beautiful location for staying and relaxing. It's also a good starting point for excursions to places like Ella, Nuwara Eliya, Kandy, Sigiriya, Minneriya National Park, or Trincomalee (for snorkeling), as we've already done. The hotel grounds and the beach are stunning, and the rooms are very nice and clean. All the meals are excellent. We absolutely loved the Sri Lankan corner with its delicious curries. But the best part is the staff. Everyone is extremely friendly and accommodating and they do a great job with passion. Thank you for everything! Best wishes to all of you, especially to Ismath and Darshan.
title: Everything excellent!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka

We would like to thank all the staff especially Ismath (who makes amazing deserts) ,Sanuji, Kushanka , Ramani & Saraj for making our stay so special!
title: Beautiful stay

the standard of housekeeping was great, I felt every The rooms were immaculate through out my stay.

placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the Anantara for 8 nights following 2 weeks of travelling and staying in various places in Sri Lanka.
We thoroughly enjoyed our time in Sri Lanka but what really did make it special were the Sri Lankan people themselves and nowhere epitomised this more than at the Anantara.All the staff from those working on the grounds through cleaners,restaurant staff to front of house were friendly,helpful and usually happy to engage in conversation.You are made to feel especially welcome when dining at Journeys where we enjoyed chatting with Tachila,Thisari and others,often fairly new staff but very pleased to be working there.The manager of the pool bar,Greshan,was probably the nicest person we met in Sri Lanka and his story of surviving the tsunami we will never forget,thanks for the G&T’s!Likewise to the ‘beach boys’ Nuwan,Heshan and others who ensured our place on the grass for sundowners and just couldn’t stop smiling and laughing.Great guys.Front of house was Thisal who was at the end of all our WhatsApp’s sorting out laundry,drinks and every other request.Thanks
The grounds are immaculately kept with people sweeping from sunrise to sunset and contain many different trees,shrubs and plants as well as animals and birds,well worth taking a closer look at to appreciate.Don’t miss the man who climbs the impossibly high palm trees with just a bit of rope between his feet,chopping down coconuts.
The whole complex sweeps close to the shoreline and is bookended by the Il Mare Italian style restaurant high up overlooking the cliffs and wonderful on an evening to Verala Asian themed restaurant shaped to mimic 2 coconut shells and very impressive.We ate there 3 times and were expertly looked after by Rizvi enjoying watching the chefs with their clanging blades making the kotthu or other specials.
The beach in front of the hotel can be challenging to swim in and not for the inexperienced but the adjacent public beach Goyambaku is safer but still great fun for bodyboarding.
Our all inclusive package allowed us a one hour spa treatment which is very classy and we also enjoyed the high tea experience.I wanted to try a surfing lesson and the hotel have a company called Tropic surf which is located on site and run by Shaun and Lainey which take you to a safe and quiet beach some 20 minutes away by tuktuk.Great fun,very tiring but no good if you’re 63 and unfit!
The Anantara is very much a 5 star experience.
title: 5 Star experience

roomTip: ing. There is   We went during the offseason therefore the ocean was rough and not recommended for swimm an area nearby if you want to swim.
text:
Annantara Peace Haven Tangalle is one of the most luxurious resorts I have been to in SL. When we arrived we were welcomed in true SL tradition with dancers and drummers and to the sound of conchshell blowers!! After registration we were met by Ms Kavindi Ashinshana, our room host who took us on a tour of the property. Kavi is the most friendly and helpful person you could meet. She told us to call her at any time if we needed anything at any time!! She even made our restaurant reservations!!
We were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room which was large and spacious. The bed was super comfortable and the linen was soft and luxurious.
We had lunch at the Lobby Bar and the rice and curry was delicious and our steward Bashitha was super friendly and genuinely cared about making us happy and the supervisor Wiraj was a super nice person who ame and talked with us to make sure we were happy.
We had dinner at Il Mare Italian restaurant the first night and it was the most amazing experience.
Our steward Dinuka helped us to select our starters and main course which saved us time and as a result of his knowledge we loved what we ordered and enjoyed the meal!!
Since the food was so tasty we went back to the Poolside bar for lunch.
On Saturday we went to the Verela restaurant for dinner and we were ordering funentertained by a saxophonist who played some unbelievable music.

Here too our well trained steward Manula was exceptionally helpful and before long we were able to order our food!!
Finally our room attendant Dilip cleaned the room, toilet and bed and brought extra water since we liked to drink a lot of water. I could see that he enjoyed his job from the smile on his face!!
The front office staff too were very happy and I believe that they enjoyed their work.
Overall Annantara Peace Haven Tangalle is a must visit destination if you liked to visit a 5 star hotel outside the city of Colombo!!
title: A memorable vacation in a luxurious resort!!

text:
I stayed at the Anantara Peace resort Tangalle for 3 nights with my family. We had a great experience. The property is beautiful. Great expanse and lovely spaces. 
The room was spacious, exactly as described online. 
The common areas, garden and beach access all were great. 
We used the spa as well and the therapists were very good. 

It is a great spot to relax, unwind. The drive from Colombo is also super convenient- very good roads. Easy access. 

The staff is very very nice and warm. Super attentive. Every person we met was always smiling and eager to help. They have a concierge system and it’s very effective. Our concierge was Thisari and she was so so nice. We were fortunate to have met her. She was so attentive, always available and helping us with various things. 
I would like to say a special thanks to her for her warmth and hospitality. 

All the other staff were also extremely nice, helpful, warm always smiling. 
Was lovely to meet a friendly face at breakfast or while walking at the property. Imalka served us breakfast several times and made very nice coffee each time. He was very sweet. 

My only suggestion would be to improve the taste of non Sri Lankan food that is served at the hotel. When we were bored of eating Sri Lankan, we would try the Asian but this was not the best. 

Apart from this, we had a lovely and a memorable stay.
title: Lovely stay at Anantara

text:
The term Peace Haven is not misused. From the check-in to the check-out and everything else in between was amazing! 

The staff at Anantara Tangalle are some of the best I’ve come across. Their efforts in supporting the guests seem natural and authentic as opposed to being forced to do so. The personal guest relations staff assigned to the room (Hashan) was very helpful and made sure all the needs and requests were met. Every single staff from the Front Desk to the Restaurants and gardeners were all courteous beyond measure and greeted every single person crossing their path and made sure they were ready to help with anything. 

The food was delicious! Unfortunately the lunch and dinner at the main restaurants were only on à la carte basis due to the low season, however the Breakfast Buffet made up for it for sure. The spread was great and the quality of food and freshness from the live juice station is unmatched. Overall, this buffet is enough to satisfy your hunger for days. 

Overall, the hotel was excellent and would be a great choice for travellers visiting by themselves or their loved ones to escape from reality and enjoy some much needed peace and tranquility.
title: Truly a Peace Haven!

text:
Our family had a truly memorable high tea at W15 Hanthana Estate. From the moment we arrived, the team welcomed us with genuine warmth and attentiveness. They answered every question we had about local wildlife and the surrounding mountains—and even brought out a photo book so we could see how the estate was restored.

Although my relatives are from the area, this was their first visit, and they were amazed by the estate’s beauty, the exquisite spread of sweet and savory treats, and the impeccable service. Sheriff and his colleague (whose name escapes me) went the extra mile, even preparing a cup of tea for our driver while he waited.

We left thoroughly impressed and already looking forward to our next visit!
title: High reviews for high tea

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I got married at W15 Hanthana in June and stayed there for 3 nights. 
It was a beautiful experience. We were surrounded by misty rolling hills and tea plantations. The property is incredible, with  10 well maintained rooms that were immaculately clean. The spacious rooms were perfect for our wedding party to get ready in. The villas interior and exterior architecture was perfect for photography. 

The W15 team has done a great job preserving the heritage of the property while offering all the modern comforts for their guests. A huge shoutout to the incredible hospitality team consisting of Sheriff, Manjula, Prabod, Hasthasava, and Keerith. They went above and beyond for us. Their warmth and hospitality left a lasting impression on us and our families.

Also a special mention to the chef at w15. Every meal was exceptional, from warm, fresh pastries in the morning to multiple course meals. The food was definitely a highlight.

Finally, a heartfelt thank you to Sidath and the management team for their coordination with our event planners and the Hilton food and beverage team to bring our vision to life. 

We are grateful to the entire W15 team for helping us organise this wedding.
title: Wedding weekend at W15

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Incredible hotel with the most lovely staff, food and atmosphere. Upon arrival, we got a warm, traditional welcome before being guided to our amazing villa with a private plunge pool. The place was clean, spacious, and overall incredible. 

The staff's hospitality was unmatched. Amazingly helpful and friendly. We felt like royalty! Some of these people felt like family and friends, even after just having met them. 
 The food is fresh, tasty and of high quality, with a variety of options. We definitely recommend booking the authentic kamatha dinner. Romantically located in the middle of a rice field, the lovely staff cook and serve a Sri Lankan dinner with an abundance of rice, curries and other tasty dishes. Everything is cooked in the authentic kitchen, which they give you a tour of. An amazing experience to never forget! 

The hotel offers plenty of activities. We rode the bikes that came with the villa to explore the property, spotting monkeys and peacocks and taking in the lush nature and rice paddies. Another big plus was the kayaking experience. In the early morning, we had the chance to immerse ourselves in the serenity of a lake filled with colourful water lilies popping up at the surface. This was truly out of a fairytale.

This hotel is a place to never forget. We would recommend it to everyone. Thank you to all of the staff who've made this stay so wonderful. Out of this world on every level!
title: Idyllic Sri Lankan gem

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: We have come for our honeymoon... and the only thing I can say about this hotel is that it is SPECTACULAR. Atmosphere, rooms, food and all the people the hotel are detailing and attentive to every moment. If you have the opportunity to go... don't hesitate.
title: Honey Moon

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Fabulous from the moment we were greeted by the staff on arrival. 58 acres of heaven nestled away from the hustle bustle. Service was excellent, as was our pool villa. An early walk around the property assures interaction with monkeys, peacocks and sublime views and gardens.

The dining experience at Kamatha was novel as much as it was a world class experience. Highly recommended, this was certainly a highlight of our stay.

This was an unforgettable 2 night stay.
title: Amazing 2 night stay

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Unser Aufenthalt im Uga Ulagalla war ein echtes Highlight unserer Sri-Lanka-Reise. Die großzügigen Villen mit eigenem Plunge Pool bieten Privatsphäre pur und sind wunderschön in die Natur eingebettet. Die Verbindung aus traditioneller Architektur und modernem Komfort ist absolut gelungen. Besonders hervorzuheben ist das außergewöhnlich freundliche und aufmerksame Personal – hier fühlt man sich nicht nur willkommen, sondern rundum umsorgt. Kulinarisch bewegt sich das Resort auf hohem Niveau, wobei Fleischliebhaber sich gelegentlich etwas mehr Auswahl am Abend wünschen könnten – das ist aber Kritik auf hohem Niveau. Insgesamt ein wundervoller Ort zum Abschalten und Genießen – wir kommen sehr gern wieder!
title: Ein traumhafter Rückzugsort inmitten der Natur – stilvoll, ruhig und herzlich

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try their home-made ice creams. The best we have tasted.
text:
Back from Uga Ulagalla after yet another unforgettable stay. While every visit of our many visits has etched fond memories, we felt that the resort had subtly elevated its already impeccable standards.
 
Much of this, we realised, stems from the remarkable team, led with confidence and humility by GM Dimuthu. From the seamless service to the genuine hospitality that enveloped us throughout our stay, Ulagalla was special.
 
One of the aspects we noticed was the resort’s strides toward greater gender balance. It’s incredibly refreshing to be welcomed by smiling, attentive staff who consistently went above and beyond—not just as part of their job, but with a warmth that felt sincere and personal. And dressed elegantly, always in fresh attire.
 
Front Office Manager Dilrukshi, whom we have fondly known from our past visits along with other heads of divisions, brought that signature Uga touch that defines a world class luxury resort.
 
 A pleasant surprise as we were about to leave was the handwritten note delivered in a sealed Uga envelope by Thilini in the restaurant, asking us to open it only after we leave. The touching contents of the note said it all about the humility of the staff.

“Deep in the forest, lost and lone,
A city sleeps in ruin and stone;
Columns shattered and temples bare,
Tales of kings that dwelt there.”
-From Ruined Cities of Ceylon by Sir Samuel Baker
title: A Sanctuary Refined

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: I enjoyed my stay at Ulagalla.  It was close enough to see many of the cultural attractions of central Sri Lanka (Dambulla, Anuradhapura, Sigiriya) but far enough away to be a peaceful retreat.  I enjoyed the time in my villa and the monkey visitors putting on a show in the morning.   I had one of the best deep tissue massages I've ever had with Dina at the spa and enjoyed learning about the local communities during my scenic drive excursion.   I booked the Kamatha dinner experience one night and was served enough food for about 5 people :)  All of it was wonderful and a great way to try many Sri Lankan specialties.
title: Wonderful peaceful resort in a great location

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Endroit paradisiaque , calme et sérénité . Que dire de l'amabilité de tous les personnels , de leur aptitude à toujours vous rendre service.
Les chambres ( plutot les appartements) sont extraordinaires avec un confort poussé à l'extrème.Bref ce lieu est incontournable !!!
title: Le calme paradisiaque de cet hotel est à découvrir absolument

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Endroit parfait pour le repos car très calme et intime 
On peut facilement visiter les sites touristiques au départ de l’hôtel 
Très bon accueil au sein de hôtel 
Le personnel est très attentionné.le repas très bon surtout au restaurant Kamatha.
Safari en jeep pour découvrir les villages environnants et notre ranger très sympathique..merci pour le goûter au coucher du soleil 
Très bon moment à l’hôtel
title: Endroit Paisible et intimiste

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful hotel!!! I absolutely loved this place. Thank you so much for the excellent service. It’s been a real pleasure!!
If we come back to Sri Lanka, we will definitely return to this hotel.
Special mention to Yoshina, thanks a lot. 
Berta and Pelayo.
title: Wonderful hotel!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful, historic main building set in manicured grounds.  Welcome was warm, and buggy ride to villa passed through rice fields, gardens and forest.  Villas are huge, with sitting room as well as large bedrooms and bathrooms all both very modern and traditional blended.  Plunge pool offered a great relief from the heat.   Restaurant was exceptional, every meal delightful...both traditional and more European-inspired items.  Chef was deligthful...and offered tastes of experimental ice creams he'd been working on...all were great.  There are a few activities available--horseback riding (there is one horse), kayaking on a lake, walks...but I'd say they are not really the point.  The main pool is beautiful, but rather exposed and far from the villas, so i never saw anyone in it.  There is a spa, but we never went.
title: One of my favorites in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Very nice resort, beautiful surroundings. Very helpful staf. Excellent food! Pool villas are located very private in the nature. Monkeys and other animals on the terrain. Flexible for my husband who’s not so mobile. We did a very nice excursion including a high tea!
title: Beautiful resort!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Everything at Uga Ulagalla was amazing. The hotel, villa, pool and specially the staff were incredible.
The restaurant was very accommodating to our dietary preferences (we are not the easiest to deal with).  They went above and beyond to provide what we requested.
Definitely coming back whenever I am in Sri Lanka!
title: Amazing stay at Uga Ulagalla

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: This place is worth every penny! Paradise on earth with plenty of space and activities in a gorgeous setting. You've got free bikes that come with the room to explore the area which is surrounded by jungle, rice paddies and lakes. The food is delicious and the hosts are friendly and welcoming. Would strongly recommend!!
title: Garden of eden

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Uga Ulagalla offers a stay unlike any other in Sri Lanka. The 58-acre property is a testament to thoughtful design, featuring nature-friendly villas with all the luxury amenities, paddy fields, farmhouses, natural vegetation, kayaks, and stables with horses. With such a diverse range of activities, boredom is simply not an option here. 
Waking up to the symphony of different bird calls and the sight of peacocks, squirrels, and monkeys, one can start the day with a horse ride in the paddy fields. The unique dining experience in Kamatha, a dining area set in the heart of a paddy field, is a highlight not to be missed. I had the opportunity to indulge in a culinary journey, with the curry leaves chutney being a standout. The hotel's commitment to authentic Sri Lankan flavors is evident in the use of hotel grown and ground spices.  The hotel caters to vegan and vegetarian diets.
Hospitality and the service of the staff are among the outstanding highlights of our stay. Staff goes out of the way to ensure comfort and make the stay uncomfortable. We had a viper encounter, and the buggy driver went over and above to take care of everyone’s safety.  
Uga Ulagalla is built on the pillars of sustainability. The hotel's commitment to the local community is evident in its employment of local staff and its support of local farmers by purchasing their vegetables, fruits, and rice. Hotel is committed to provide a lifeline to the local community. 
Finally, Uga Ullagalla is a platform to convey the Sri Lankaness to the world.
title: The best stay.

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Use the included cycles to explore the grounds. A take away breakfast can be organised for any early morning visits.
text:
The most outstanding stay. We have never experienced such attentive and warm service. 

A special thanks to Tinusha who looked after us right from our delightful welcome. The whole team however were exceptional throughout. 

The food is out of this world and served in a lovely open first floor area looking out over the pool and fields. We also dined alongside the paddy fields at the Kamatha one evening sampling over 25 Sri Lankan dishes in the most amazing setting. Something not to be missed.

The location is secluded yet has easy access to many of the historic sites. The highlight for us has to be Lion’s rock which we visited early in the morning to avoid the heat and crowds. A sensational place to visit. 

The accommodation is spacious, very well equipped and spotlessly clean. We enjoyed the buggy rides to and from the main building. We also rode around both the site and local tanks (reservoirs) on the bikes provided taking in the magnificent scenery and wildlife (peacocks, monkeys, mongoose…)

I can’t imagine a better place to stay. Thank you again to everyone that made our stay so special,
title: A truly outstanding experience

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Our first night in Sri Lanka and what a start. Beautiful setting, wonderful service. Loved the big pool(30 metres perfect for swimmers)  and the bikes!  We also had a massage and it was great.  And we had a peacock at the decking this morning  Thank you very much.
title: Beautiful stay

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: This is a beautiful but very spread out hotel set around paddy fields.  However, bikes are provided with each room and there is also a buggy service. The rooms are amazing with a separate sitting room as well as a large bedroom, dressing area and bathroom.  They also each have a large terrace area and plunge pool set in their own private bit of jungle.  There is a beautiful massive main swimming pool up by the reception and dining area.  In house activities are very well-organised and we went on two excursions with the lovely Narmadha as our guide.  All the staff were lovely and the food is good, however, the menu is a bit limited and drinks were expensive.
title: Amazing suites

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: IMHO, it is worth staying here and driving a little farther each day to the major cultural triangle attractions
text:
I can't add anything here that hasn't already been said. Simply the best hotel/resort we stayed in over the 30 days we were in Sri Lanka.  Beautiful, luxurious, attentive staff...my only wish is that it was closer to Sigiriya and the other main cultural attractions in Sri Lanka.

Beds were great, private pools at the side of each bungalow was great...
title: The best of the best in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The resort is cleverly embedded in nature. The guest bungalows are loosely distributed on the huge site. For transportation you can take the villa bikes or call a golf cart. The XXL pool invites you to swim and relax. Morning excursion by Jeep with Katharina is highly recommended! We loved the varied and very good food.
Stuff is always very friendly and helpful. Yoshina, the Guest Relations Manager, taught us many Singales words. We had a incredible great time with her and we miss her terribly. Hari, hari, Yoshi?!
title: Unforgettable stay at the Uga Ulagalla with Yoshina

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Arrange for a driver - can be challenging to find an uber or taxi
text:
Remote and secluded but well-worth the effort and travel to get there! The rooms are unique  and the care and kindness of the staff are fantastic: 

A special thank you to:

Dilshan - Reception
Nuwan
Hasitha
Shamal - Mixologist 
Gayan - Safari Ranger
title: SRI Lankan Safari

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff is extremely nice and professional, their main goal is to ensure we were always comfortable and addressed our needs. The safari guides and drivers were very professional and knowledgeable about Yala National Park fauna and flora. Remarkable how they respected the animals and avoided gatherings with other vehicles around the wild life. 
The hotel rooms are amazing, integrated architecture, great interior design and relaxed balcony with jacuzzi. 
Great cuisine and both restaurant and bar well located with ocean views.
title: Sri Lanka trip

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Hut 1 great for sea view. Hut 2 great for wildlife visitors.
text:
We spent 7 nights at Uga Chena Huts on an all inclusive basis booking via Emirates Holidays.  Very relaxed place to be and rather informal which we appreciated.  Situated on  a picturesque beach  (not suitable  for swimming) and  adjacent to  Yala National Park. Plenty of wildlife to see within the parameters of the hotel itself, hence the need to have a Ranger with you when walking the beach.  Cocktails and nibbles available daily at sunset from a beach bar. The Huts are nestled in the bushes , provide privacy, are spacious, luxurious and kept  immaculately clean with everything you would need, including laundry service.  Private decks are large and  have a shower ,  and each hut has its own jacuzzi- swimming pool.  We stayed in Hut 2 on arrival  for three nights and had lots of wildlife visitors throughout the day and night, especially monkeys which we immensely enjoyed watching . We moved to Hut 1 just to get an ocean view.  Not so many wildlife  visitors  to Hut 1 though an elephant did walk along the beach on our last evening!.  
Mini bar was free and well stocked though the  wines left a lot to be desired!!. Room was serviced twice a day.  Bed is enormous and extremely comfortable. Wifi is good and reliable. We used the hotel pool  and the spa facilities and thoroughly enjoyed them. 
The staff are  all exceptional. Every member of staff was  pleasant, polite, and couldn't do enough for you.  The food is extremely good, imaginative dishes, varied menu, quality,  fresh local  ingredients  and a chef who takes pride in what he produces.  What lets the restaurant down is the wine that is available. It's terrible, poor quality and limited choice  and not befitting of a 5* hotel or the fabulous food the chef produces.  We did mention it and we hope something is done to rectify this .  
We had the services of an excellent knowledgeable Ranger for our five safaris and we also visited Sithulpawwa Temple with him. He also took us   to a local fishing village and  on  a beach walk  in the vicinity of the hotel.  We saw everything we wanted to  on the Safari's and thoroughly enjoyed them. The hotel provides a picnic for each trip too.  
We would highly recommend this place.
title: A" MUST GO TO " destination!!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived at Uga Chena Huts, we knew we were in for something extraordinary. Nestled between the lush Yala jungle and the sparkling Indian Ocean, this luxury eco-resort effortlessly blends nature with elegance — and every moment we spent there felt like a dream.

The Vibe:
There’s a peaceful energy throughout the property — calming, rejuvenating, and full of soul. You’re surrounded by nature, but the comfort is uncompromising. The thatched-roof villas are spacious, beautifully appointed, and come with private plunge pools and outdoor decks where you can hear the jungle hum around you. It’s luxury in its most natural and refined form.

The Food & Gastronomy:
The culinary experience at Uga Chena Huts is second to none. Every meal was a celebration of Sri Lankan flavors, with an exquisite touch of international flair. From freshly caught seafood to fragrant local curries, each dish was crafted with care, creativity, and authenticity. A special thank you to Gayal, Kalum, and Chamara from the main restaurant, whose attentive service and warm smiles made every meal feel like a five-star experience — their hospitality was as unforgettable as the food itself.

The Safari Rides:
The game drives into Yala National Park were beyond thrilling. Our friendly ranger Sandun was not only incredibly knowledgeable but also genuinely passionate about the wildlife and the land. He brought the jungle to life with fascinating stories and insights, and we were lucky enough to witness some breathtaking animal encounters, including the majestic Sri Lankan leopard.

The Bar & Lounge Experience: Best smoothie ever, so do the cocktails.
Evenings at the lounge were something we looked forward to every day. Whether it was a craft cocktail or a custom creation inspired by local flavors, the bartenders never failed to impress. Huge thanks to Sathish and Nuwan, whose skill and charm behind the bar turned each drink into a celebration. Their energy and attention to detail added a vibrant and fun touch to our nights at Uga.

The Front Office & Service:
A very special thanks to Deshan and Dasun his front office colleagues at the front office who always pick us from buggy and guide us always — your kindness, constant support, and genuine care truly made us feel at home oh that sarcasm 😉 . From organizing our experiences to ensuring every detail was perfect, Deshan went above and beyond for us every step of the way. The entire front office team was friendly, efficient, and always ready with a warm smile — the true embodiment of Sri Lankan hospitality.

Final Thoughts:
Uga Chena Huts is more than just a luxury retreat — it’s a heartfelt experience where nature, comfort, and people come together in the most beautiful way. Thanks to the incredible team — especially Deshan, Sathish, Nuwan, Gayal, Kalum, and Chamara — our stay was filled with unforgettable moments, amazing flavors, wild adventures, and genuine human connection.

We may have forgotten some of the names who helped us throughout our stay. Cheers to all of them.

🌿 10/10 – Already dreaming about our next visit! 🐾🍸
title: A Magical Escape into the Wild – Uga Chena Huts is Simply Unforgettable!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Opt for both a morning safari & evening safari. The bush is very different at different times.
text:
Every aspect of our stay here was perfect. From the ambience, to the room quality, to the food, to the staff - it was all a 5* experience. I loved our stay there and cannot wait to be back.

Special note of thanks to Dushmantha, who was the Uga ranger assigned to us for the safari during our stay. He was polite, professional, and extremely knowledgeable. Highly recommended!

I also want to thank Nuwan, who was our waiter during the stay. He was prompt, had a sharp attention to detail, and made us right at home.
title: Best trip we have ever taken

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Incroyable !
Le personnel est extrêmement sympathique et a l’écoute. Après une erreur sur les dates Dinith nous a permis de pouvoir changer et venir aux dates qui nous arrangeait. 
Le bar et les cocktails sont excellents (merci à Lassi) 
Les chambres sont incroyables ainsi que la restauration ! 
Merci bcp
title: Incroyable

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for two nights, my only regret is that it was not longer!
The hut was gorgeous and we enjoyed our pool in the evening. 
We never made it to sundowners as we were in the pool and didn't get to see the main swimming pool.
The food, wow, was delicious and freshly cooked.
Our safari guide was Janith and between him and the driver did a fabulous job of taking us on some quieter routes around Yala.
Special mention to Deshan who always had a smile on his face and had a great sense of humour.
title: Two nights was not enough!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Bungalow avec piscine au cœur du parc de Yala 
Les chambres sont spacieuse entouré de végétation 
Très bonne restauration et le mini bar de la formule tout inclus est très bonne qualité 
On profite bien de la piscine de son bungalow avec le bruit de la mer 
Très belle plage mais il faut un ranger pour aller se balader  car situé dans le parc de Yala 
Possibilité de faire un safari dans le parc
title: Très bonne prestation au cœur de Yala

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Uga Chena is an incredible place with a breathtaking view of the ocean. The service was flawless — every detail taken care of with care and professionalism. The team at the restaurant and reception were extremely kind and welcoming.

Our safari experience was unforgettable, thanks to our amazing guide Dushmantha, who made it both exciting and insightful.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for nature, luxury, and warm hospitality.
title: A Wonderful Safari

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: I had the most incredible solo stay at Uga Chena Huts. The lodge is beautiful and peaceful, but what really made my experience unforgettable was the people. The entire staff was warm and welcoming, and I felt so well taken care of throughout. Special thanks to my safari ranger Dush and our driver — they were absolutely fantastic. So knowledgeable, kind, and truly passionate about what he does. I couldn’t have asked for a better guide. Highly recommend for anyone traveling solo or otherwise!
title: Solo Adventurer Review!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Enjoy every moment cause it’s worth it.
text:
Could not fault our stay in any way. From the service to the food and all in between. 
Life is but for creating memories and this we did. 
And yes you know when you take a photo of the pillow label that they are the best. Just have to work out how to import them.
title: Perfection

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Nestled on the beach in Yala wildlife park, a collection of luxury cabins. Unbelievable location, the cabin design is wonderfully luxurious and in keeping with nature, and we had an ocean view. Our own outside decking and plunge pool were perfect. Unfortunately only one night for us, with an afternoon and morning safaris that were fantastic. We saw a family of elephants right up close and a pair of leopards - but we were told we had been very, very lucky. Lots of other wildlife including crocodile, deer, buffalo, peacocks and a wide range of other colourful and different birds. Hotel staff super helpful and the safari guide and driver amazing. A must, if only for one night like us, if you visit Sri Lanka. Unreservedly recommend.
title: A totally unique, collection of luxury "huts" in Yala wildlife park,

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Le camere vicini al ristorante etc a me no che nn abbbiate problemi di deambulazione.
text:
Magica notte asiatica.
Abbiamo passato due splendide notti nelle capanne 17-18-19. Sono le più lontane. Le
Altre sono troppo vicine al ristorante e alla piscina. Isolatevi in queste oasi. Dovete fare almeno due Safari di sera e 1
La mattina. E 1 passeggiata sulla sabbia. Personale
Gentile.
Direttrice altezzosa ma a tratti gentile.
Lo
Staff superbo. Una pausa da godersi
title: La notte asiatica

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: We had the most amazing time at Uga Chena Huts! The resort was beautiful, the food was sensational, and the safari was excellent with a very knowledgeable ranger. We were only able to book for one night, as the resort was at full capacity the following night, but we would have loved to stay longer if we could. The staff were extremely helpful, especially in the restaurant. I would recommend anyone visiting Yala National Park to have the full experience by staying at Uga Chena Huts.
title: A 'Must do' in Yala!!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Remember that nature is unpredictable, you’re never guaranteed animal sightings in the wild so just enjoy the ride!
text:
Absolutely flawless! I can’t fault our stay at all. The hotel is located in a beautiful part of the park with dramatic sea views that the hotels architecture makes the most off. 

The food was some of the best we’ve had at hotels in Sri Lanka.

Rooms are luxurious (the bed is insanely big and comfortable) and feel at one with nature, whilst also doing a good job of keeping the bugs/animals outside and sound proofing against nature! Having a pool right outside was a nice bonus in the heat. 

We visited the spa for massages in between safari rides and the massages were excellent! Definitely recommend a visit to the spa if you can. 

Our safari rides were amazing and we were fortunate enough to see the elephants and leopards! The hotel sends you out in small groups with their extremely knowledgeable rangers who are respectful of our comfort and of the national park and animals. 

Going out on safari with ranger Jabaya was the highlight, you could tell he really cared about the animals and about ensuring we had a good safari. Ultimately it’s all down to luck as to what you will and won’t see but his knowledge of the park and animal behaviours certainty helped us to see some amazing animals. 

The hotel had lots of little touches, like the snacks provided during the safari trips, and the sundowner session (beach front cocktails and canapés before dinner) which really helped to make the stay special. 

If you’re looking for a safari hotel/excursion which balances excellent safari trips, relaxation and luxury then this is undoubtably the hotel for you!
title: Luxury safari perfection!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 2 nights but wish we stayed longer! 

Indhi and her team are fantastic and really added to our experience. Their attention to detail is fab, they knew who you were immediately. I mean everyone. We went to the beach for sundowners and the staff there knew I had an allergy without me saying so and recommended alternatives. 

We had some incredible food. The menu changes every 3/4 days so even on an extended stay you wouldn't get bored. My husband had some particularly good seafood. 

Safari itself was an amazing experience, rangers super knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely ruined me for other safaris as we were spoilt with drinks and snacks as well. The rangers & guides would come and check with you before your drive to ensure you knew what to expect.  Safety precautions were clear, we didn't have any issues and expectations were laid out. Ie we knew what to expect if an elephant did come into the hotel.
title: Incredible

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Completely fabulous experience- everything about this hotel is totally perfect, from the smooth and friendly check-in (even though we were early, the amazing food and drink, the location on the edge of the national park overlooking the crashing waves of the Indian Ocean, to the stunning 'huts'. And that's before you even go on a game drive  where they take care of every detail and use their knowledge, experience and  patience to give you the best possible experience.  Yes, it's expensive but the most incredible experience. Our guide Vibushana and the driver and spotter were just brilliant and were almost as excited as we were to see the leopards they got us to within 20 metres of. Cannot recommend this place, its manager Lisa and all the hardworking and charming staff highly enough.
title: Just perfect in every way....

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The huts are totally safe and secure and you can’t hear anything. But there is wildlife around the huts so you have to stick to the rules.
text:
We were lucky enough to spend 4 nights here with 5 safaris. Everything about our stay was perfect. We feel so privileged to have had the opportunity to have experienced Uga Chena. Firstly every member of staff will do anything to make sure your stay is beyond perfection. There is nothing they wouldn’t do for you. I couldn’t single out anyone as everyone who helped look after my family was just so wonderful. I have to say though our safari guide Jayaba was just the GOAT (my sons word!) and our driver we renamed Lewis Hamilton with  the best hair in Sri Lanka was the absolute best. Our safaris were incredible ….. off the beaten track away from the crowds so we really felt that it was just us in the park. We could see all the wonders of nature in its true beauty. We were truly blessed. 

The food is exceptional. Again nothing is too much trouble. My son has a severe peanut allergy and everyone was so careful which we were so grateful for. The portions were perfectly sized. During the safaris they pack you a selection of yummy snacks and drinks. The banana bread is divine! 

The resort itself is so sympathetically built into its environment with the respect the animals need. The pool area is lovely secluded to not attract any animals with attentive staff ready to bring you a refreshing cocktail. Sundowners on the beach each evening with snacks and more cocktails. 

The safaris take place at 6am and you are usually back for 9:30 to enjoy breakfast. The afternoon safaris take place at 3:15 and you are usually back by 6 for sun downers. Try to embrace all of the nature that Yala has to offer as I was just as guilty of it but if you become fixated on just wanting to see a leopard you will miss how beautiful your surroundings are. 

The huts themselves are spacious and luxurious. UK plugs and voltage. Laundry is included up to 15 items per day. We went in April and it was very warm so light clothing was all we needed. There are ponchos in the safari truck. Khaki coloured clothing is recommended to keep the insects away. Shorts  and a t shirt are fine even in the morning. With trainers. My husband wore flip flops … you don’t get out so you don’t need to wear sensible footwear but if you did need to get out in an emergency the terrain is muddy and uneven.  You can go straight to diner as you are. Or you can change for dinner into something more glam if you prefer. It isn’t formal though. But I did put a dress on two nights! 

Four nights felt like the perfect stay. As the resort is worth experiencing so you can relax. With four / five safaris. Our safaris were totally private which we preferred. The safaris are bumpy but it’s so much fun … And exhilarating. The safari jeeps are covered so you don’t need a hat and it will blow away unless you have string. 

You won’t be disappointed if you choose to stay here. It’s a truly a bucket list all round experience. 

Thank you to everyone who made our stay so memorable.
title: Natural paradise perfection

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay was exceptional, the hotel is great, relax, a super restaurant and a very nice game drive (even tough the Yala these days is very busy and bushes cover most of the animals). Particular thx to waiter Chinthaka that made our stay even more memorable.
title: Exceptional stay

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a two night stay at Uga Chena Huts in Suite 1, with a fantastic view of the Indian Ocean from our large deck and plunge pool. Uga Chena Huts is in an incredible location, beachfront with amazing views of the Indian Ocean from the bar, restaurant and the magical evening sunset bar on the beach.

Service was exceptional in all parts of the resort; check in, meal service, bar service and housekeeping were all of the highest standard with friendly, professional and well trained staff. 

There is a great variety of cocktails, spirits, wine, beer and other beverages available from the all inclusive offering, and we found the meal quality for breakfast, lunch and dinner to be of a high quality, with dietary issues / substitutions no problem at all. 

Our hut was spacious, luxurious and everything was of a high standard. 

We did two safari drives and the vehicle, drivers and guides are great. As Uga Chena Huts is so well run, it was great on a morning safari drive having the ability to drive past the 100 odd safari jeeps lined up to get into Yala National Park and enter the park straight away. 

The great location ensured plenty of animal spotting even from the resort including monkeys and a sloth bear walking across the driveway. The highlight was sitting at the bar in the evening whilst sipping wine and watching a large elephant walk through the resort illuminated by the moonlight. 

We absolutely loved our stay, our only complaint was that we only stayed for two nights and wished we had of stayed longer!
title: Perfection - we did not want to leave!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely perfect, and maybe a little bit more! 🥰 Excellent food. The room is beautiful and clean, the view is amazing, sunrise every day…
title: Lovely place!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! This place is a gem. So much to love. Incredible value for money!
First of all, the warmth of the staff is really special. The smiles, the willingness to help. Mr. Dammika, F&B manager, was on hand to make sure everything was to our liking.  He took such care to chat with and listen to everyone. Superb customer relations. And kudos to the chefs. Gosh; we loved the food. The flavours, the variety, the freshness. Huge shout out to the housekeeping staff: our rooms were so clean and we slept like babies on those beds. Waking up to sunshine and palm fronds at our window was the best!
We've been to a lot of beaches, and this sand is so like silk under your feet...no jaggy rocks. Natural shade provided by the thoughtfully planted trees gave the place a relaxed vibe.
Added extras: an amazing sunset sail on a beautiful Catamaran, and a very romantic beach dinner a deux...the staff went above and beyond. We couldn't fault it. Fresh seafood...beautiful ambience...gorgeous table setting and torch light...excellent service from Kamran.
The GM, Mr. Ruan, should be proud of all his staff. Together, they gave us a memorable and relaxing week. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this wee gem, and can't wait to return.
title: Softest sand, gorgeous food, immaculately clean, value for money

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We enjoyed our stay very much. Lovely spot on the beach. Everything was great; the room, the hotel and beach. Staff was amazing and Mr Dammika was an amazing host for the restaurant. He welcomed us each time we came for buffet and made sure our needs met
title: Hidden Gem in Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Ha sido nuestra mejor estancia en Sri Lanka sin duda. Las habitaciones muy limpias, bonitas y con una cama comodísima. La piscina una pasada y el buffet super bueno y variado. El personal muy atento y amable en especial Codammika Nandasiri, siempre pendiente y con una sonrisa. En conclusión: una maravilla de hotel.
title: Perfecto

text: Service is the best. Fixed our sink in a minute and were so kind. Definetly the fastest service I’ve ever experienced !!!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka

Food is excellent especially the sea food and as someone who is lactose intolerant they brilliantly adapted the menu without missing the highlights.
Overall a great way to unwind and relax after touring.

text: We had an absolutely amazing time at Sunrise Pasikuda celebrating our honeymoon. Everything was perfect - the friendly and attentive staff, the exceptionally clean rooms (and clever towel art!), the incredibly tasty food and superb cocktails, the brilliant amenities, the gorgeous pool, and let's not forget the most beautiful beach! We really were blown away by this place. A real highlight was the romantic dinner on the beach at night. Staff put so much effort into making the area beautiful and romantic, and the food was really exceptional. Thank you again, from Kirsty and David.

text: Un hôtel incroyable, superbe piscine, et accès direct à la plage privée de l'hôtel. Les chambres sont spacieuses et les lits confortables. J'ai adoré mon séjour dans cet hôtel. Le personnel est serviable et très accueillant, très souriant et aux petits soins pour les clients

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Everything has been perfect; the staff was super attentive.
The facilities are excellent. 
Everybody was very kind, specially the Maître of the restaurant who makes you feel warmly welcomed. The food was excellent. A nearly private beach looks like paradise.
title: Perfect in every way.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a fantastic stay at Sunrise in Pasikuda! The hotel is located directly on a beautiful, quiet beach with soft sand and shallow, clear waters – perfect for swimming and relaxing.

Our room was spacious, clean, and had a stunning view of the ocean. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked perfectly, which was much appreciated in the tropical heat.

The highlight of our stay was definitely the friendly and attentive staff. Everyone – from the reception to the restaurant team – went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Special thanks to the chef for the delicious Sri Lankan meals, especially the fresh seafood!

The pool area was clean and well-maintained, and we loved enjoying drinks while watching the sunset.

If you’re looking for a peaceful getaway with warm hospitality and a breathtaking beach, this is the place to be.
title: Good

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We had such a lovely stay at Sunrise, we cannot fault any part of our stay. Each member of staff was extremely polite and friendly. They really made us feel welcome and would always ensure everything was perfect. 

The facilities were brilliant. An incredibly large pool, located on the beach front, rooms cleaned daily with top ups of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion etc and delicious food!! We also made use of the pool table and the gym.
title: Highly recommend! One of my favourite hotels!

placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
Outstanding Service and Memorable Experience

Our stay at The Argyle - Luxury Boutique Hotel was truly exceptional. From start to finish, their service was on a top-class level.

Even the day before our arrival, they called to update us about the weather conditions and the road situation near the hotel, which we really appreciated. It showed how much they care about their guests’ comfort and safety before they even arrive.

On the day we checked in, we received a warm welcome and were treated to a fresh, high-standard cinnamon tea that was perfect for helping us relax after our journey.

As we were guided to our room, the staff kindly explained where to find the restaurants and other services in the hotel. Once inside, they took the time to show us all the amenities in the room and how to request room service. Our room was beautifully decorated, adding a special touch to our stay.

The food was some of the most delicious we have tried anywhere—nicely presented and full of flavor. I would honestly give the food 10/10. There were so many different selections and styles to choose from.

Throughout our stay, the staff were always friendly, polite, and happy to talk with guests, making us feel genuinely welcome.

On checkout day, they surprised us with a lovely tea gift and a warm goodbye, which was such a thoughtful gesture.

This was easily one of the top 10 hotel experiences I have had in Sri Lanka. I truly hope the CEO and the whole team continue this wonderful standard of service in the future. Highly recommended!
title: Warm Hospitality and 5-Star Comfort at The Argyle
