roomTip: Book a room with a balcony for the views
text:
This was my second stay at The Argyle – Luxury Boutique Hotel, and once again, it was nothing short of exceptional. 

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with the same warmth and elegance that made me fall in love with the hotel the first time.
My room was spacious, spotlessly clean, and beautifully styled.

The staff deserve special praise for their genuine hospitality and attentiveness. They remembered my previous visit, which made me feel especially welcomed and valued. A special mention goes to the incredibly thoughtful staff. We were initially assigned an upper-floor room, but when they noticed that my father was having difficulty with the stairs, they promptly offered us a room on the ground floor without any hesitation. That level of attentiveness and care truly stood out and made our stay all the more comfortable.

On top of that, they surprised my sister with a lovely birthday gift during our stay, which was such a sweet and unexpected gesture. It made her day extra special and showed how the team at The Argyle goes above and beyond for their guests.

Dining was another highlight. Every meal was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. 

It’s rare to find a hotel that maintains its charm and service quality so consistently and even improves with each visit. I’m already looking forward to returning.
title: Even Better the Second Time – Thoughtful Service & Peaceful Luxury

placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Argyle, where do we start…. 

This was our 4th hotel in our tour of Sri Lanka. The Argyle is absolute luxury hidden in the tea plantations surrounded by fantastic scenery. 

Upon arrival we were greeted by the really friendly & helpful staff. We were showed to our rooms which were modern & immaculately presented. 

The pool area was modern, clean & the poolside staff were on hand to provide us with towels when we arrived. 

Food was a mix of buffet/table service, both were great. 

Part of our stay included “high tea” this was basically afternoon tea, it was amazing. Endless cups of local tea & great food with an amazing backdrop! 

If you have time, there is a great hiking trail of around 10k which loops around the local area. Well signposted. 

We were sad to leave the Argyle & it’ll be a hotel never to forget. The staff all came out & waved us off! A lovely little gesture. 

10/10 for the Argyle! Thank you to all the amazing staff who made our stay a great one.
title: Stunning Hotel, Amazing Location.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Greetings from Luxury Highland Haven!

Thank you very much for the detailed feedback of your stay at The Argyle. The hotel does offer a truly unique experience and it is quite easy to fall in love with it. I am truly grateful for your kind comments and it is rewarding to know that your stay with us was a memorable experience.

On behalf of the Management.
placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at The Argyle, Hatton purely on the recommendation of our travel agent, Explore Vacations. All we asked for was an offbeat hill resort — and what a gem they found! We went in without reading a single review, and what unfolded was a truly unexpected and unforgettable experience.

Hatton itself is serene and untouched, but The Argyle elevates that charm to something magical. This resort isn’t built just with bricks and cement — it’s built with heart. The people here are what make it extraordinary. Every staff member, from the front desk to housekeeping, radiates warmth. Their motto, “to exceed expectations,” isn’t just a phrase — it’s a lived reality. Every interaction felt personal, every smile genuine.

We stayed in the Campbell Suite 444, hands down the best room in the house, with a breathtaking view of Adam’s Peak right from the bed. The wind howling through the hills at night adds a rustic symphony to your stay — a reminder that you're deep in nature, away from the noise of the world.

Our kids loved the warm pool, and we all swam in the rain and mist, wrapped in the chill of Hatton’s weather but embraced by the pool’s comforting heat. To top it off, the team surprised our son with a birthday cake — a beautiful, thoughtful gesture.
The rooms are spacious, well-maintained, and designed with taste and comfort. Every little detail is taken care of.

And here’s our kids’ verdict —
Place: 11/10 | Room: 11/10 | Service: 15/10 | Food: 10/10 | Staff: 20/10
(Yes, those are real scores from two very happy little travelers!)

If you’re looking for peace, comfort, luxury, and a soul-soothing experience in the middle of nowhere — this is the place. We left The Argyle with full hearts and memories to last a lifetime.

Highly recommended.
— Prakash & Family
(May 2025)
title: A Hidden Gem in Hatton – A Truly Soulful Stay

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We are the family of five who it appeare so preoccupied the delightful Katie, see review below. Luckily for us, we did not notice her.

Contrary to her description, we had a blissful time relaxing at W15 (occupying 2 rooms for 4 nights, I expect that's why children are welcome as well as couples who seemed to stay for only 1 or 2 nights only). We would highly recommend the hotel to couples or families. It feels like a home away from home in the most beautiful surroundings.

All the staff were delightful, and very kind to the children. Sherriff and Hastha were always ready to help and arrange wonderful activities. We also appreciated the turn down service and the lovely housekeeping staff.

The hotel has two expert naturalists, Banuka and Anju. We were really impressed by their knowledge and professionalism. They took us on a nature walk and also a hike. They were highly engaging and made the activities lots of fun and interesting for the children who otherwise could have got bored or tired in the heat.

The hotel location is perfect- very close to Kandy for visiting the city and also in the most beautiful and serene setting in the mountains, with spectacular views and immaculately kept grounds.

The design and interiors of the house are also stunning and very comfortable. We loved sitting on the wrap around veranda,  playing board games in the library and lounge, swimming in the pool and playing croquet on the lawn.
title: Serene, immaculate and welcoming

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Katie-louiseA, 

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughtful and honest feedback. We're truly delighted to hear that you enjoyed the beautiful views, your room, and the warm hospitality from Sheriff, Prabod, Hastha, and Navod—they’ll be so happy to know they made a positive impact on your stay.

We also truly appreciate your suggestions for improvement. Your feedback about meal planning is completely understandable, and we’ll definitely take it into account as we work on creating a more flexible and relaxed dining experience. Regarding the atmosphere and the presence of young children, we hear your concerns and recognize how important peace and tranquility are to many of our guests. While we do welcome guests of all ages, we will certainly consider how we can better preserve the serene environment that so many of our guests come to enjoy.

Thank you again for your kind words and for helping us grow. We're so pleased you enjoyed your time with us overall, and we hope to welcome you back in the future for an even more perfect stay.

Warm regards, 
Team W15 Hanthana Estate
placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
The stand out here would be the views and the staff, the staff absolutely cannot do enough for you, and you are made to feel incredibly welcome from start to finish. Our room and the property were beautiful, and the explanation of the excursions and dining was excellent. We were served by Sheriff, Prabod, Hastha and Navod who were wonderful. 

Just a couple of minor things I would change if possible:

- ordering food straight after a meal for the next meal is difficult, I found myself worrying I wasn’t hungry enough etc. I understand the need for this, but I couldn’t face the food I’d ordered for the time we’d requested both evenings and went to bed very full and a little uncomfortable. It would be nice to be able to choose later, or have a more casual approach to this.

- The property isn’t adult only, and in my opinion, should be. A family with 3 children were there when we were, and they were constantly shouting, screaming and running around. The property is very small and intimate, so it isn’t really possible to remove yourself, and it completely spoils the atmosphere. I was loving hearing the natural sounds and watching the view, and swimming in complete bliss. All of this was ruined once the children descended. We were having a lovely morning at the pool, but this was ruined when the family landed and the children were repeatedly jumping in and out, splashing and screaming. We therefore moved to the lawn but would have really liked the option to swim to cool down. Our room had a private part of the veranda which was wonderful and we dined there each evening; however the children kept running past really close to us somewhat spoiling it, and it didn’t feel private with them constantly staring at us. Fortunately a thunder storm came and sent them indoors. The parents seemed on edge the whole time, and I don’t know what was worse, hearing the children or the parents constantly berating them for being children. It would be easier all round if there was an age limit.

That being said, it’s a beautiful property and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Another thanks to the staff who were absolutely incredible.
title: Great, just a couple of minor tweaks would make it perfection in my opinion

text: Nous y avons séjourné 4 nuits à Tientsin en famille (2 adultes et 2 enfants: 7 et 11ans) dans le cadre d'un séjour sur 3 Relais Châteaux (Ceylon Tea Trails, Wild Coast Tented Lodge et Cape Weligama). Le service est irréprochable et les attentions quotidiennes. Un remerciement plus particulièrement à Nesa pour son professionnalisme et sa bienveillance. Les repas sont délicieux et adaptés pour les enfants. Le lieu est reposant. Nous avons visité la manufacture de thé (un petit bémol car la visite est exclusivement en anglais et un audio guide serait un plus). Nous avons fait une randonnée dans les plantations de thé de un peu plus 5Km...magnifique. Vous trouvez également sur place un salon, une piscine avec jacuzzi, un jeu de croquet, des jeux de société, un terrain de tennis. Les chambres sont spacieuse et la décoration raffinée. En résumé, à faire absolument!
title: Pour se sentir comme à la maison!

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Every superlative you’ve read about this hotel is true. It’s fantastic! Nothing, but nothing, is too much trouble. The food was great. The welcome generous. The atmosphere so peaceful. The only warning, if you plan to get there by road it’s a long, bumpy journey. Worth it when you get there though. If it’s an option for you consider going by float-plane.
title: A piece of heaven in the hills

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the Summerville bungalow- a fantastic location having a terraced garden with magnificent views of the lake. Service from the staff led by San was impeccable and all the staff were so friendly.  The food was amazing, with the chef discussing in advance what we would like for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

We enjoyed a visit to a tea factory, and hiked a couple of trails through the tea plantations.   We also arranged to have lunch at the Norwood bungalow (transport provided) following a hike there.

Thanks to all the staff for a fantastic time.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
- to be caught in the rain. 

Castlereigh bungalow has only 5 rooms so the atmosphere is one of a house party. The tall figure from Birmingham, the military man, the Belgian lyricist (or is he a detective), the motorcyclist with a ponytail  make quite a cast.  All of us in a bungalow built in 1925 with a vibe of the 20s, 30s and 40s inside. The bedrooms without AC but a fan is enough at the altitude of the tea plantation. 
It really is all inclusive with a first class chef and staff, Singh stands out as really knowing his profession. If you stayed for 6 days as we did you could easily leave with a Michelin man physique.  Food is Sri Lankan or European as you wish and jolly good. 
There is a pool and the pretty garden is well looked after.  We went to 3 of the other 4 bungalows and our second choice would be Teitsen. Castlereigh though seemed the most authentic and comfortable. 

Let the rain pitter patter
But it really doesn’t matter
If the skies are grey 
Long as  I can be with you 
It’s a lovely day
title: Isn’t this a lovely day -

text: A beautiful experience like no other, Ceylon Tea Trails feels out of this world. Set in breathtaking surroundings amongst the working tea plantations we loved drinking and learning a lot about tea, and the plantation history. The beautiful restored bungalows are a snapshot back in time, which now set out to educate about the past, while also celebrating the rich nature and heritage of Sri Lanka. Food and service is impeccable, personal, and everyone there made it feel liked a serene home away from home. Even travelling with two little boys, we still felt peaceful and rested here! We tried to soak up every single moment of our truly special time here. Thank you again to the wonderful staff for making it such a special trip.
title: A bucket list destination

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
If you want to experience what was Tea planters’life , go to Ceylon Tea Trails. We spent 2 nights at the Summerville cottage, in the Master suite. Beautiful suite, british colonial style with a Private garden where we had our breakfast. There are only 5 rooms in each cottage which guarantee you calm and opportunity to meet with extraordinary people. Thanks to Richard (from DC) we enjoyed havina drink all together. From the cottage as well as from the pool, you have a beautiful panorama : Castlereagh lake and Tea plantations. Service is amazing. You can visit the Tea plantation & The Tea factory with a guide, former Tea tester with more that 30’s years of expertise. We also had a fantastic « pique-nique » organised  by our personal butler: Lunch was prepared by the chief using the tiffins box. 
Just unique & special !
title: Unique & Spécial dans in Ceylon Tea Trails - Summerville cottage

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for your feedback on your stay with us. We truly appreciate your valuable insights and feedback as we are constantly striving to improve our special blend of hospitality. 

We are delighted you had a wonderful 'walking holiday' with us and that you enjoyed the hikes with Dhanushka.

Each of your constructive comments have been actioned for immediate improvement. We have also shared your positive feedback with the team and thanked them on your behalf.

We look forward to welcoming you again in the future!
placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The laundry service is fabulous!
text:
Several people ( including a travel agent) told us that a 5 day stay at Ceylon Tea Trails would be too long. In fact we stayed for 6 nights and could happily have stayed even longer. I do appreciate that many people stop here on a tour of Sri Lanka, but I can also highly recommend it as a destination in its own right. We have been to Sri Lanka several times before and booked the 6 night walking package at CTT before moving to the coast for 5 nights. I booked directly with the company, which was very easy: they arranged car transfers from the airport and onward to Tangalle. If you are pushed for time and/ or happy to spend the extra, I would recommend trying the float plane as it would have saved us a lot of time, especially on the journey to the coast, which took about 6 hours.
The walking package gives you 3 nights in one bungalow then 3 nights in another ( in our case Castlereagh and Norwood), but we visited all the properties. The bungalows are all lovely, and staff are delightful.
The thing that really made the holiday for us was Dhanushka, our walking guide. We had him with us for three out of the six days. The first walk he took us on was probably the easiest- we walked from Castlereagh to Norwood (had lunch there) and walked back a different route. He took us on a wonderful walk from Castlereagh to Somerville (4 hours - we had a picnic lunch en route) - the distance between these two bungalows is not far but we walked a long way round, avoiding the road completely other than crossing the dam, and walking up high on the ridge. Beautiful views and very quiet. The last of the three was from Norwood to Tientsin ( 4 hours) - we took a packed breakfast and had lunch at Tientsin. Dhanushka showed us routes that we would have struggled to find on our own and was great company- he was also good at spotting wildlife etc. The walks are fairly easy with some decent hills . Trainers or walking shoes are fine. We really loved the walking and saw few people other than tea pickers and the occasional group of children playing cricket. We also had a tea tour with Bernard (highly recommended) and a planters lunch, which was lovely. We also got a heavenly foot massage after each walk, which was wonderful.
The bungalows themselves are spacious and well appointed. Food varied from good to outstanding , though the packed breakfasts/ lunches could have been a bit more exciting.
Things to know
It’s useful to have a small day pack for walking (D carried water and food for me, but it’s handy to have somewhere for sunscreen, lip balm, camera etc) and I would recommend taking swim suits so you can have a dip when you arrive at your destination.
Take light weight clothing for walking which dries quickly- I wore t shirts with a long sleeved linen shirt which was fine, or sportswear. 
If you can face carrying them, binoculars would be great to have too.
The bungalows tend to be very sociable with everyone gathering for drinks before dinner etc. we enjoyed meeting a lot of interesting people.
You can borrow leech socks, but unless it’s damp, they are not really necessary.
Service varied between the bungalows. It’s not always as polished as it could be. 
If you want anything booking, it’s worth being very specific and what you want and when. The day we moved to Norwood, we had requested a foot massage on arrival, but it was never booked because they weren't sure what time we were arriving. It was sorted out in the end, but it did show a staggering lack of initiative given that we were with D all day and so easily contactable. That would really be my only gripe in an otherwise fabulous stay.
title: Wonderful Walking holiday

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s a beautiful journey from Hatton to Ella on the train, but reserve in advance to get a seat!
text: This is without doubt one of the most incredible places I have ever stayed and likely ever will stay. The location was truly stunning - pictures do not do it justice - and the service was outstanding. From fresh tea as soon as you wake up, to delicious afternoon teas with scones by the lake, incredible quality meals and fantastic pools/ trails, Ceylon is a masterpiece. We are already hoping to come back. A special shout out to Janaka and the team at Castlereagh bungalow who went above and beyond to make our honeymoon so special!
title: Simply incredible

roomTip: Make sure you try the Afternoon Tea.
text:
Ceylon Tea Trails 

This review cannot possibly do justice to the Ceylon Tea Trail bungalows. 

We stayed at the Ceylon tea trails bungalows for four nights. Norwood for two nights and two nights at the Dunkeld bungalow

The Norwood Bungalow was exquisite. The opulence is everywhere. If you want to be spoilt this is the place for you. Stupidity I didn’t get the names of the staff but they were excellent from the workers behind the scenes to the butler and the waiting staff. The chef produces food that is fabulous. Try the afternoon tea it’s brilliant. 

Our days at the Dunkeld bungalow were very different than Norwood but again 5 star. Our butler and waiter (Krishna and Samantha) were excellent a special mention has to be made to the chef Ravi at Dunkeld. The food he produced was unbelievable. Ravi cooked us a BBQ on our last night. It could have fed 20 people. The food was extraordinarily fabulous. Just far far too much 😂

Overall impressions of the Ceylon tea trails the best travel experience of my life. If you do go make such you take the opportunity to go for a trek. The walk is not far and it’s at a leisurely pace. Our guide Kith showed us many species of birds which we would never have seen had we been on our own. We have travelled a lot over the years this accommodation was probably the best we have stayed at.

we also walked to the Castlereigh bungalow as well. This accommodation was definitely at the same standard as Dunkeld and Norwood. 

I would thoroughly recommend these bungalows.
title: Bungalows at the Ceylon Tea Trails

roomTip: Each bungalow is unique - we had a beautiful garden, pool, tennis court and croquet
text:
This has to be the most idyllic place to stay in Sri Lanka - from the moment we arrived until the time we had to leave, we were in paradise!

We stayed at Tientsin and we were immediately made to feel this was our 'home' by the Butler, Ajith.  He has incredible knowledge and experience in the Bungalows and was always able to find solutions to any challenges we made.

Staying at Tientsin, our lives had a gentle pace punctuated regularly by Chef Goshitha coming to tempt us with the delicacies what would be our next meal.  Again, nothing was too much for him and Niwantha and our every wish was accommodated - whether we chose to eat his suggestions, or wanted something different.  And when the food arrived - the presentation and the tastes were simply divine.

The whole visible team included 3 further 'house staff' (don't wish to offend) Chandrasuriya, Vije and Kesavan who's job descriptions must have been to make life perfect for us - which they achieved and more!  Chandrasuriya was there in the morning serving tea and coffee in our room, and mixing cocktails in the drawing room at night.  Always a joy to see his friendly face. And all 3 of these men appeared to work effortlessly as a team whether it was cleaning rooms or serving Afternoon Tea - you truly need to be walking the tea trails regularly to be able to eat all of the delicious things on offer!

As a group of 8, we must have been quite a challenge to the team, but 'no' didn't appear in anyone's vocabularies!  We can't begin to thank you all enough for the wonderful experience we have had in Sri Lanka.
title: Paradise in tea country

It was our third stay at the Ceylon Tea Trails. This time Tientsin bungalow for five nights. The bungalow has a most beautiful flower garden. It is an “All inclusive" concept at the highest level.
We were particularly impressed by the great people who spoiled us every day. Ajith and his team (Chandra, Priya, Chamara, Prakash) were magical – first-class service at its best. The daily chats with the Chef were so caring, the food was presented tailor-made, so tastefully and lovingly. Our suite (Bretherton) has a private garden, surrounded by birds and green scenery with the tea hills blew us away.
If you seek serenity and the perfect place to unwind in the most beautiful scenery: this is most definitely the place for you.
We will be back! Thank you for this warm hospitality. AMAZING!!

text:
Dear Anantara Peace Haven Team,

There are places you visit... and then there are places that live on in your heart long after the journey ends. My stay at Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle was, without a doubt, one of the latter—a soul-soothing, heartwarming experience that lingered well beyond the check-out date.

Please forgive the delay in sending this note; due to the whirlwind of a demanding schedule, I was unable to share my reflections sooner. Yet not a single day has passed without fond memories rising gently to the surface—the sound of waves echoing through the palms, the taste of spice-laced southern cuisine, and the unforgettable warmth of your team’s hospitality.

From the very first moment I arrived, I was enveloped in a sense of serenity and grace. The resort didn’t just meet expectations—it quietly, elegantly redefined them. There’s a rare kind of magic at Anantara Peace Haven—one that lies not only in its sweeping views of the Indian Ocean or its lush, fragrant gardens, but in its people. It is your team that turns luxury into something profoundly human.

I must extend my deepest gratitude and appreciation to Ms. Thisari Nawoda, whose leadership and attentiveness infused every element of my stay. Ms. Thisari is not only a consummate professional but also a true ambassador of Sri Lankan hospitality. Her ability to anticipate needs, resolve requests with poise, and engage guests with genuine warmth is a gift few possess. It was clear to me that she doesn't just manage a resort—she nurtures an experience. Her quiet presence seemed to ripple through the team, creating an atmosphere of calm attentiveness and joy.

To the incredible staff, whose names I wish I had written down one by one, you each made me feel as though I were the only guest on the property. From the gentle housekeepers who maintained my villa with care and respect, to the smiling faces at breakfast who remembered my coffee preferences without being told twice, every detail felt personal. Not scripted, not rehearsed—real.

What truly stood out was the flexibility and thoughtfulness offered during my stay. Despite arriving with a somewhat unpredictable schedule and changing needs, your team never once made me feel like an inconvenience. Whether it was adapting meal times, arranging transport at odd hours, or simply offering a quiet space for me to catch my breath, your collective grace was unwavering.

The villa itself—an oasis of comfort—was designed not just to impress, but to restore. The harmony between refined architecture and natural beauty created a space that felt both elevated and grounding. Every sunrise I watched from that private terrace was like a quiet promise that all would be well.

And the cuisine... what a journey that was! Each meal was a celebration—vibrant, soulful, rooted in the local soil yet layered with creativity. Your chefs are not merely cooks; they are storytellers, serving chapters of southern Sri Lanka on every plate. I felt nourished not only in body, but in spirit.

As I look back, what touches me most is that Anantara Peace Haven never tried to “impress” in the way many luxury resorts often do. Instead, you chose to connect—to the guest, to the land, to the moment. And that is where your true magic lies.

Please accept my sincerest thanks, not just for the unforgettable stay, but for the way you made me feel—seen, cared for, and at peace.

To Ms. Thisari Nawoda and every team member whose efforts made my stay so special, thank you. I carry your kindness with me.
title: A Long Overdue Note of Heartfelt Gratitude

Ayubowan from Anantara Tangalle, Sri Lanka! 
Thank you for taking the time to share such a beautifully detailed review of your stay with us at our resort in Sri Lanka.
We're thrilled to hear you had a magical four-day escape and that you enjoyed everything from the luxurious rooms to the personalized service. Kaush will be delighted to know that his attentiveness made your experience seamless and relaxing.
It's wonderful that your family enjoyed the nature walk with Rashmi—she truly has a gift for bringing the natural beauty of our resort to life, especially for our younger guests. We're also glad the lagoon boat ride left a lasting impression!
Your kind words truly mean a lot to our team. We hope to welcome you and your family back to your own peacock haven Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle in Sri Lanka again very soon.
Kind regards, 
Erik Billgren – General Manager
placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: During the monsoon the sea is too rough to swim into but there are plenty of other activities to keep you busy
text:
We had a wonderful four day break here, it is a beautiful resort on what used to be a coconut plantation. The rooms are luxurious and well taken care of. The resort assigns you a personal butler who manages all orders and bookings for you which we found extremely convenient. We were assigned Kaush, who was on top of everything whether it was food orders or safari bookings. 

There are a host of activities throughout the day which are complimentary and one of the best experiences was the morning nature walk with Rashmi; a marine biologist who does discovery tours working with the resort. She guided us through all the flora and fauna and had our six year old fascinated throughout. 

There is a lagoon snaking through the resort which you can boat ride on, which was also magical. The views are incredible and the whole experience was unforgettable for us.
title: Peacock haven

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Plan your experiences beforehand as they are all private and there are only so many guides.
text: We had an amazing stay in Ulagalla. From the beautiful rooms with swimming pool, to the wonderful team and very tasty food. A shout out to the Kamatha dining experience (please don't have any lunch because it's a lot of food) and the scenic drive throught the village nearby. Thank you for having us!
title: Amazing stay in Ulagalla

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Uk sockets, good wifi,
text:
A beautiful, pristine property in a peaceful tranquil setting, wonderful warm friendly staff for whom nothing was too much trouble.
Dimuthu, the GM, has created a great culture, they all respect him and admire his hands on approach and preparedness to pass on his knowledge of the industry.
The food, both the western & local cuisine, was of a very high standard and well presented under the watchful eye of the hardworking F&B manager.
We enjoyed a feast at the Kamatha restaurant, delicious curries prepared and served by Diluka, Manel & Eranda.
Erlanda’s signiture cocktails are a must too.
The Villa was spacious, private & well appointed. Buggies were always available and punctual.
Our expectations were exceeded.
title: A Sri Lankan Gem

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is absolutely fabulous, all the staff were extremely welcoming on our arrival, Villa just perfect, felt so private on our pool terrace and really felt like we were immersed in nature. Monkeys and Peacocks wandering the grounds were wonderful to watch. 

The bicycles were a great touch and made it easy to get around. Food exceptional with a wide variety of choices on the menu.

We were very lucky to experience a rice paddy cutting ceremony when we were there which was so authentic, we also really enjoyed our kamatha dining experience - a real sample of traditional Sri Lankan cooking. 

Finally we went on a safari from the hotel to Wilpattu national park - a must do activity if you have time - we were able to see so many different types of bird and other wildlife species including elephants and it felt much quieter than some of the other national parks we went to later on in the holiday. 

We would highly recommend this hotel, ideally located to see some of the top cultural sites as well as national parks, and the hotel is even more beautiful and peaceful than the photos show, you will not be disappointed by a stay here!
title: A Tranquil Paradise close to National Parks and top cultural sites

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our 3rd visit to Uga Ulagalla and this time we highly noted the big difference with overall involvement of the General Manager Dimuthu.
The staff was warm, attentive and provided an excellent service throughout our stay.
Kamatha dining experience was on another level with scrumptious authentic Sri Lankan dishes and outstanding service.
All in all, we had an amazing stay.
Thank you all 🙏.
title: Amazing Stay in Uga Ulagalla

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Room was out of this world, basically a suite with it's own private plunge pool.  The property is large so they offer buggies to collect and deliver you to your room but really it's not necessary as it's only a 10 minute walk to the resort centre where there is a bar, restaurant and a huge pool.  We had the Kamatha meal one night which is their take on a traditional village celebration meal - I've never seen such  a variety of dishes and all very tasty.
If I'm honest I'm not sure the restaurant lived up to the rest of the resort but overall a great experience.
title: Great rooms

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our first stop on our 2 week travel through Sri Lanka. We loved our stay in the pool villa unit. The room and property were beautifully designed. The main house was lovely and welcoming to sit in for cocktails (the cocktails were great!).

The grounds were allowed a close view of rice harvesting and had many animals and birds to view. 

The main pool was large and could accommodate guests without ever feeling crowded. 

The food was delicious, especially the soups. Staff offered to share the recipes, but I unfortunately forgot to get upon leaving. 

Getting a glimpse of and chatting with staff about the resident cats was also a highlight.

My only regret is that we didn’t stay longer.
title: Beautiful Luxury in the heart of the Cultural Triangle

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful hotel in beautiful surroundings. The suites are spacious, tastefully decorated and very private. This can mean a bit of a walk to the ‘hub’ but it’s a lovely one (lit at night) and buggies and bikes are available. The staff are attentive and friendly. It’s a great base for visiting the temples and wildlife parks in the region. We only had 2 nights but could have stayed longer.
title: Superb boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: My husband and I visited this hotel as part of our honeymoon travelling Sri Lanka and it was a wonderful stop off. We loved our private plunge pool, the beautiful nature of the grounds and the proximity to lots of activity areas. The staff were wonderful and couldn’t have done more for us. Kusal in particular was incredibly helpful and kind. We also very much enjoyed the dining experience in the paddy field and the two sister chefs were absolutely wonderful. Their food and hospitality were brilliant. Thanks for the great memories!
title: Honeymoon stay

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take your time to enjoy the hotel and its facilities
text:
We arrived to this paradise in a rainy day and yet the place was so warm full and cozy. We loved the villas, the swimming pool, the main building, the outdoors were magical.
The staff was fantastic and we loved how Kusai took care of our journey, always attentive to our schedule so we could have the best experience ever.
We are definetly coming back !
title: Amazing restful place. Great great staff

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
The ritual welcome of lighting the lamp and ringing the bell at the entry was a lovely way to begin our stay here. We had a beautiful suite of very spacious, superbly furnished rooms in a villa right on the outer edge of the estate with views over paddy fields from our terrace and pool. The staff are lovely, all very friendly and helpful. The buggies that ferry you around the place were always quick to arrive.

A horse ride one morning around the estate and out to the lake and village was wonderful, a gentle walk on Rolex, a lovely horse who likes his palm leaves!

Very varied selection of food on offer for lunch and dinner, over the course of a couple of days our choices included meaty prawns, though a little light on taste; good pork ribs, though a little fatty, and the pak choi they were served with was inedible - very stringy; reasonable fillet steak; very good fish, prawn and squid tempura with a dressed salad.

The Elephant Research Centre does extremely good work with the local communities including the children, promoting their understanding and tolerance of the elephants in the area.
title: Wonderful hotel

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Très bon accueil, très bel endroit 
Service long au restaurant 
Devrait prévenir de ne pas laisser la porte de la terrasse de la chambre ouverte par rapport aux singes, agréable d’être en pleine nature avec le chant des oiseaux 
Belle expérience safari en fin de journée au milieu des rizières
title: Belle expérience

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Ein unglaublich schönes Tropenresort, perfekter Service, super Essen, extrem saubere und komfortable Privatvillen, zahlreiche Tiere (Affen) auf dem Gelände. Nicht schöner vorstellbar - ein Paradies.

Super freundlicher Fahrer des lokalen E Buggy Servicel auf dem Gelönde (Kusal)
title: Exzellent

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Aiya Ulagalla, and it exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I arrived, the staff was warm, welcoming, and attentive. The check-in process was smooth, and my room was immaculate, spacious, and beautifully designed.
I highly recommend Uga Ulagalla for anyone looking for comfort, luxury, and excellent hospitality. I look forward to my next stay.
title: Excellent Stay with Outstanding Service

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Loved villa # 1! Very close to everything. Definitely reserve dinner at Kamatha!
text:
We started our Sri Lankan holiday staying here and could not have been more impressed with our welcome, the staff, the attentiveness of the service, the facilities, activities, food and our gorgeous villa. 

Everyone we encountered here went above and beyond to be helpful. In particular, my dietary restrictions were significant and were expertly handled by the management, chef and kitchen. Beautiful gluten free bread and muffins and food prepared with no onion and garlic. A HUGE THANK YOU! We did dine at Kamatha and Diluka prepared a Sri Lankan feast according to my restrictions- and it was spectacular! That was a true highlight of our trip!! 

Our room was #1, which was hugely convenient as we could easily walk to meals and the pool. The villa was enormous and beautifully appointed!!! Also, everything seemed new! We did relax around the pool a few times- often just a few people there. And such a relaxing setting. 

We did take the guided bicycle ride through the village - hugely fun and insightful. The setting of this resort is just beautiful!! And close enough for day tours. 

We loved our time at Uga Ulagalla and were sad to leave. It is a first class resort in a beautiful location with a staff that is really a credit to its brand. We were very grateful for all they did to make our stay so wonderful!
title: An absolutely 5 Star resort

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons passé 3 jours merveilleux pour notre lune de miel dans notre villa avec piscine, idéal pour un séjour en amoureux. 
Lors de notre dernière soirée nous avons eu la surprise d’avoir une table dressée au bord de la piscine, super romantique. Un grand merci à notre serveur Ravindu qui a pris soin de nous toute la soirée. 
Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel, tout y est parfait avec un service exceptionnel.
title: Une lune de miel exceptionnelle !

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: We had an incredible dining experience at the Kamatha Restaurant, and served by an amazing and delightful staff of Diluka, Manel, Dilshan, and Eranda. If you want authentic food and a unique venue, this is it. They prepared 25 different dishes. Don’t miss this opportunity!
title: Amazing Authentic Sri Lankan Cuisine and Unique Experience!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Kamatha dinning experience with Diluki was exceptional. Resembles home cooked food with so many flavours, the pumpkin curry and lamb curry are a few stand outs, the kiri hodi with string hopper and pol sambal bar far the best I have tasted at any resort/hotel in Sri Lanka plus the other 12 dishes we sampled while Diluki talked us through the cooking process. Amazing I would give 10 stars if possible.
title: Kamatha dinning experience with Diluki was exceptional.

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Great base to explore Anuradhapura. Hotel itself and location is fantastic but what makes it stand out is it’s incredibly helpful and welcoming staff led by Dilrukshi and her team. The standout event  was the dinner cooked by the sisters Manel and Diluka - a memory we will cherish for ever - 5 stars!
title: Warm, friendly and welcoming hotel. They cannot do enough for you.

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Mit eines der schönsten Hotels in denen ich jemals war. Durch die geringe Anzahl der Zimmer fühlt sich alles sehr persönlich und familiär an. Die gesamte Hotelanlage verbindet exklusiven Komfort mit der naturbelassenen Umwelt und ist sehr gepflegt, wunderschön angelegt und bietet viele Möglichkeiten für Aktivitäten. Das Personal ist durchweg sehr freundlich und geht auf die persönlichen Wünsche der Gäste ein. Das Essen und die Getränke sind von sehr hoher Qualität und bietet für alle Geschmäcker Vorlieben etwas an. Wir haben uns sehr sehr wohl gefühlt und würden jederzeit wiederkommen.
title: Wunderschönes Hotel mit erstklassigem Service

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Uga Ulagalla is a beautiful place with fantastic grounds, we had a lovely time there. The staff are all wonderful and the rooms are truly beautiful, more like small cottages filled with everything you could possibly wish for including a plunge pool. We went for a bike ride around the local area and saw lots of birds. We also enjoyed a nature walk with a naturalist and a drive and picnic. The naturalist was very knowledgeable and great at spotting birds. Ulagalla are passionate about wildlife, especially protecting the elephants, and there is a research station that you can visit to find out more. There is so much that you can do whilst staying at Uga Ulagalla. We really enjoyed the Kamatha experience, 25 Sri Lankan dishes! Special thanks to Diluka and Manel (the chef that prepared all the fab dishes), as well as all the other incredible staff.
title: A beautiful,  tranquil eden

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sleep Quality - 4 such as at the morning we heard signing of the birds)
text: Hello to everybody!  Usually I don't write reviews but this time I have to do it.  I was in this hotel with my mother according to my friend's recomindation. I didn't  mastake choosen this hotel - it's a piece of the paradise in Shri.  Single disadvantage -  distance fron the airoport to the hotel 5-6 hours but we were ready , knew about that and all was comfortable. So, now about positive points - the staff met us friendly with local traditions , we were checked in a nice room at the second floor. Aaaaaall staff are so  kindly, open-minded and service was excellent- in the restarant, on the beach - everywhere we were surrounded by care! Also, I would like to mention Sajeevu, Nissanka, Anura - thank you so much!  Food is tatsty , take the seafood plato on the beach  - it's really nice.  Thank you for all! If you need a relax without night parties and so on - go to this hotel - great place to spend time in silence and privacy. PS. Form Russia (Ekaterinburg) with love!
title: Amazing vacation in Shi

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Es was eines unserer besten Hotels in dem wir bis jetzt waren. Die Freundlichkeit vom Personal war überragend. Vielen Dank gebührt vor allem !!Nimal!! der sich sogar an seiem freien Tag für uns Zeit genommen hat, um für uns eine wichtige Besorgung zu machen. Auch der Ausflug, den wir mit ihm gemacht haben war absolut Top! Die Zimmer wurden jeden Tag zwei mal gereinigt und abends das Bett vorbereitet. Wir hatten noch nie so gutes und abwechslungsreiches Essen!
Alles in allem können wir das Hotel nur weiterempfehlen und freuen uns schon auf ein Wiedersehen.
title: Eines der besten Hotels in dem wir waren!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Vale la pena hacer parada a mitad de la ruta por sri Lanka para venir! tener en cuenta la época.A partir de Abril buen tiempo aquí!
text:
El hotel es espectacular! Es precioso... estuvimos en habitaciones con vista a la playa y era un lujo de comodidad, y de vistas.
La comida es algo increible... El desayuno super completo y agradable y la cena a la carta pero como si fuera un menú degustación con un montón de platos  para ir disfrutando. Un nivel de presentación y de calidad muy alto. Los niños tienen una gran variedad en el menú infantil pero también pueden pedir a la carta de los adultos si lo prefieren. 
El único inconveniente fue  la lentitud en la cena, que tardaban mucho en sacar los platos... pero valía la pena la espera. Cenamos las dos noches al aire libre al lado de la piscina y el ambiente es super agradable. 
La piscina que tienen es preciosa y de tipo infíniti, así que te bañas viendo el mar que lo tienes detrás.... 
Hubo música en vivo (pianista tocando) y el personal super amable todo el tiempo. 
Tienen un chiringuito para comidas, que está mirando al mar y se come muy bien y agradable con la brisa marina... 
La playa muy muy vacía y bonita... la disfrutamos mucho y cogimos padel surf y canoas para divertirnos con los niños. 
Hotel para repetir sin dudar!
title: Hotel espectacular! Remanso de paz como Desconexión en medio viaje Sri Lanka.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed at Uga Bay, Pasikuda and had an incredible experience! The staff was super friendly and really accommodating—from the reception to the restaurant, everyone made us feel so welcome. The food was absolutely delicious, and since my family and I are picky eaters, we really appreciated how flexible they were with our requests. The rooms and washrooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable. We spent a lot of time in the games room playing chess, carrom, table tennis, and even tried out the pool table and other fun games. It was the relaxing, fun-filled vacation I truly needed—Uga Bay exceeded my expectations!
title: Hospitality at Its Best! , The Vacation I Truly Needed

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The SPA prices were similar to the European prices. Which was somehow not necessarily expected but ok, considering the level of the hotel.
text: First of all just a general feedback: amazing, amazing, amazing!!! In details: We have been to Uga Bay for about two and half weeks and enjoyed everything from the beginning to the end of our vacation! It is really a first time in our experience that the personal is listening to any of the client needs fulfilling these and trying to go a kind of extra mile. The hotel area was really clean, the beach and the pool as well (Eg the rooms have been cleaned three times a day). Around hotel and on the beach there was a security who has taken care of the surrounding area ensuring a really good filling of safety forcing not thinking about the things like keeping mobile phone or like unattended. The food (incl. buffet) was really delicious and manifold. During the breakfast or dinner time the chef came to our table and asked for extra wishes of our children subsequently fulfilling these. The ocean water on the beach seemed to be clean. In general according to the several local opinions it is one of the most beautiful bays on Sri Lanka. Eg one day during our vacation the president of Sri Lanka was just swimming there. Dear Uga Bay thank you a lot for that incredible experience.
title: Amazing vacation in the paradise.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Start your day with a snorkel or sea swim!!
text:
Probably the best and most personally curated stay in Sri Lanka we've ever had. We spent two nights here and from being welcomed to leaving, we were looked after like family.

Dasun was our host and he made the stay seamless through simple explanations of how the property works. The dining and drinking experience was next level. Sameera looked after us throughout with Yasas supporting - both of the guys are so attentive that before we asked for anything, it was already done!

Anura looked after us at the main bar and Rakshini made sure she kept our favourite table always available.

Izmath - one of the head chefs came to our table multiple times and made sure the food was to 10-star standard. 

The people here, the staff, that’s what makes this place unique. It’s a location and service you cannot find anywhere else. 

CANNOT recommend this place enough. It is truly magical. If you ever visit Sri Lanka - DO NOT MISS!!
title: The Most Magical Place!!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Very clean, spacious, comfortable and well-appointed rooms. Serene views and calm surroundings. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Superb food service and always ready to accommodate special requests. Clean and spacious beach front with calm and shallow waters with silky sands. Nice beach bar and pool bar with infinity pool overlooking the bay. There is nothing more you can ask for!!
title: Fabulous staycation !!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Excellent hotel on a prime location
text: We had an amazing 2 nights with my family at Hotel Uga Bay Passikudah. Excellent hotel on a prime location. Customer care manager at front desk was very kind & friendly & helpful as well, rest of the staff. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The restaurant excellent service & the food was delicious. The staff were so lovely and welcoming. We look forward to returning in the future.
title: Excellent hotel on a prime location

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: It was an excellent experience as a family vacation at Uga Bay. Rooms were extremely comfortable and luxurious. Food was amazing and the head chef was a nice guy always helping us and offered tasty foods. Staff is very nice and helpful always care about us. I am recommend uga bay as the best stay in Pasikuda.
title: Best place to stay in Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at this hotel from the end of March to the beginning of April for 10 days! Several days we spent on excursions. We really liked the service, the cleaning of the rooms, we went to the massage at the beginning of our stay, the beach is the cleanest on Passikuda, while we walking towards the elephant rocks we saw how dirty it was near other hotels. Our beach in Uga Bay was cleaned every day, the security was watching so that no one left entered our territory. All hotel workers are friendly, they will always wish you a good day or a pleasant dinner, special thanks to the man at the reception (I don’t remember the name) who helped us move to another room when one became available. As for food, we had breakfast included, at the egg station at the entrance the cook cooked a very tasty omelet and rice pita (my love), for dinner I would like more days like the "Buffet", when you choose a variety of dishes and this dessert bananas with chocolate will forever be in your heart. Thank you Uga Bay for our vacation! I recommend it to anyone who wants to get away from the noise, enjoy the clean ocean with small waves, and relax their body.
title: quiet rest

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 3 days at the most amazing property.  It was perfect in every way, except of course that we had to check out.  
Upon arrival we experienced a warm and refreshing welcome.  The rooms are well appointed with everything you need. One of the highlights of the stay was a brilliant experience at each meal time.  Sajeevu, Nisankar, Ismoth, Santha, Rumesh. Shan, Dasun, the talented chefs,  and the F&B team were outstanding!  The beach is perfectly clean, with loungers and towels really.  The green space on the grounds lush tropical and well maintained.
As always the product, service and delivery of the experience starts at the top.  The GM, Neeranjan runs an excellent operation, smooth and efficient.  Thank you for making our stay enjoyable and memorable.  It is now one of my favorite hotels to stay at.
title: AMAZING!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just book it, you won’t regret!
text: Best hotel we have ever stopped in. Location is right on Pasikuda beach which could be compared to Maldives standards. We had a beach studio which was spacious and very comfortable, with a massive bed and seating area, I slept better than I have in years! We had  fantastic views of the sea and beach. Food was outstanding we ate in the restaurant every night, set menu gave lots of options and variety each night, the food was always tasty and high quality! The buffet was only available a couple of nights but both times plenty of choice, delicious and top quality food. We also ate in the beach restaurant most days which was great value for money and food and cocktails delicious! Beach was regularly cleaned so it was immaculate, white sands and clear blue water, ideal for swimming! Pool was spacious and clean and we made good use of this too! The staff are a credit to Uga, there was not one person from the gardeners through to reception staff who wasn’t pleasant and polite, always with a friendly welcome and smile, the service was absolutely outstanding. We have travelled to many different countries and without doubt this stay has stood out above every other and is going to be hard to beat! Thanks to all at Uga Bay for making our stay so special!
title: Just outstanding in every way!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: My wife and I stayed for 9 nights and loved every minute - absolutely fantastic resort. From arrival the staff were so welcoming and friendly, we immediately felt at home. We had an ocean studio room with a balcony and sea view, it was spacious and comfortable. The beach here is also amazing, with a great beach bar for lunch or a drink. Both food and service absolutely top class, with a choice of a buffet or set menu. We have stayed in some very good hoels in the past but were surprised how good the food was here - both Sri Lankan and European. Every single member of staff was fantastic, so attentive and friendly, couldn't fault our stay at all and we will be back - if you are looking for a relaxing beach holiday in Sri Lanka, honestly look no further as I don't think you will do better than Uga Bay!
title: Stunning!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
UGA BAY liegt in der Bucht Passikudah-Beach fernab des Massentourismusses.

Es ist ein tolles Hotel. Das UGA BAY hat einen Traumstrand. Zusätzlich gibt es einen neu renovierten Infinity Pool. Die Zimmer sind groß, sehr sauber und haben Meerblick. Die gesamte Hotelanlage ist sehr gepflegt. Das Essen ist einfach fantastisch.
Das UGA BAY ist für uns etwas ganz Besonderes. Wir erlebten Ruhe und eine Freundlichkeit, die von innen kommt. Es wurde alles dafür getan, dass wir uns richtig wohlfühlen. Alle waren ständig dabei, uns alle Wünsche und Bedürfnisse zu erfüllen. Dieser Service kommt von innen heraus und ist die DNA dieses Hotels. 

Wir haben eine solche Freundlichkeit und einen so tollen Service bislang noch nirgendwo erlebt. Wir hatten einen Traumurlaub!

Eigentlich wollten wir keine Namen nennen und niemanden hervorheben, da wirklich alle einen fantastischen Job gemacht haben. Trotzdem möchten uns wir besonders bedanken bei Pratheep, Munas, Ramani, Nissanka für einen unvergesslichen Service und insbesondere auch bei Lakmal und dem Küchenteam, die uns jeden Tag aufs neue verwöhnt haben.

Trotz aller Superlativen gibt es aber auch einen Punkt, der nicht zum Gesamtbild dieses Hotels passt. Das All Inclusive Paket enthält nur eine sehr eingeschränkte Auswahl von Cocktails, Säften und Softdrinks. Weiter sind Getränke der Minibar kostenpflichtig. Das passt aus unserer Sicht nicht und sollte nachgebessert werden. 

Ganz lieben Dank an das gesamte UGA-BAY-Team !
Wir werden im nächsten Jahr wieder kommen.
title: Abschalten und genießen – Service und Kulinarik auf allerhöchstem Niveau - ruhiges Hotel mit fantastischem Strand

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Uga bay is the jewel in the crown on the east coast of SriLanka. We have just returned from our eighth visit to this fantastic hotel in Passikudah . Uga bay continues to build on its reputation for sustainability and first class service. Each guest is given a warm welcome and can experience bespoke hospitality. From the minute you step through the doors, the team led by GM ensure your stay is exceptional, from the front desk, bar staff, the chefs, waiters, gardeners, maintenance and beach side staff all contribute to a truly wonderful holiday.
title: Uga bay, the jewel in the crown on the east coast of Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Man sollte einen Adapter für verschiedene Länder/Steckdosen mitnehmen.
text:
Das Hotel ist sehr ruhig und sauber. Perfektes Essen, genauso ist das Personal sehr zuvorkommend und Hilfsbereit.
Die Zimmer sind sehr groß und gut ausgestattet.
Der Sandstrand ist auch sehr sauber und flach abfallend. 
Die Massage in der Wellnessabteilung war sehr angenehm,  es wurde sogar nach Allergien und sonstigen Beschwerden gefragt.
title: Ruhiges Tophotel zum relaxen.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Es gibt tatsächlich nichts - direkt anfangen zu genießen !
text: Es fängt schon an beim Empfang bis hin zum Check out, das Personal ist so herzlich, höflich und hilfsbereit ! Alles ist so wunderschön hergerichtet! Wir haben uns zu 100% Wohlgefühl. Essen sowie Getränke waren so sehr lecker, jeden Abend etwas anderes und so schön angerichtet! Der Strand ist der Hotel eigene Strand und ist sehr schön sauber gehalten! Alles in allem einfach nur perfekt! Es war einTraumurlaub dort!
title: Für uns war es das perfekte Hotel, klein gehalten, ruhig, gemütlich und sehr sauber.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We were not welcomed with the traditional drum experience.
text: We had a great time in Uga Bay Pasikuda. Everything was so perfect, but we only stayed for 3 nights. Next time we would love to spend more time there. Special reminder, Dasun went above and beyond to fulfill all our expectations. We recommend this hotel to everyone.
title: Our stay in Uga Bay

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Nous étions à l hôtel UGA BAY il y a quelques jours.  Je le recommande vivement ! Le personnel est vraiment aux petits soins ! L hôtel est magnifique, très propre et la plage est splendide.  Ma note est au maximum.  D ailleurs nous étions également à l hôtel Uga Ullagala qui était tout aussi bien !
title: Top top top !!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We have recently returned from holidaying at Uga bay for the 2nd time within 7 months. This place is truly a paradise place for us.
The beach is private,with  white powdery  sand. The hotel rooms are spacious with all amenities. House keeping is excellent. Gardens  are well  maintained. 
When we arrived in our room, the display  of welcome back with leaves and flowers on our bed was very heart  warming. 
Nimali welcomed us with a beaming smile which made us welcome and comfortable. 
Chef lakmal  and  his colleague chef prepared mouth watering  Sri-Lankan seafood  cuisine. They were very obliging preparing delicious food throughout our stay. 
We had a surprise birthday party on the beach, under the stars. It was truly spectacular. Thank you very much  Lakmal,colleague chef(sorry can't remember name) Nimali and Dammika for  organising this. We will treasure this in our memories. Beach staff Nissanka and team served us cocktails and food with a smile. Dinning area staff including Shantha, served us food and drinks in the dinning area with efficiency and smile. 
Truly the whole team from reception staff to hotel maintenance staff  work hard and with a smile, to make the guests  welcome , to enjoy their stay  and to  maybe return again.
title: Holiday experience at UGA BAY

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful stay, loved the staff, the views, the weather and the food. Enjoyed thoroughly and would highly recommend to all travellers to come here. In particular book a Pigeon tour too, and you can see incredible marine life.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:

We did the Pigeon Islands snorkelling tour with Ashan and it was brilliant. The visability wasn’t great due to the weather/waves but we still saw loads including turtles and sharks! Ashan was a great guide.

text: Amazing hotel and unbelievable experience. The beach cabin was incredible with this corridor to the beach. The attention and manner were perfect every time, so you can feel like home.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Everything perfect, but is quite remote so dont expect alot of activities near the location.
text: Great location and very nice staff. Especially our waiter Prabodha, who tool really great care of us during the great dining expiriences and the tour guide Ashan, who went on several trips with us.
title: Great place to relax

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We have just returned from a fantastic 5 day stay in Uga Jungle Beach, to top off our 2 week tour around Sri Lanka. It was the perfect spot to relax in paradise after 2 weeks on the go. Our beach cabin was spacious and clean. It was private and quiet - and even included our own private entrance to the beach.  The service was exceptional - and we were incredibly well looked after by all staff we encountered during our stay. All staff were friendly and attentive, often going out of their way to make our experience unforgettable. A special mention to Sanoos in the Beach Bar, and Nipun, Madhawa, Praboda and Ashan in the main restaurant who couldn't have looked after us any better! I would highly recommend Uga Jungle Beach to any travellers looking for the perfect spot to relax in paradise.
title: 5 Star Stay in Uga Jungle Beach

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wir hatten vor dem sehr schönen Hotelaufenthalt eine traumhafte, perfekt organisierte Rundreise mit SRI Wunderreisen.
text:
Nach einer perfekt organissierten SRI-Wunderreise wollten wir noch an der Ostküste SriLankas ein wenig relaxen. 
Die Wahl viel unter Anderem auch auf das UGA Jungle Beach Hotel, was perfekt dafür geeignet war! Das Hotel ist zwar hochpreisiger, bietet aber auch einen gewissen Gegenwert dafür. Die Lage ist am Besten als "irgendwo im Nirgendwo" zu beschreiben. Es liegt an einer Strasse nördlich von Trincomalee. Im Kreis von ein paar Kilometern gibt es so gut wie nichts.

Wir wurden freundlichst empfangen, unser Zimmer war zirka 1 Stunde vor offizieller Checkinzeit bezugsfertig. 
Unser 1. Zimmer "LagoonView 42" war noch umrenoviert, aber in Ordnung. Einzig die Klimaanlage war relativ laut und nachfolgend durch Defekt auch der Grund, warum wir noch in  "JungleCabin27" umgezogen sind welches gerade frisch renoviert war.  JungleCabin Zimmer sind einwenig größer in eigenen Häusern, Lagoon Zimmer haben ein Zimmer im Erdgeschoss und eines im Obergeschoss je Gebäude. 

Wir hatten Allinclusive gebucht, da das Hotel im Nirgendwo lag, eine gute Wahl, obwohl auch Halbpension gereicht hätte. Aber man gönnt es sichSämtliche Mahlzeiten AlaCart mit genügend Auswahl (Diner täglich wechselnde Karte) und IMMER optisch und geschmacklich perfekt. 

Das Personal ist ein weiterer Pluspunkt des Hotels, egal ob Kellner, Barman, Reinigung, Gästebetreuung, Beachboy usw. - alle extrem freundlich und gastorientiert.

Wir können das Hotel als eines der besten Hotels die wir weltweit besucht haben durchaus weiterempfehlen und möchten uns herzlichst beim Team des Uga Beach Hotels für die schöne Zeit bedanken.
title: Uga Beach Hotel - perfekt zur Erholung nach Rundreise mit sehr guter Gastronomie und Spitzenpersonal

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wer Ruhe liebt ist hier genau richtig.
text:
Wir können das Hotel weiterempfehlen.  Personal, Zimmer, Essen, Strand alles top. 
Man kann hier auch Ausflüge zu moderaten Preisen buchen. Zu empfehlen ist der Schnorchelausflug mit Ashan zur Pigeon Island Marine. Ashan  führte uns zu tollen Riffs. Selbst wer unsicher beim Schnorcheln ist kann es wirklich machen. Ashan führt ein Schwimmring mit, an dem man sich jederzeit ausruhen kann.
title: Einfach nur empfehlenswert!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Amazing experience and clean place with welcoming staff highly recommend proboda one of the staff  did take really good care.
Over all 9rating connected to the beach is plus point. Staff helped us out with the airport transport and the car provided was very relaxing and spacious . The jungle vibes are real😊
title: Just a perfect place to spend your week end

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a truly wonderful experience at this hotel. The location is absolutely beautiful. The room was exceptionally well-maintained, providing a very comfortable stay.

The room service and hospitality were outstanding. The food was superb and incredibly delicious. A special thank you to Chef Kushan for preparing such delightful meals. The restaurant staff were amazing, especially Mr.Prabodha, whose service was warm, attentive, friendly and professional. Both Ranga and Kanishka also provided an excellent service at the restaurant .
Actually, all the staff we encountered were incredibly kind, friendly, and welcoming. This is truly one of the best hotels we’ve ever visited, and we look forward to coming back again. Highly recommended!
title: Exceptional stay with amazing hospitality and delicious food

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Tips - Stayed on the jungle room which were spacious. Beach rooms were looking gorgeous.
Take the snorkeling excursion from the hotel. Worth every penny.
text:
Stayed here for 4 days. Very warm welcome and special thanks to the property manager who took care of all our requirements. forgive me for not remembering the names.
The team was managed very professionally. Rooms were great and the housekeeping outstanding. Special thanks to the chef who made sure that any requests were promptly prepared for our kids.
The entire staff is very courteous and professional. And the property was well maintained.
Special applause to the lady manager on the F&B resturant Her energy was very evident in taking care of the guests at the resturant.
We took snorkeling exercusion booked through the hotel and the kids had a fantastic time including us. Must recommended for the in house guests.
Prompt service at the beach resturant and in the end I thank the entire staff at uga jungle for such a memorable stay. We will visit again for sure.
Thank you all.

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka

Need a renovation for lagoon side csbans

Mr. Roshan (Residence Manager), Mr. Prabodha, Mr.Nethru, Mr.Pathum, Ms. Mithila & Mr. Sasanka. Thank you again for your wonderful hospitality during our stay. Wish u all d very best. Will meet soon

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful stay at Uga Jungle Beach with our 5-month-old baby. Every staff member we encountered was warm, friendly, and attentive—special thanks to Ishara, the only name we caught, but everyone was truly exceptional. The food was delicious and beautifully served. Our beach villa was spacious, spotless, and private, surrounded by trees and with easy access to the beach. Highly recommend for families.
