placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing stay at Uga jungle beach ! 
The service was really forthcoming and the room very clean!
The Spa treatments, the day trips and especially the Beach Bbq were super nice!! 
Thank you for the best start to our travels in Sri Lanka :)
title: We can highly recommend you stay at Uga jungle beach!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful stay at Uga jungle beach! The accommodation was clean & comfortable, and located, right by the beach, making it easy to relax. The Guests Relations Executive, Ishara Rajapakshe, was  incredibly helpful throughout our stay, addressing all our needs. The manager, Tharaka along with the rest of the staff were friendly, attentive and went out of their way to make us feel welcome throughout our visit. The food was incredible as well!  I’d highly recommend Uga Jungle Beach for anyone seeking an exceptional beach resort experience.
title: Exceptional!

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful Ressort with a great beach and awesome staff taking care of us. Everything clean and a very idyllic pool. Amazing food and a lovely team at the restaurant. The perfect location to relax and come down. You can see lots of animals everywhere!
title: Beautiful Jungle Ressort

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Uga Chena Huts is fabulous place to stay. Set right by the ocean it is committed to sustainability. The room was large beautiful appointed with a private plunge pool. The food was delicious and all the staff were delightful. It has a unique setting. Each suite has a very private feel surrounded by lush vegetation. It is great to be able to walk to the edge of the grounds and look down on the sea though there is a strict no go area onto the beach due to the danger of the sea and at night the potential of wild animals. We took a day safari into Yala National Park. Our ranger from the hotel was Dush who was fantastic. He was so knowledgeable and  tried to enable us to see all our top requests. The driver was particularly skilled and between them we could not have had a better team. Due to a monsoon downpour we did not see a Leopard but that only means I will have to return to this wonderful hotel. Strangely the room was a little under lit which was a bit frustrating especially after dark. Other than that it was faultless. Go and experience Chena Huts you will not be disappointed.
title: A unique hotel

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Had the most amazing two day stay , really wish we had stayed for three! Fabulous attentive staff , beautiful location , exceptional food & cocktails.  Highlight of the stay were the 3 safaris with Janith ,our extremely knowledgeable ranger & seeing a leopard, elephants, crocodiles , buffalo and beautiful birds. Will definitely be back !
title: Pure luxury

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
OMG what can I say about this hotel that hasn’t already been said . . . Everything from the moment you check in to the moment you leave is excellent.  They don’t stop feeding you and the food is first class. They also try to collect you and deliver you everywhere you want to go by golf cart so you don’t even need to walk anywhere!  Even though each ‘hut’ has a plunge pool  we used the hotel pool one morning and we were the only guests there.  It was shady and monkeys were playing in the trees for a while when we were there so it was even better.  We wanted a drink and nobody was about so we asked in the spa and a member of staff was immediately dispatched to the pool area and stayed there until we left!
Only one very small point. The lighting in the hut is quite subdued which is fine most of the time, except as a lady when you are trying to get ready to go to dinner.
A part from that it was superb and thanks to everyone for making our stay and our 2 safaris so good 😄
title: Everything excellent!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Hospitality at its perfection. We were taken care of even before we arrived and it didn’t end until we unfortunately had to leave. We stayed 2 nights and will definitely be back one day. 

A very well trained and organised team all working together to please their guests in an unbelievably beautiful environment. 

The “huts” are expensive but worth every cent.  Cuisine (including vegetarian needs!) and choice of beverages were remarkable. There was one comment concerning toilet privacy which is true, but that can be avoided by the partner going for a swim in your own pool. 

It would be unfair to name one member of the staff for his work as they all worked together as a team and were always in for a joke. The safari tours are a must even if you don’t get to see the leopard or the famous tusk elephant, the guides and the drivers are enthusiasts all the way. Thanks. 

Keep up the standard.
title: Hospitality at its perfection

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: On arrival we were greeted by Salman with the words "welcome to paradise|". And it was. Highlights are many but include the wonderful bungalow with its view of the lake (and bathing water buffalo); the sundowners on the beach over-looking the Indian Ocean; the amazing, creative and tasty food (all made on site to the highest standard); the fabulous cocktails; and the awe-inspiring safari with our knowledgeable ranger. Having elephants pass a few feet in front of our jeep was an unforgettable experience. But the icing on the cake was the amazing staff who, without exception, were friendly, helpful and professional. Seems unfair to single anyone out from such an outstanding crew, but a special thanks to Deshan for making us laugh on every buggy journey (sorry we missed your leopard suit!) and Sanjeewa for the 1st rate cookery class which we got to enjoy for our lunch.  This is that rare place - a truly all-inclusive resort.
title: Paradise!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Die Anlage ist sehr authentisch und naturverbunden und gibt einem ein richtiges Safari Feeling. Die Huts sind luxuriös eingerichtet mit einem eigenen Pool. Die Betten sind unglaublich bequem. Das Restaurant und die Bar sind ebenfalls sehr elegant und das Essen ist super lecker. Das beste war natürlich die Safari. Uga Chena Huts unterstützt die Bevölkerung vor Ort indem sie die Fahrzeuge und Fahrer vom Dorf organisiert. Der Guide bzw. Ranger wird vom Uga Chena gestellt und wusste bestens Bescheid über die Tierwelt. Wir haben uns bei den Safaris sehr sicher gefühlt und haben auch gemerkt, dass das wohl der Tiere bei diesen Anbietern an erster Stelle steht. (im Park haben wir leider auch anderes gesehen) Ich empfehle diese Unterkunft definitiv weiter. Sie ist nicht ganz günstig aber die Atmosphäre ist unbezahlbar.
title: Wundervoller und einzigartiger Aufenthalt

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Paradise.
We stayed at Una Chena Huts for 8 nights and it was absolutely fabulous.
As soon as we arrived we were greeted by smiling friendly staff and offered a beautiful welcome drink. I knew we were going to have an amazing holiday.
One of the best holidays I have ever experienced.
The huts are beautifully appointed villas with a large pool.
The room is huge, with  a fully stocked mini bar, a massive comfortable bed, The toiletries are plentiful and there is a separate very large toilet and separate shower.
Our villa had a view of the lake where we would see our resident water buffalo who I named Bert every day just wallowing in the water keeping cool.
Every evening at 6pm we were invited for drinks at the sundowner bar on the beach overlooking the beautiful ocean.
The restaurant served amazing silver service breakfast, lunch and dinner.
The choice of food was fabulous with a choice of 4 course European  or Sri Lankan specialties.
The chef would come and say hello during dinner to ensure the meal was satisfactory.
During  our stay we were visited by an elephant walking to reception, an elephant on the beach who made his way to the restaurant and reception. Monkey family enjoying the freedom of the resort.
One particular evening on returning to the villa from a night enjoying fabulous food and drinks we were greeted by Bert our water buffalo on the porch of our villa munching on the greenery and when he was full he wandered behing our villa of our villa.
Uga Chena Huts have a fabulous team of guides who arrange and take you on the safaris. We were lucky to be offered 2 safaris a day one early in the morning and one late afternoon.
Our guide Kalihdu was absolutely fabulous, his knowledge was exceptional. He was super friendly and changed our route through the park every day.
We were so lucky to watch a leopard just chilling in the bush who then decided to sit in front of our 4x4 just relaxing and cleaning herself for 5 minutes then we had the same experience with an elephant.
It was surreal seeing these beautiful animals in the natural habitat.
The animals we saw were leopards, elephants, water buffalo’s, monkeys, crocodiles, deer and an amazing array of birds.
All the staff at Una Chena Huts are absolutely fabulous. Leezel Daniel The resident manager must be so proud of all her staff. They were exceptional, always had a beautiful smile and going above and  beyond to ensure our stay was unforgettable.
Una Chena Huts is paradise and we will definitely return.
title: AMAZING FABULOUS UNFORGETTABLE

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The huts are large and very comfortable,  wirh a great private pool. All of the staff are excellent, incredible service and attitude. 
We particularly appreciated Salman, who was so professional and so friendly 
The food and choices were excellent quality
And the restaurant and bar was very nicely appointed.
We were out on Safari multiple times and were lucky to see a notirious Tusker, a Leopard and many other Elephants amongst several species of birds and other animals.  The ranger Dushmantha & Driver Roshan were absolutely excellent, knowledgable and very accomodating.
We highly recommend.
title: Relaxing and Exciting  in Yala

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
eine weitere unterkunft auf unserer grossen sri lanka rundreise, jedoch übetraf sie jeglichen erwartungen. im nachhinein bereuen wir nur einen punkt: dass wir nicht länger als 2 nächte blieben!
wir besuchten 3 hotels der uga-kette, chena huts war mit abstand die luxeriöseste.
sämtliche punkte (ausstattung, grösse der villa, pool, essen, sauberkeit, freundlichkeit, service, bar) sind hier top! schwierig ist die zufahrtsstrasse, dafür weiss man, was auf einen bei den safaris zukommt :-)
mit kalindo hatten wir einen ranger, der uns auf den 2 safaristrips und bei einem morgenspaziergang begleitete. das lohnt sich, weil man nichts auf eigene faust unternehmen darf, da das wildlife wirklich direkt vor der haustüre beginnt!

danke an dieser stelle auch für das wunderbare dinner im sand für unseren nachzufeiernden hochzeitstag :-)
title: luxus pur......... und das direkt neben dem nationalpark yala!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 3 nights at Uga Chena Huts. It was a great amount of time - and 4 nights might just be better to thoroughly enjoy the property as well as Yala. 

The room was such a great respite after the crazy Yala drives. So much space to sprawl out. Such a comfy bed and pillows. Great shower and pressure. The deck with pool was lovely and really enjoyed hearing the waves from the ocean and the birds. Only criticism is the toilet room - it needs a roof for privacy - no one wants to hear their loved  one’s issues going on in there! 

The service was spot on! They worked so hard to make eveyone happy and cared for. A shout out to Janith our ranger - he was so knowledgeable and made the drives fun and tailored them to my needs after I said no more bumpy “main road” of Yala - so helpful! (And on that note make sure to book Spa appointments! Your sore body will thank you after those safari drives) Tea in the spa was excellent! 

The food - amazing! Always ready to cater to our needs when we needed to change it up because of preferences. I will remember the fluffy truffle eggs from breakfast forever!! Best breakfasts I’ve ever had. And the quantity of food - you will never go hungry - ever! I had to start just having soup for lunch to save room for Safari snacks which is actually just lunch to go - and so good to! 

I can’t say enough or praise the property and people enough - wonderful in every sense. Oh and an elephant even made a visit to the car park where you board the safari vehicles as well as wild boar to top it all off! 

Thanks so much Uga Chena Huts!!
title: Perfection all the way!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You will not want to leave!
text:
Uga Chena Huts offer a near-perfect 'Robinson Crusoe' boutique hotel experience.  (A mile away, the Wild Coast hotel offers a less-good experience, and costs more.)

The Uga Chena rooms are high-ceilinged and airy, many with views of the adjacent lagoon; the contemporary dining room and reception areas are beautifully designed - simple, pared-down and elegant - and the staff are smiling and attentive.

At sunset, they light a brazier on the beach and offer complimentary cocktails to watch the sun go own, with the roar of the ocean immediately adjacent.  Memories really are made of this.  The setting is utterly unspoilt and magical and surpassed our expectations.

Would we go back?  Absolutely.  A two or three night stay is probably best.
title: Near Perfect Ocean Hideaway.  Wonderful.

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Wow! What an amazing place with very friendly staff who go out of their way to make your stay an exceptional one. Special mentions have to go to the chefs for their fantastic food(we particularly liked the cookery demonstration and guide of the kitchens). The head waiter runs the restaurant with enthusiasm that runs all the way through his staff. Dush, our ranger, has a fountain of knowledge and such passion for the job he obviously loves, we learnt so much from him. A minor issue was poor lighting in the room, for ladies especially, however this didn’t detract from the ambiance and beauty of the spacious room.We both thank you for such a memorable stay.
title: Luxury at its best

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Morning and evening drives are quite different so if you can do both, take the opportunity.
text:
A wonderful property with exceptional comfort, food and hospitality. We have found hospitality delightful all over Sri Lanka but Uga Chena offers a unique serene setting and the resort exceeded my expectations in every aspect. 
At mealtimes Chinthaka was an engaging host and we were delighted to enjoy a table on the sand by lamplight on our final night. Thank you so much.
Our guide Kalindu was incredibly knowledgeable and alongside our driver made sure we had 3 unique drives looking at different aspects of the wonderful national park. Seeing a leopard cub stalking a buffalo calf was incredibly special and thank you to the driver ( sorry I didn’t get your name) for getting us to the perfect position to watch it. The national park is overcrowded with jeeps but we managed to steer clear of the queues and still see great wildlife. Thank you.
Finally to the behind the scenes team who maintain the high standards across the property. Thank you.
Don’t hesitate to book this amazing resort of just 18 luxurious cabins.
title: Exceptional

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s worth it to be all inclusive. They also stock binoculars, drinks and gourmet snacks for each safari
text:
Luxurious special jungle escape! The villas are gorgeous, well stocked w its own pool. Having safaris 2x per day included in the package was brilliant! Ranger Kalindu was with us for our stay and we got to see leopards, elephants, crocodiles, jackals, all types of birds and more. 

The food feels plucked from top restaurants (hats off to Chef Nuwan) combining traditional Sri Lankan specialties with European flair. You definitely won’t go hungry with their 4 course meal service, sundowner specials on the beach (happy hour drinks + appetizers) and many desserts! They arranged a beautiful dinner on the beach for our final night by a mesmerizing fire. What a treat!

And what would an amazing hotel be without great service? Ask for Nuwan as your server - he anticipates your needs and knew all our likes / dislikes quickly. 

There’s no better way to experience a  Sri Lanka safari.
title: The only place to stay for your Sri Lankan safari!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: A must stay when visiting Yala National Park
text: This was a wonderful experience watching elephants on the sand dunes while having drinks in the bar. Staff are incredible and so is the food. The hut is super comfortable and very spacious. Game drives were very interesting especially seeing all the beautiful peacocks.
title: Must stay just magical

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
If your travels bring you to Sri Lanka a stay at Uga Chena is a must.
It is an oasis of low key luxury. The staff, accommodations, and food are all outstanding!
The safaris are an experience of a lifetime. Our zoologist Johnny made the trip for us. His knowledge of everything in the park was interesting and fascinating! In both rain and sunshine we saw many species of  birds, elephants, a leopard and so much more.  A shout out to our driver who handled the vehicle in all terrains and water levels!  A must visit place!!
title: Luxury in nature

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Early safaris are best
text:
This was a simply amazing.  When you find the place it is a long dirt track from the main road (which is quite normal in Sri Lanka) and Uga Chena is at the end past the Hilton, Cinnamon and a couple of other places down this road.  

So glad we picked the Uga Chena though as we could not fault it.  From the amazing HUGE room to the warm, friendly, helpful, brilliant team working there.  Uga have a few hotels throughout Sri Lanka and they vary greatly in price and facilities, Uga Chena is up there on price, but what you get is unparalleled and we had quite an adventure just in our 3 days there.

Upon arrival, we were welcomed most warmly and felt at home straight away.  As we walked to the restaurant a monitor lizard was fishing in the pond and caught a fish which was amazing to watch.  

The restaurant is small and intimate with aircon indoor seating and covered outdoor seating available.  There is an outdoors bbq where some items are prepared - the food is freshly prepared each day and the menu changes dependent upon what they have fresh that day.  My favourite was the lobster and Kris’s was the steak. But the curries are all delicious.

We had a culinary demonstration which was a treat and the prawn curry chef cooked was delicious.  

The outside bar and ‘sundowner’ bar are a treat with the bar close to the restaurant and the sundowner out near the beach, the weather and animals do not always allow the sundowner to operate, so go there when you can.  

The room is simply amazing - you will not be disappointed.  The bed is enormous, you can both starfish.  toiletries and amenities are plentiful with separate toilet and shower (excellent pressure), large bath, twin sinks and great aircon. The minibar is well stocked and replenished whenever you wish.  Try the ‘whispering wall’ - if you both stand in opposite corners and talk quietly to the wall, you can hear perfectly - or better still surprise your partner with this knowledge when they are in the toilet :).

The room has an outdoor pool - this is not heated so brace yourself.  But the view from it is perfect.

Our personal experience was quite the adventure even for just 3 nights that we were there.  We had 3 safaris booked and were paired with a very warm and friendly Australian family who we made friends with straight away.  Our Ranger ‘Gayan’ and his driver were absolute diamonds - so helpful and knowledgeable, spotting animals we wouldn’t even with binoculars. Our first trip out was leisurely until they received word of a possible leopard sighting - but it had gone when we got there.  On the way, we saw plenty though and were very happy with our journey.  Our second trip was early morning and we were treated the most magical hour or more when we saw a leopard taking a nap in a tree and watched her for as long as she sat there watching us, licking her paws.  

That night we were held hostage by an elephant who decided that the trees outside our villa were the best in Sri Lanka and we were unable to leave.  So we turned off the lights, made good use of the minibar and sat watching the magnificent beast as he completely ignored the rangers combined attempts to move him on.  We got to dinner about 9.30pm and could not have been happier!  We were treated to the brilliant service they offer none-the-less for our late arrival and the story of the elephant in camp was doing the rounds.  While we were at dinner, he moved on to the staff accommodation and they found themselves unable to go back till he had moved on - I hope they had a ‘lock-in’.  :) and enjoyed it.

Whilst we were there in January and the weather was a little against us with sporadic rain, we made the most of this magical place and the wonderful staff who looked after us.  On the morning that we were leaving, we went on a beach walk with our Ranger and our Antipodean friends and were again treated to the most magical walk on the beach.  We saw the recent prints of Leopard, Elephant, Sloth Bear and mongoose - all of which had travelled through camp during the night - incredible.  The most surprising was the sloth bear and it made up for not having seen him on our safari.  There are a couple of stray dogs here but they really don’t bother you.  

Animals we saw were:- Elephant, Leopoard, Buffalo, Boar, Chipmunks, Peacocks, Monkeys, Monitor Lizards, Gecko, lizards of all sorts, Birds too many to mention and crocodile.
title: Simply stunning

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Wow! What an amazing place, absolutely fantastic! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay fabulous. The hut was a restful and luxurious room rather than a hut. Food was so good, fresh and well presented. Sundowner drinks were sociable and the staff were friendly and helpful during that time. Safaris provided by the hotel were great - jeeps were comfortable and powerful and ranger tried hard to make it successful. Our stay was further enhanced by a large bull elephant visiting the pond by reception for a drink. An amazing and unique experience.
title: Amazing and unique

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir können diese Hotel ausnahmslos empfehlen! Ja, es ist hochpreisig - allerdings spiegelt sich der Preis absolut im Aufenthalt wieder - es bleiben keine Wünsche offen!!

Das Hotel hat nach unserer Auffassung 6 Sterne verdient. Neben der Lage, der Organisation inkl. Durchführung der Safaris, den Mahlzeiten sowie dem  exzellentem Service vor Ort  sind auch die Huts überwältigend. Die Gestaltung/Interieure des gesamten Hotels ist sehr durchdacht und imposant! Allerdings möchten wir den Service und die Menschen hervorheben, welche dem Hotel den letzten exzellenten Schliff verleihen!

Wir waren vom 28.12. - 31-12.2024 - im Rahmen einer eigens organisierten Rundreise - vor Ort und haben unseren Aufenthalt sehr genossen. Gerne wären wir noch länger geblieben.....aber es gibt so viel Tolles in Sri Lanka zu erleben.

Zudem möchten wir insbesondere sehr positiv die Safaris erwähnen - wir haben jede dieser Möglichkeit genutzt und wir wurden belohnt. Deshalb waren wir ja auch hier - es war einfach grandios .... die Aufzählung an Tiersichtungen würde den Rahmen sprengen ;-) Und ja, Elefanten und Leoparden waren dabei!

Der Service und die Qualität - in vielerlei Belangen - haben wir bisher selten erleben dürfen! Nochmals einen großen Dank an das gesamte Team! Wir können niemanden hervorheben - we were falling in love with all of you!

Wenn Yala, dann werden wir dieses Hotel 100%ig wieder wählen - ja auch für den Preis. Und ja, wir kommen wieder!
title: Einfach nur empfehlenswert - wir kommen wieder!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay at least three nights!
text: We only had two nights at Uga Chena. Suggest staying at least three to really enjoy the facilities! Our private pool was divine and we didn’t spend enough time lazing by it as we were busy doing wonderful game drives. The one morning we did have to spend poolside a large elephant strolled by our hut and gave us the experience of a lifetime. We  have been on several safaris but never had the chance to be so close to a wild animal and get such closeup photos. It was truly special. The staff and our ranger went out of their way to make our stay exceptional. Highly recommended!
title: Perfect! The accommodation is outstanding! Beautiful design and the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in! Loved it

placeInfo/address: Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Лучший отель в историческом здании в данном регионе! Очень внимательный и полезный персонал. Отличный завтрак и потрясающая природа. Идеальное поддержание номеров. Неплохой интернет. Отдельно стоящие здание с джакузи(температура воды 37), сауной и хамамом. С уверенностью рекомендую!

placeInfo/address: Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at the Bellwood Manor for three nights during our tour of Sri Lanka.  Its a superb hotel with wonderful service.  As an example, you're welcomed by flower garlands and a complimentary head and shoulder massage.  The hotel is well-presented with a range of facilities such as a library to relax in and a snooker room, which we used after dinner.  We also took advantage of a massage in the Spa.  Dinner is a 6-course experience with a very high level of standard.  We would thoroughly recommend Bellwood Manor to you if you're travelling through the hill country of Sri Lanka.
title: Superb hotel in Sri Lanka's hill country

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your spectacular review! We’re so pleased you enjoyed the charm of Bellwood Manor, from its rich colonial heritage to the modern comforts we’ve carefully curated. It’s wonderful to hear that the cozy fireplace, welcome massage, 6-course tasting menu, and spa facilities added to your experience.

Your kind words about Stacey and our team mean a lot—they truly take pride in delivering exceptional hospitality. We hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay in Nuwara Eliya!

Best regards,
The Bellwood Manor Team
placeInfo/address: Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We booked a room for two nights at Bellwood Manor. The property is a brand new restoration of a sumptuous historic property dating back to the British colonial period. Rooms with all comforts, including a stove under disguise of a faux fireplace which was worth, given that Nuwara Eliya is at an altitude of approx. 1’900m and therefore quite chilly compared to the plains. Welcome drink and neck massage offered while checking in, exceptional 6-course tasting menu at the restaurant, breakfast served in the garden, cozy SPA with heated pool, steam bath & sauna, park with wonderful view over the valley. All staff were absolutely charming during our stay. Our special thanks to Stacy. She was always available and personally committed to ensure a perfect service.
title: Spectacular

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It was very quiet when we were here (late May), only on the last day (a Saturday) did it get busier. There is not much around to do/see/eat.
text:
10/10 experience! The hotel was so lovely, everything was clean, the beds were very comfy, the bathroom was lovely and the pool area was stunning (as well as being 10 seconds from the beach!). 
The breakfast buffet was great and we had dinner in the hotel one night which was also delicious. 
There is a decent gym onsite and a pool table and table tennis as well.
Finally, the thing that tops it off were the staff. They were all so friendly and helpful, chatting to us every breakfast and making sure we had the best stay possible.
Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Sri Lanka.
title: Amazing hotel, a must visit

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka

We celebrated our anniversary here and the staff surprised us with the most thoughtful touches that made our special day absolutely magical! Outstanding stay! The food was absolutely delicious - every meal exceeded expectations with fresh ingredients and great variety. The customer service was exceptional from check-in to check-out. All staff members were friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting great dining and top-notch service. We'll definitely be back!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The architecture was unique and beautifully designed.
Loved the scenic views from the property.
Meals were tasty and well-prepared.
Rooms were spacious with excellent amenities.
The bed was extremely comfortable — slept really well.
Service was professional and friendly throughout.
Nothing specific to note as improvements.
title: A stylish stay with comfort and charm

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Don’t forget to watch the sunrise while you are staying here. It’s amazing. 

The traveling season is from June to December.
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 02 nights and went there to celebrate our anniversary. I was amazed by the views and lovely beach by the hotel. The service and food was exceptional  too. 

The staff went above and beyond to create a memorable experience for us from room decorations to the anniversary celebration dinner which was arranged by the pool just for us.  The hotel has a really talented staff including chefs who prepared mouthwatering spreads for all our meals. 

Again, the food here is delicious and the hotel staff is fantastic. I wouldn’t do justice if I didn’t mention few names who made our stay much better. Dhammika (Restaurant Mgr), Mahinda (Restaurant Supervisor), Madushan, and Kavinda (Restaurant staff). 

I must say the rooms are so clean and tidy. It seems they pay extra attention to details. And it’s absolutely same with the hotel premises. The pictures here will tell more about what I described. 

I highly recommend this hotel to a couple or a solo trip. It’s very safe and there’s a huge pool for you to have a dip. We were so relaxed and happy, will definitely come here again.
title: Our anniversary celebration stay. The best part about the hotel is it’s staff.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful F&B team with great standards. They are very accommodating to customers needs, extremely helpful and warm. It's very clear that they work as a team, juniors and executives all working together to make the guests time valuable. They made our stay a joyous one. Also the reservation team is great and flexible too. Overall good place.
title: Great F&B management and team

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The beach here is beautiful
text: Gorgeous and very clean rooms. Lovely hotel! All staff have been so lovely and attentive. I got ill on my second day (tonsillitis) and the manager was concerned and called put the doctor for me. The restaurant menu is delicious too. All I can say is a big thank you
title: I'd definitely return here

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka

The place was very calm and quiet, ideal place for relaxing with friends and family. Very beautiful view of the hotel, food was also very nice.
title: Very Comfortable stay

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Plenty of parking, I’d recommend half or full board option when booking
text:
We had a great stay at the hotel. The rooms are well equipped and spacious. The pool at over a hundred meters is really big, and some of it is even covered by the hotels massive open roof. Food was excellent having done a buffet and three course set menu with plenty of options. Beds by the beach and pool have soft cushions but we had to put them on ourselves
Would stay again!
All staff team are great, management created and supports a good culture from what we saw.
Overall great value of money
title: Would come again!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Très bon séjour ! Nous avons passé deux nuits idéales ! Merci à tous pour l’accueil ! Les repas étaient très bons et les chambres propres et confortables. Nous avons également profité d’un massage relaxant qui était vraiment très bien. Je recommande !
title: Très bon séjour !

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Очень крутой отель, а персонал Выше всех похвал! Я путешествовала по Шри ланке и видела разные отели, но этот действительно достоин 5 звезд! Кровать огромная и удобная, подушки классные- мы отлично высыпались. Хорошая звукоизоляция. Территория и номера убираются каждый день, любую просьбу тут же решают. Даже выключают вечернюю громкую музыку по пятницам, если их попросить. Готовы порезать ваши фрукты, которые вы купите на рынке. 
WiFi отличный, в номерах и у бассейна работает. Однако для серьезной работы на ноутбуке- плохо тянет. Выручал интернет с сим карты. Завтраки и ужины вкусные, есть блюда совершенно не острые. На ужин всегда готовили что то на гриле-курица, рыба, креветки, свинина.
title: Лакшери и релакс отдых

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
La literie était top, beaucoup de petites attentions (ex: fruit en arrivant, serviettes pliées en forme d’animaux). 
Le spa est très sympa et les massages sont parfait. 
Tout le personnel est accueillant, très bon séjour. Je recommande vivement !
title: L’hôtel est très agréable, la plage devant l’hôtel est magnifique.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We had a super relaxing and nice stay at the sunrise Pasikuda hotel. The private beach access is definitely exceptional and the service is very attentive and fast. Very large and diverse breakfast and the fact that the hotel comes with a gym is an extra plus point - we can highly recommend!
title: Beautiful Hotel!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Finished our family tour of Sri Lanka at Sunrise Pasikuda, hoping to rest and relax prior to a long flight back to Europe. The rooms were spacious and excellent quality, the staff were friendly and helpful and the dinner service contained a wide variety of local and more westernised dishes. 

A good sense of security within the resort.

The pool was huge and lounge chairs were easily available. Easy access to the beach smack in the middle of Pasikuda Beach.

Room for improvement -> perhaps add a bar & snack service closer to the beach. Otherwise guests are tempted to walk to other resorts nearby.
title: Relaxing beach resort experience

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: East coast is beautiful! Very good for relaxing on the white sand big beaches
text:
Prachtige grote accomodatie aan zee. Mega lang zwembad en hoogstaande hospitality.
Je wordt echt in de watten gelegd
Tuin is mooi aangelegd en goed onderhouden. De kamer is goed met heerlijke bedden. Het strand is hier groot en heel relaxed je kan schaduw zoeken onder de bomen. Strandbedden met kussens en handdoeken voor alles wordt gezorgd.
Ontbijt in buffetvorm heeft voldoende variatie. 
Zeker een aanrader in deze prachtige regio. 
Gratis late check out zonder problemen
title: Great hotel with very good sence of hospitality

title: Very nice

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: WONDERFUL STAY @SUNRISE PASIKUDA. HOTEL LOCATED IS PRIME LOCATION THE ROOM ARE COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN.THE LARGE POOL VIEW MAKE US HAPPY.STAFF MAINTAINED THIS AT A VERY HIGH LEVEL. BREAKFAST, LUNCH, DINNER BUFFET EXCEPTIONALLY GOOD. HEMANTHA (HR MANAGER) HAD GIVEN WONDERFUL SERVICE DURING OUR STAY AND LOOKED AFTER US VERY WELL. AND SPECIALLY I WANT TO THANKS WAITER UDARA & ANJANA TOOK CARE OF US DURING ALL 03 MEALS. WE HAD A MASSIVE DJ NIGHT WITH DRINKS AND ALL.WONDERFUL.IN SERVICE AND THERE HAPPY SMILE MADE FOR LOVELY EXPERIENCED, WELL DONE TO THE MANAGEMENT HERE. WITH A GOOD PRICE,YOU CAN ENJOY PREMIUM SERVICES AND GREAT AMENITIES, WHICH TRULY WORTH IT FOR GREAT STAY EXPERIENCE.IM VERY SATISFIED WITH MY EXPERIENCE HERE AND WILL DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TO OTHERS & HOPE TO SEE YOU ALL SOON.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Wir waren leider nur 3 Tage hier und wären so gerne noch geblieben. Wir haben uns rundherum wohl gefühlt.  Das Personal war sehr freundlich, professionell und haben uns jeden Wunsch von den Augen abgelesen. Das Zimmer (Deluxe) war ausreichend groß und die Dusche war hervorragend. Die ganze Anlage war traumhaft und  groß, sodass sich die Gäste überall verteilen konnten bis hin zum Traum-Strand. Der extralange Pool war toll. An diesem Strand kann man auch sehr gut im warmen Meer schwimmen aufgrund der geringen Strömung.  Die ayurvedischen Anwendungen waren ausgezeichnet. Die Mitarbeiterin ist professionell auf meine Rückenbeschwerden eingegangen.   Frühstück und Abendessen waren von guter Qualität und vielfältig. Wir kommen wieder, aber dann länger!
title: Hier kann die Seele baumeln

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Genießen Sie die Ruhe.
text:
Es war toll, weil wir hier so alleine waren. Es war ein sehr schön eingerichtetes Zimmer und der Zimmermann hat unser Zimmer immer sehr schön gemacht er hat Affen, Hunde,Krokodile und Texte aus Handtüchern und Pflanzen gemacht. 
Der Pool ist riesig und der Strand traumhaft, das Essen toll und Personal mega freundlich.
title: Bewertung Sunrise Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren 2 Nächte hier und es war rundum perfekt.
Wunderschöne Anlage, toller Pool, saubere Zimmer, sauberer Strand. Das Personal war sehr freundlich, besonders der Restaurantmanagar Dammika war zuvorkommend und lustig. 
Auch den Spa Bereich haben wir für eine Fußmassage und Maniküre genutzt und waren sehr zufrieden.
Wir empfehlen das Hotel absolut weiter und kommen jederzeit gerne wieder.
title: Perfekter Aufenthalt

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check which cabins you prefer, some are beach side and others are facing the forest according to your preference.
text: I really enjoyed a unique experience staying for one week at Uga Jungle Beach. The staff and management were very accommodating to all of my remote work and cabin requests. They were happy to accommodate anything I asked to change. The hotel has a very natural common area with a pool, restaurant and bar area where I was able to work. The food was excellent especially if you enjoy seafood. The juice and deserts, jams and butter all made with fresh fruits and tasty ingredients. The staff was happy to give me as much food as I wanted and to taste and have small bites, could modify orders as I liked. I highly recommend this place for a true getaway into nature, away from city life. The naturalist Ashan was super genuine, knowledgeable and helpful about all sightseeing and nature excursions in Trincomalee and across Sri Lanka. He even helped me plan the rest of my trip moving to other cities. I arrived by cinnamon air from Colombo to Trincomalee airport which was super easy and fun, and Uga hotel sent me a driver to pick me up from the landing strip and take me to the hotel. There are lovely beaches, snorkeling and temples in the area which the hotel took me to, including seeing lots of amazing dolphins, turtles, colorful corals and fish. I loved how flexible it was every evening I would talk to reception and the naturalist and we found something fun and different that I could go do the best day according to my work/time off schedule. Staff and management super kind and nice.
title: The true nature experience in Trincomalee

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Everything was great—definitely worth the price. The hotel has only a few guest rooms, so it always feels quiet and private. Facilities are modern, clean, and never crowded. The hardware is excellent, and the staff are kind, attentive, and always ready to help with anything you need.
title: A nice trip

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Review

We had an incredible stay at Uga Jungle Beach for my 30th birthday. We stayed for 5 nights and the stay can be surmised into 3 points: exceptional service, exceptional food, premium feel.

The staff were all extremely friendly and no request was too difficult to sort. They work long hours and maintain the high quality consistently. A good example of their forward thinking was to do the room cleaning whilst you’re at breakfast and dinner so you don’t have the awkward moment returning to your room to find someone midway through cleaning!

We were half board and experienced a la carte dining. For each of our 5 days we had a different menu for a 5 course dinner (starter, soup, sorbet, entree, desert). Dishes were superbly prepared and presented and tasted superb. Breakfast was also an a la carte experience with juice options, 3 different dishes out of a large menu (we only ever had 2 as they were very filling).

On my birthday my wife surprised me with a sunset seafood bbq on the beach, organised by Uga. This was the main highlight of the holiday for me - the food was exceptional, both in quality and quantity (tuna, crab, lobster, prawns, cuttlefish, white fish, vegetables, rice etc) - we even got a private fire pit! They put lots of effort into the sand decorations too.

Only minor thing was the drinks were on the pricier end but that’s to be expected when travelling to a premium hotel. As a reference a lion lager (330ml) was around £5. We have been to restaurants / hotels where a 625ml bottle was £2. By UK prices £5 is still good. Be aware the menu prices are listed in USD - there is then a service charge (10%) and local tax (18-20%) on top of the listed price. At the time of writing this, the conversion to GBP means the listed price is basically what it costs in GBP when you add the service + tax.

We also chose to go on a guided cycling tour (3 hours - £32) with a private naturalist - this was around 20km and involved seeing many of the 400+ bird species in Sri Lanka (thanks Ashan!). If you like nature and the beautiful rice field landscapes then this excursion is a must do in our opinion.

On site itself there are so many varieties of wildlife - monkeys regularly sat above our balcony (Jungle cabin). We also do giant squirrels, crabs, 3 different species of kingfisher, loads of other birds.  

The beach is completely idyllic, we ran 2km either side and didn’t encounter another human being - it is fully secluded. The water is beautiful, calm, warm and there is a lifeguard on duty. We found that the water remained chest height up to around 15-20 meters from the shore so was ideal for paddling and swimming.

We hope to return in the future - thanks for the amazing stay.
title: Idyllic beach resort with exceptional food and staff

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Uga Jungle Beach exceeded all my expectations. The combination of jungle serenity and beachside beauty made it a truly unique experience. The staff were incredibly polite and helpful, always making sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The property is well-maintained, and the atmosphere is peaceful and private—perfect for a relaxing escape. Waking up to the sounds of nature and enjoying a morning walk on the secluded beach was unforgettable. I would gladly return and highly recommend it to anyone visiting the east coast of Sri Lanka
title: Perfect retreat on Sri Lanka’s east coast

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Uga Jungle Beach was simply outstanding; one of the best we’ve had in Sri Lanka. The staff were warm and attentive from the moment we arrived, and their kindness really made an impression.

We stayed in Beach Cabin 15, which was private, beautifully maintained, and opened right onto the beach. The surprise cake and personal touches made us feel truly special.

The setting is stunning peaceful, lush & perfect for a romantic getaway or quiet retreat. We left feeling refreshed and already look forward to coming back. Thank you to the wonderful team for such a memorable experience!
title: A Slice of Paradise – Truly Unforgettable

placeInfo/address: 27th Kilometre Post Pulmoddai Rd, Kuchchaveli 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pidan las beach villas.
text:
La experiencia ha sido increíble! Nos alojamos en una beach villa escondida en la selva y con acceso a la playa. La ducha exterior privada ha sido un experiencia maravillosa. 
Relax, servicio impecable, playa paradisiaca, muy buena restauración.
Volveremos y lo recomendaremos.
title: Quiero volver al Jungle Beach

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Such a delight to return Uga Ullagalla - the property is soo Big you will only meet other guests over meals - excellent getaway for couples - we love the privacy - the rooms are spacious - with two separate sections and a private plunge pool … ideal location to visit Anuradhapura or Pollanaruwa (or both actually)
Highly recommending
title: Returning again next year … Second time so far

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an excellent experience at Uga Ulagalla. It's everything you could wish for when going on holiday.
The staff make sure you have an unforgettable time at their hotel by being really welcoming, attentive to your needs and providing the best possible service. In addition, the villas are beautiful and offer a lot of privacy (we had the deluxe pool villa). On top of that, the food was creative and really delicious every time.
title: We had an excellent experience at Uga Ulagalla

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
- Kochevent ist sehr zu empfehlen 
- keine Schuhe vor der zimmertür stehen lassen Wegen den Affen
text:
Wir hatten einen wundervollen entspannten Aufenthalt hier im Dschungel Uga Ulagalla. Das gesamte Team ist äußerst zuvorkommend und freundlich. 
Das Ambiente ist atemberaubend. Das Gelände riesig, weshalb wir täglich mit dem Fahrrad durch diese wunderschön gepflegte Anlage, um ein satt grünes Reisfeld herum fuhren. 
Besonders und äußerst interessant war der Kochevent vom traditionellen Curry. 
Zuerst erhielt ich von Yoshina, der wundervollen, außergewöhnlich hübschen und freundlichen guest Managerin, die Möglichkeit einen traditionellen Sari zum Kochevent zu tragen. Ich fühlte mich sehr wohl damit und er sah wunderschön aus. Uns wurden zuerst die Kräuter und Gemüsepflanzen im schönen hauseigenen Garten gezeigt. Dann wurde gemeinsam gekocht. Der Koch  mit über 15 Jahre Kocherfahrung und die hilfsbereite Köchin waren fantastisch. Wir aßen hier wirklich das beste Curry auf unser 3- wöchigen Reise. Wir können diesen Event sehr empfehlen!!!
Beim Frühstück klauten uns Makaken-Affen 2-mal das Brot aus dem Körbchen, weshalb das grandiose Serviceteam uns während dem Essen beschützen 😂 wir nahmen es mit Humor. Wir haben unsere Zeit hier sehr genossen!!!
Und Yoshina hat unser Herz berührt🥰 Herzlichen Dank 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻
title: Wunderbarer Aufenthalt im Jungle

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: alle villen sind vermutlich recht ähnlich und somit alla top!
text:
was für ein start unserer 3-wöchigen sri lanka rundreise... natürlich verpeilt von der langen reise mit bereits tausend eindrücken der doch langen (4 stündigen) fahrt vom flughafen, bleibt es dabei: uga ulagalla bleibt das PERSÖNLICHSTE, HERZLICHSTE hotel der spitzenklasse...
die villa mit pool, all die details im und ausserhalb des zimmers, die sauberkeit, der hohe standard der einrichtung (achtung, das himmelbett quietschte bei unserer villa!), die velofahrten über das riesige hotelgelände überzeugten ebenso, wie die persönlichkeit des teams.
da wir 4 tage hier verbrachten, schöpften wir u.a. das ausgezeichnete essen aus: begeistert vom sri lanka frühstück probierten wir jegliche empfehlungen des hauses aus und wurden nie enttäuscht. stringhoppers im übrigen fanden nicht nur wir lecker, sondern auch die affen, die sich beim essen doch recht nah an unseren tisch getrauten!
überhaupt sind die tiere hier ein highlight: als schweizer ist man doch recht schnell überfordert, wenn einem pfaue, affen, streifenhörnchen (bei glück sogar ein elefant...), glühwürmchen, grosse echsen auf dem hotelgelände begegnen.
2 wunderbare damen machten unseren aufenthalt und reisestart mit ihrer unaufdringlichen art unvergesslich (Dilrukshi und....?). ein grosses dankeschön und ja, wir haben vor, wieder hierher zu kommen.
title: unsere lieblingsunterkunft während der sri lanka rundreise!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Suggest to stay two nights!
text: We recently chose this place to spend our honeymoon and we had an excellent stay! Staff was so helpful and the food was great! They arranged us a candle light dinner by the pool! There are so many activities to do here! Villas are super clean and spacious and the pools have built in jacuzzi! Will definitely visit again!!
title: Excellent stay

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Endroit idyllique pour parcourir le triangle culturel . Accueil chaleureux et infrastructures excellentes. Service attentif et personnalisé .les villas avec piscine sont luxueuses et très bien aménagées . L’environnement au milieu de la nature est exceptionnel
title: Séjour idyllique dans cet écrin de verdure

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: N’hésitez pas à réserver les chambres luxueuses avec piscines
text: Un hôtel extraordinaire dans un environnement exceptionnel.  Un accueil exclusif avec photo et «  cérémonie » de bienvenue et un personnel attentionné et bienveillant. Nous avions une « chambre » ou plutôt une maison à l’extrémité du domaine en bordure de rizière qui était immense et tout équipée dans une atmosphère cosy ! Rien à dire sur les repas et les petits déjeuners servis par des personnels serviables et sympathiques . N’oublions pas Yoshina et sa bonne humeur communicative ! Merci à tous pour ce merveilleux séjour
title: Le paradis !

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just had 3 very special days here. The villas are spacious and tastefully decorated, with a lot of privacy as they are concealed by nature in the extensive grounds. The main house is lovely and overlooks a large swimming pool.

The atmosphere is calm, relaxed and serene. We loved our walks and cycle rides around the site!

The team in the restaurant - the food was delicious - did a great job, as did all the staff. 

For rest and relaxation in beautiful surroundings, Uga Ulagalla is absolutely top class!
title: What a beautiful, serene place!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Our meal at kamatha restaurant at Ulagalla was the most incredible experience. 

To dine in the middle of the Paddy Fields and experience exceptional traditional cuisine was an experience of a lifetime. 

Our Chef Manel and bar tender Dilshan looked after us as if we were family and added so so much to the experience. 

If there is one restaurant to visit in Sri Lanka this is it. 

Thank you for such an amazing personal experience. 🙏🏽❤️
title: Meal of a lifetime!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel, delicious food and most importantly incredible service! We stayed in one of the deluxe villas with a pool and we found it spotless, very well decorated and huge. Pool is huge and we loved having bikes to cycle from our room to the pool and restaurant. The food was probably one of the best on our two week tour. Thank you to the whole team for making our stay so wonderful! Highly recommend this luxurious hotel.
title: Luxurious hotel in a stunning setting

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Dieses Hotel erfüllt alle Wünsche. Sehr grosszügiger Bungalow in einem wunderschönen riesigen Park.
Das reichhaltige Frühstück und Abendessen sind ausgezeichnet und es hat für jeden etwas.
Das ganze Personal ist freundlich und hilfsbereit- wir wurden sehr verwöhnt!
title: Einzigartiges Hotel!!

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure to book your dinner at Kamatha!
text:
Lovely stay at Ulagalla! Stayed in Villa 21 - spacious layout, beautifully maintained and thoughtfully appointed one bedroom pool villa. A private pool overlooking a luscious landscape of foliage, we felt utterly lost in our own space while being surrounded luxuriously. I asked for a yoga mat to be delivered to the room so I could do a morning practice and couldn’t ask for a better backdrop!

The team has a focus on service and a not-to-miss is their Sri Lankan dinner at Kamatha! Chef Diluka has crafted a very special experience. Arriving through the paddy field with stars above it is a luxurious and yet authentic experience!!! 

We had a fabulous time here - visit the Elephant Resource Center on the property to learn more about what the hotel and villages are doing to cohabitate w the wild elephants!

Hope that we can come back soon!
title: Luxurious Stay at Ulagalla

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text:
Best Sri Lanka dining experience.  Authentic cuisine, atmosphere and host.  Diluka and her sister Manel are wonderful.  They offer tour of their kitchen and explain the different types of cooking instruments which are all authentic.  They provide so many dishes to try. 
The setting is truly memorable being in the middle of rice paddy field.  The rice you're eating actually comes from the field.
title: Best Authentic Sri Lanka Dining Experiencerience

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take time to enjoy just being there.
text: A glorious luxury retreat in the rice growing country outside Anuradhapura.  The choice is yours to either enjoy the privacy of your own villa or take up one of the many options offered to entertain you.  Monkeys and peacocks are the obvious wildlife but the elephants and not far away.
title: Luxurious Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Second visit to this amazing resort with the family, and thoroughly enjoyed the two night stay. The staff are well trained, welcoming and ever so eager to assist. The General Manager Dimuthu also made an extra effort to make our stay comfortable. Plenty of activities including bicycle rides, kayaking, archery, horse rides or if you want to relax, can do so in the comfort of the private plunge pool! The rooms are well maintained and the service levels are at the highest level. Food is amazing. Will surely come back. Thank you for the amazing experience and keep it up!
title: Truely a luxurious sanctuary

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: We left this morning after 5 nights in one of the 25 villas here and we were very sad to leave. This is a very special place. From the beauty of the natural surroundings to the spaciousness & creature comforts of the villas, no stone is left unturned to ensure a magical stay. The attention to detail and attentiveness of the staff is second to none, the service really is first class.Rarely if ever have we stayed somewhere where the staff are so invested in ensuring a first rate experience, we will miss their smiling faces and cheery greetings very much. Heartfelt thanks to the whole team.
title: A perfect stay

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Diluka welcomed us to her beautiful and authentic Sri Lankan kitchen, Karmata, the name for the rice harvest area in the centre of a paddy field. A wonderful peaceful setting, where she makes traditional delicious curries with fresh local ingredients, cooked and served with great skill and love. She takes pride in preparing and serving food in the traditional way. It is a memorable experience absolutely not to be missed.
title: Unique dining experience

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You do need to be able to manage stairs to go to the restaurant.
text: This hotel is a peaceful delight. Surrounded by jungle and wildlife you will be wonderfully looked after in your very comfortable villa.  The staff deserve a very special mention.  You are welcomed by the most cheerful and courteous reception staff, driven to your room by helpful, friendly and cheerful buggy drivers , if you call they will return you to the bar and restaurant where Robin and his utterly delightful and most excellent staff will look after you. Fabulous.
title: The most welcoming staff in the world

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: We had the most amazing time staying at Uga Ulagalla. We spent just 2 nights and could have stayed longer. Amazing staff who are so helpful and the food is delicious especially if you do the 'special' meal under the stars! Go and chat to Katharina - her knowledge about elephants is truly amazing! So much wildlife at this hotel. We weren't very lucky with the weather but it didn't spoil our fun!
title: 2 Night Stay with our family

placeInfo/address: Ulagalla Road, Thirappane 50072 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful and spacious property, surrounded by nature, ideal for relaxing. Tasty and plentiful meals. Despite sometimes slow or uncoordinated (we were a group of 12 guests), the service was kind and thoughtful. In the end we were gifted a lovely souvenir.
title: Wonderful enclosure

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Reviewer2011x,
Ayubowan from Anantara Tangalle, Sri Lanka! 
Thank you for taking the time to share such a heartfelt review of your stay at our Resort in Sri Lanka.
We’re delighted to hear that you found your room comfortable and especially enjoyed the bed—it’s always wonderful to know our guests are able to truly relax. Your kind words about Hashan mean the world to us; he is indeed a valued member of our team, and we’ll be sure to pass along your compliments. We’re especially pleased that he was able to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable given your mobility needs.
It’s also great to know you took advantage of the many activities we offer, from boating to our community garden project and evening ceremonies. The natural beauty and wildlife of our resort are something we are deeply proud of, and we're glad you had the opportunity to enjoy them.
Thank you once again for choosing to stay with us. We hope to welcome you back to Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle in Sri Lanka during the dry season so you can enjoy the sunshine and our stunning beach to the fullest.
Kind regards, 
Erik Billgren – General Manager
placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Probably go in the dry season August September October time if looking for dry hot weather. We went in may monsoon time.
text: Beautiful hotel. The room was lovely. Comfiest bed I’ve slept in. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly. Especially Hashan our room host. He was very polite helpful and friendly.  Lovely guy. Couldn’t do enough for us. Hashan was very easy to talk to. He spoke English very well. Room was clean and comfortable. Room service was great. Hashan took us everywhere by buggy. Which was a big help as we both have walking issues. Lots of  activities to do. Boating on the hotel lagoon, community garden project, evening sundown ceremony, spa, beach, and also lovey food. Location was beautiful. Lots of wildlife,  the gardens were kept beautifully. Very beautiful walks with lots of plants. Monsoon weather in may. Not that rainy. Probably better to go in August sept November dry season if looking for very hot weather beach weather.
title: Beautiful Peace Haven Hotel

placeInfo/address: Goyambokka Estate., Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: The best part of our stay had to be the service and kindness of the staff at Anantara in Tangalle. We have been around to many places but the hospitality and kindness of the employees here is truly exceptional. Thisari Navoda and Madhavee Seekhuge were very welcoming and enhanced our experience at Anatara. Sean, who arranges the dinners was great to us. We did our nature walk with Rashmi and she was very passionate about the animals and marine biology surrounding the resort. Shane from Tropic Surf was very helpful to us. There are so many others that I can’t recall the names of, such as the individuals from the Spa, or from the restaurants or from the shops. But everyone was amazing to us.  The private beach is beautiful. The views from the clifftop are breathtaking. Having dinner at the El Mare or just hanging out on the clifftop during the sunset is stunning. The infinity pool is great. The overall design and preservation of nature within the resort is a marvel.  For kids, there is a kids club and a game room. There is also a nature walk where they can see some of the animals in the resort. Overall, it’s spectacular and a must to visit this place.
title: Amazing get away

text:
This was our second visit to Anantara Tangalle, and once again, it was a lovely experience. The resort retains its serene charm with beautiful surroundings and warm, attentive service. A special thanks to Thisari for her exceptional hospitality. 

We couldn’t find an iron in the room, which we believe we had during our last stay. We’re not sure if there have been any changes, but adding this would be a nice touch. We also tried to order some cocktails from the pool bar, only to find that they weren't being served during the dates we stayed. However, this didn't take away from the overall experience. Everything else was just as perfect as we remembered. A special thanks for the lovely birthday cake. Again this is wonderful place to relax and unwind — we’re already looking forward to our next stay.
title: A wonderful place to relax and unwind, we celebrated a birthday!

text:
We had a wonderful stay at Anantara Tangalle. From booking the stay to our departure, everything was a seamless and memorable experience. We were greeted with a lovely gesture, and it was clear that a lot of effort had gone into making us feel welcome.

The rooms were very comfortable and had all the facilities we needed. Although the beach was a bit rough, we still enjoyed it. The pool was very relaxing and had ample space to swim around and chill.

Thisari was our host, and she was extremely helpful and clear with all her instructions. She was always reachable and assisted us in booking the nature walk and the canoe ride—which, to be honest, we might have skipped if she hadn’t convinced us. And what a great decision that turned out to be!

Suresh at the restaurant was also very helpful, friendly, and witty. He made sure we were having a good time and regularly checked if we needed anything. He even took our photos without any hesitation, which we really appreciated.

The nature walk was a lovely experience. Even though we are locals, it’s definitely a must-do—it gives you a fresh perspective on the surroundings and is also very informative. Konara, our guide, was punctual, friendly, and clearly passionate about what he does. Although he knew we were locals, he still made the walk engaging and interesting.

Overall, I would give a 10 out of 10 for the location, the people, the service, and the memories.
title: Was a wonderful experience. The location, cleanliness, people and the service was 10/10. Highly recommended.

text:
This place felt like a little piece of heaven in Sri Lanka, truly the perfect way to end our hectic journey after a week of exploring the island. 

We stayed at six hotels over nine days in Sri Lanka and experienced the warm hospitality the country is known for, but the staff at Anantara were exceptionally generous with their time—and their sincerity felt truly genuine. 

From the moment we arrived, we received a warm ceremonial welcome. The check-in process and tour of the grounds were handled with elegance, and our room was clean with a lovely view. 

A special shoutout to Ms. Thisari, who made our stay truly memorable. She was not only helpful but also thoughtful with every arrangement, going the extra mile to ensure we were comfortable throughout.

Suresh, one of the staff at Journey Restaurant, was also a delight. He greeted us with the biggest smile each morning at breakfast and was always attentive to our needs. During one of our dinners, another member of the waitstaff (I’m so sorry I didn’t catch your name!) noticed my husband sneezing and offered to brew us a pot of black tea with ginger and honey. The tea was delicious, but what touched us most was the attentiveness and sincerity behind the gesture.

One afternoon, while enjoying in-room dining in our garden, a beautiful peacock came and stayed with us until we finished our meal. It was one of the most magical moments of our trip.

Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle exceeded all our expectations and gave us the perfect ending to our Sri Lankan adventure. Highly recommended!

Best,
June W.
title: A Perfect Paradise to End Our Sri Lankan Journey!

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Plan your itinerary to fit with the scheduled seaplane flights. They only arrive in the plantation area during the AM from Colombo
text:
This was our first visit to Sri Lanka, which we were looking forward to as part of our winter tour including Maldives, Sri Lanka, Thailand and a return to the cold UK through Oman and Quatar.
Ceylon Tea Trails comprise five individual tea planter bungalows situated in the very beautiful mountain tea plantation area south of Hatton in Central Sri Lanka. It can be either easy to reach, or difficult dependent upon how you travel. The easiest route is to take the floatplane from Colombo airport. The aircraft touches down on Castlereagh Lake at 4,000 feet above sea level after about 30minutes flight time. The most difficult alternative is via road, taking between 4 and 5 hours dependent on conditions. If the mountain weather prevents visual air operations, then the only option available is the road journey. We were luckily able to make the journey by air and its truly spectacular. Descending into the valley the green velvet plantation tapestry is strikingly beautiful, this added an exciting and dramatic feature to our visit.
The planter bungalows are situated about 40minutes drive from one another, each with their own manager, butler, chef and service team. We had been assigned to stay at the Tiantsin bungalow, the original building of the five established in 1888 and named after the original town in China from where the first tea plants were imported. The area is steeped in colonial history from this period. During the journey from lake to bungalow we were fascinated to stop at the Anglican Christ Church of Warleigh and experience the original almost 200 year pipe organ being casually played by a fellow visitor, this brought quite an emotional sentiment. On  arrival at the Tiantsin the gardens display an array of colour, layed out and manicured resembling a Thames Valley English summer garden.
We were welcomed by our butler with a refreshing juice and introduced to our Chef who discussed our gastronomic preferences. The service here is all about providing a truly bespoke tailored experience. As the guest, you can set the time table and routine and the chef will volunteer the wide array of ingredients for the lunch and dinner, with afternoon tea in between should you wish.
The rooms are traditionally furnished and generally spacious with access to garden terraces. Curiously for me they had a familiar “Scottish” ambience. Internet connectivity functions well, despite an amusing absence of room telephone, such apparatus being replaced by a bedside call button. Using this retro technology one press for a couple of seconds and our butler would be at the suite entrance in moments to meet our needs.
During our three day stay we enjoyed walking along the plantation trails where we met many locals, we visited the Norwood Bungalow where their chef entertained us for a morning curry cooking course, and visited Norwood shopping street. We didn’t get time to enjoy the swimming pool and hot tub, but I did spend a relaxing afternoon with a Cuban cigar amongst the array of birdlife  in the garden, note its essential to bring your own cigars as they are not available for purchase anywhere in Sri Lanka.
Only suggestion we might make, and on a positive note would be to provide a modest wild flower arrangement within the room on arrival, perhaps adding a feminine touch. Could easily be sourced from the abundance of wild and cultivated flowers in the bungalow gardens.
As we depart for our next destination, Wild Coast Tented Safari Lodge, the striking elements of CTT are the quality of food and service which is to the level expected in a Michelin star establishment, served in a beautiful mountain area with very intimate personal service.
With thanks to the G.M. Chandana, Clement, and at Tiantsin our  Chef Jines, butlers Ajith and Nesa, and young room assistant Kesvan who ignited the log fireplace in our room each night, it’s been a travel experience we will remember for our lifetime.
title: Not to be missed for a gourmet traveller

roomTip: Make the most of the location. Dine or lunch at some of the other bungalows.. Look up what activities are available before you go and plan!
text: Popularised by Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder in "Amazing Hotels..." this is a quintessentially Anglo-Asian hotel set in the tea plantations of Sri Lanka. Once you get out of Hatton (many, like us arrive from Sandy by train, getting off at Hatton which is a filthy place) the road winds up into the hills and the hotel itself is comprised of several different bungalows all similar but each with its own individual charm.  We stayed in Castlereagh which is by the lakeshore and we had lunch one day at Dunkeld which is about half an hour's walk up the hill (they will drive you if you don't feel like walking but for the active it is an easy and lovely walk). The TV programme was a little misleading. We thought that the bungalows would be set on a private estate and although separated by quite a distance in some cases, but we were not really expecting there to be so many villages and people also in the vicinity. It is not entirely tranquil and there can be quite a lot of noise from the extended call to prayer to some extraordinary noise if you happen to encounter a Buddhist festival. Fireworks into the night are quite commonplace. That being said it is a very charming place with lots of colonial (between the wars) feel and the service is superb. Monica Galetti's humorous "Today's breakfast menu is..... whatever you want" is also misleading. You have to decide what you want the evening before, whether Sri Lankan breakfast or Western. The food is, however, sublimed the level of service second to none. We only had two nights here and I think we could have had a week and not geo bored. From the serene swimming pool to the hot tub overplayed by a very proprietorial white bellied eagle the ambience was lovely. There were lots of birds to see in the garden and a kayak excursion on the lake was great. Thrown in is a complimentary tour of the the factory which is, after all, the whole raison d'être of the area. Picturesque, calm luxury is how I would best describe this hotel which actually feels more like a holiday cottage with staff than a real hotel.
title: Luxury with a very colonial feel.

roomTip: Be prepared for some rain during the day. The weather forecasts are very inaccurate but the rain came at a predictable time each day.
text:
We spent three nights in the Norwood Bungalow, one of five bungalows in the Tea Trails.  We also had lunch at two other bungalows: Castlereagh and Tientsim.  All of the bungalows are impeccably presented - beautifully presented, well-maintained with polished floors, crisp linen, hot water, lovely gardens, breathtaking views, a swimming pool…. and most of all, wonderful staff who are professional and courteous.  The food is outstanding in both quality and variety.  

We toured the nearby Dunkeld Tea Processing Centre and were looked after by Bernard, who explained the history of the tea trade and the processes for making tea, from growing the bushes through harvesting the crop, sorting and rolling the leaves, producing the loose leaf tea and pancaking it for auction.  Fascinating.
title: Enjoying everything to do with tea

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was out first stop of our honeymoon and it was the most tranquil peacful start to our trip. We stayed in Dunkeld bungalow and it was beautiful, very clean and the staff were all so attentive and friendly. Our Butlers Samantha, Priyantha and both house attendants Sathsara and Varun were excellent and made our stay really enjoyable. The food is excellent too. We walked from our bungalow to another one for lunch and the staff and food were equally as delicious there. 

Whilst we were there we did a guided walk with our very knowledgable and friendly guide Wasantha. We also went out on the lake for a kayak ride and our guide Dhanushka was also extremely knowledgeable and friendly. 

I could not recommend this hotel more! I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing hotels as my father was the founder of Small Luxury Hotels and this is up there in the top 5 hotels I've been to.
title: Beautiful hotel, amazing staff and delicious food.

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: When you plan to stay in one of the 5 bungalows of Ceylon Tea Trails, we think Summerville is placed in the most beautiful surroundings
text: We stayed in the Summville Estate with only 5 rooms. It was in our opinion the most beautiful landscape we have seen during our 23days trip around Sri Lanka, with all the tea plantations which surround the lake, just few steps below, where they offer you a free transfer accross the lake to the other Tea Trail Estate. We had a beautiful but too short time there with an excellent chef serving you local or international food at its best. Thanks to our butler Dasun and the entire team who made our stay so memorable. Marcel & Nelida
title: Pittoresque and beautiful stay in  Sri Lanka's UNESCO Central Highlands

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
text: Brilliant morning. Guide was interesting and informed, in both tea tour and factory visit, and quite engaging in his approach. Would highly recommend.  Takes in culture and a perspective on Sri Lankan life on a tea plantation over the ages.
title: Tea Trail

placeInfo/address: Hatton Road, Lethant 22000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book a room. Or facing the entrance as cars come to pick up for the Adam’s Peak at one in the morning
text:
A beautiful bungalow, with privat garden . The bathroom is very big and has all you would need. A bathtub as well as a shower. The bedroom has a very good size and is comfortable with two armchairs and direct access to the privat garden which has lounge-chairs. 
The way up by car is narrow and windy but one sees lots of the tea plantations. 
The manager is very good and respectful. He teaches his staff well. Breakfast can be served outside or inside. 
Only comment is that there is no menu to choose from and one has to know what one chooses from the chefs choice of the day.
title: Beautiful bungalow

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room 2 was fabulous.
text:
Fabulous 3 night stay at W15. Amazing location with wonderful team taking care of us.

We have just left our stay at W15. Our room, number 2, was large, spotlessly clean with a separate shower and roll top bath, we had our own lounge and French windows opening onto our private garden. 

Nothing was too much trouble for all the team and we were looked after by an amazing team of butlers, Sheriff, Hastha, Prabod and Navod. They were wonderful and we cannot praise them enough. 

To celebrate our wedding anniversary they surprised us with a delicious cake. They also arranged a special dinner with a separate table for two in the garden for us. It was a lovely experience and one we will never forget.

We went out on a wildlife ride in their open top vintage land rover defender.. Our guide was Banuka and he showed us leopard paw prints and claw scratches on trees. He was very informative about the landscape, wildlife and local tea picking. 

Nighttime turn down service included a hot water bottle if you need it. 

We highly recommend the hotel. It is in a peaceful location with a wonderful view and fabulous team. 

Room number 2 was wonderful 

Thank you to all the team.
title: Fabulous hotel with amazing team to take care of you. A must stay when visiting Kandy.
