roomTip: Take in those gorgeous views, slow down and enjoy (and wear spf even when it is cloudy)
text:
Exceptional service, paradise views

My partner and I enjoyed a 4 night stay at W15 Hanthana Estate, and we already miss being there. This place really exceeded our expectations: The views are unbelievable, we spent hours just soaking it all in from different spots around the property. It’s the perfect place to come to stillness after lots of active travel.

The whole team made our stay wonderful, from the incredible food to the warmth of every interaction. We honestly wouldn’t have had the same experience without them. The butlers are amazing, anticipating our needs before we even realised them ourselves. Manjula is such a gem, bringing warmth, cheer, and genuine care in his service. Navod was also fantastic – he has a great sense of humor and made us feel right at home. A highlight of the stay was our morning hike with Naturalist Aju. His knowledge of the area’s nature but also history and culture made the hike more than a simple excursion (which in itself was gorgeous). Special mention goes to General Manager, Sidath, who went above and beyond with thoughtful touches throughout our stay. We felt like we were treated more like family than guests and hope to return with our family one day. ps. Our last evening at W15 will be one we always remember ❤️
title: Exceptional service above the clouds

ownerResponse/text:
Dear DanielcL6659XP, 

Thank you for the absolutely heartwarming and beautifully detailed review! We are beyond thrilled to hear that your stay at W15 Hanthana was such a special and unforgettable experience for your entire family. From the misty valley views and sumptuous High Tea with Navod to the breathtaking hikes with Bhanuka and the once-in-a-lifetime wildlife encounters—including a rare leopard sighting!—it truly sounds like an adventure to cherish forever.

We love that your little explorers had so much fun hunting for treasure, spotting wildlife, and even mastering Sri Lankan cooking with Chef Rasika! And of course, unwinding with a G&T while the kids caught fireflies by the fire—what a perfect way to end the day.

Your kind words about Sidath, Navod, Bhanuka, Puvi, and the whole team mean the world to us, and we can't wait to welcome you all back for more magical moments. Thank you for sharing your experience—it truly captures the essence of W15 Hanthana! 

Warm regards, 
Team W15 Hanthana Estate
placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: What an incredible lifetime experience - so difficult to put our awe into words but I will try!  The attention to detail, the staff who all went above and beyond and the sense of space and beauty Hanthana offered us was out of this world.  When we arrived in Hanthana (wife, myself; 11yo, 9yo & 5yo in tow) we were treated to not only a spectacularly misty view over the valley, but a sumptuous High Tea; expertly served by Navod who talked us through the variety of teas we could choose from. Obviously, being in the center of one of the most renowned tea areas in the world has its benefits! W15 were happy to suggest and organise a variety of trips for us and not only did the nearby town of Kandy have a wide selection of cultural trips to partake in (Notably the Buddhist Tooth Relic Temple); but the surrounding wilderness offered stunning walks and experiences. Bhanuka, the hotel's resident naturalist took us on a wonderful hike up the mountainside, through the tea plantations. It was perfectly manageable for our 5 year old and I would highly recommend as he talked us through the flora and fauna and excited all 3 children with his stories. It was so good that our 5 year old had to be carried off the mountain as he was too busy looking for buried treasure! Another highlight was the 'Rock Bar' where Navod, our personal butler (!), Bhanuka and Puvi, took us up in the hotel's Land Rover Defender to explore some of the trails and find a local lookout where Navod expertly setup a portable bar to create cocktails and mocktails in the great outdoors. A wonderful setting for me and my wife to enjoy the peace and tranquility and a playground for the children who were busy building dens and hunting for crystals with Bhanuka.  It was like our own personal childcare in the wild!  A firm favourite with the children.   Our guides also spotted a range of wild animals including an eagle, a barking deer and a LEOPARD!  Apparently this was exceptionally rare!  Our final day saw Rasika, the Executive Chef, treat us to a cooking course of local curry dishes where the children took the reins and created a wonderful lunchtime spread. Whilst it was a wonderfully busy couple of days, it was always a pleasure returning to our rooms before the evening meal, being able to soak in the bath and then retire to the veranda for a G&T whilst the children caught fireflies and drank hot chocolates by the fires. So many other wonderful touches to these days - the idyllic pool, the visit to the Tea Museum, the gigantic treehouse swing overlooking the valley, the local tea menu and lobster for lunch.  The list is endess as these are only the highlights.  Fantastic. Many thanks to Sidath and the team, we will be back!
title: One of the most special and unique family experiences

placeInfo/address: No. 947,Uduwela Road, Udugama West,, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I remember as a kid running around these tea plantations and spending my summer holidays in these hills. I returned to this area after two decades of living outside of the country and I was blown away with what they have done, an unbelievable transformation but yet, very traditional, clam and serene. Took me straight back to that childhood and those lovely memories. 

If you want to experience what Sri Lanka is all about, I highly suggest visiting here. It's very close to one of the major tourist locations, "Kandy Temple" and you will really get the experience of living in a tea plantation. Take a plantation tour in their beautiful truck and you will be transported into a whole different world, filled with happiness and tranquility. The place is breathtaking and  friendliness of the staff truly is amazing. 

Manjula, Hastha, Navod and Prabad helped us through our stay and their commitment to make this place, our visit a memorable one is worth the mention. I was there with my partner, his parents and my mom and these guys were so helpful explaining the transformation of the bungalow and wildlife preservations to them. Thank you to all of you for this amazing experience
title: Tranquility of a real Tea Plantation

title: Accueil, restaurant, cadre, calme, hébergement, Parfait ! Un grand bravo à vous.

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: What a beautiful and welcoming place! From the moment you are warmly welcomed (thank you Druzell!) until the moment you sadly need to leave, everything about Uga Chena Huts is enjoyable. The name “Huts” really is an understatement for the very spacious cabanas, each with private plunge pool. The food was lovely and each member of staff is SO friendly! Of special note were Kasun (waiter) and of course our very friendly, knowledgeable and experienced safari guide Janith. THANK you for a fantastic experience!!!
title: Beautiful Safari Lodge

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
What an experience. Arrived to a personal welcome - placing flag of UK on the board to see the International appeal. The room was beautiful and very spacious - one of the 4 new rooms with own pool. 
Golf buggies whisk you from room to reception although it’s fine to walk during the daytime.  
We were assigned a butler who was always on hand and couldn’t do enough for us - the mini bar miniature wines didn’t quite cut it and appreciated the full size bottle exchange!
The chef needs special mention. Incredible food and very grateful to him for the curry cooking lesson. The blackened curries are superb. 
Drinks on the beach were a special treat at sunset (although a wandering elephant prevented this on night 2!) 
Special mention also for grilled lobster dish 
The general manager always attentive and friendly making sure everything just right. 
Rangers are very knowledgeable - ours qualified in S Africa
The safari drive also very well organised in excellent Toyota go anywhere vehicle - leopard eventually seen after much deep jungle road exploring ! The hotel even pays for “fast track” 
Any criticism ? Only one very minor- the all inclusive wine only just acceptable. For an extra £5-£10 a bottle purchase price could improve this as did let down the meal slightly. Think cloudy bay standard to really up the game    
Not a complaint but hope this helps. 
Thanks for everyone.
title: Excellent Hotel. Room, staff, location, safari and the cuisine. Really 6* in all regards

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Wir verbrachten zwei Nächte in dieser weitläufigen Anlage. Das Personal - sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Das Essen - fantastisch. Die Safari - exklusiv und professionell. Das Bungalow - riesig, die Beleuchtung unzureichend. Grundsätzlich ist die ganze Anlage in die Jahre gekommen und entspricht niemals einem fünf Sterne-Standard. Es fehlt an Flair und der Unterhalt und die Sauberkeit lassen sehr zu wünschen übrig. Preis-Leistung stimmen überhaupt nicht. Masslos überteuert!
title: Überteuert

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Chenga Huts was excellent, the food was some of the best we ate during our tour of Sri Lanka and the staff were kind and accommodating.
The huts themselves were very well appointed and very luxurious. Particular mention must go to Dan our safari guide whose excellent local knowledge really enhanced our experiance.
title: All round excellence

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The food is beyond brilliant.  Even if you’re on safari twice a day, try not to miss a meal! The variety, freshness and deliciousness !!!!!
text: Faultless. Perfect. Just a beautiful experience in every way. The Huts are actually breath taking. The service and food beyond expectation and the safari experience once-in-a-lifetime.  If you can go to Uga Chena Huts, don’t hesitate. It’s magnificent.
title: A touch of perfection in a paradise setting.

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: The closest resort to Yala National Park - an elephant wandered through the resort during dinner! Plus all inclusive meals, drinks and safaris with professional guides, amazing food, wonderful and welcoming staff, spacious and very comfortable villas and an incredible location. The National Park is letting in too many vehicles some days but by staying here you get in sooner, can go more than once and avoid the long queue of other vehicles. We loved our stay and highly recommend including it in your itinerary.
title: Unique, luxury, all inclusive and close to the action!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book in advance because it gets booked
text: This place is by far one of our best experiences. The rooms were amazing, great customer service and good food! Perfect get away for some peace and quiet. We will definitely be back. We loved our welcome, the front desk was friendly and helpful!
title: Breataking weekend

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our fifth stay at Chena Huts and the place gets better year on year which you would have thought impossible. The it itself was amazing as always and the views incredible. We enjoyed a number of safaris and a bush walk. We saw leopards on both which was so beautiful and amazing for us. The management arranged a surprise sundowner for us on a secret beach with was a lovely touch.

This place is magical because of the team who both work within and who manage it. The new resident manager Nissanka is so approachable and cheerful and always around to talk about your day and how your stay is going. There is a new front office manager Druzelle who is an amazing addition to the team and like the Resident Manager she is always available and bright and cheery.

Our star as always is Vibushana who was once again our ranger for the third year running. He managed to find us some leopards on a safari and a bush walk and we loved his company.

We will be back next December and until then we will all the staff a lovely Xmas and new year
title: Best Yala Safari resort

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay 3nights or longer so you have time to relax.
text:
This place is amazing.  From the moment we arrived to leaving (2 nights) the stay was absolutely perfect.  The food was delicious.  We stayed in the new huts that had everything you needed and more! They were clean, private and perfectly decorated with comfortable beds.  
The private pool was refreshing and private.  We swam every time we were back at the hut.  

Our driver and national park guide were very skilled and informative.  Our driver manoeuvred us in prime perdition to view the animals.  He took us into parts of the park that most drivers could not therefore we got to see the elusive leopard !
title: Amazing !

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Fabulous! Situation, Ambience, Position (edge of Yala Safari Park & Ocean) 
But the STAFF take it all to a level of excellence - Hospitality cuisine, service & then Janith & ‘Cheese’ our expert safari Guide & Driver made Safari dreams happen
title: Sri Lankan Safari Par Excellance

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Es war unglaublich schön !
Wir waren zwei Nächte im Uga Chena Huts und würden sofort wieder gehen.
Personal und Service hervorragend. Essen sehr lecker und extrem vielseitig.
Die Bungalows wind wunderschön in der Natur eingebettet. Leider kann man im Meer nicht baden, weil der Wellengang zu hoch ist, bzw.  es dann zu gefährlich ist. 
Das Ambiente macht es jedoch wieder gut.
title: Wir haben es extrem genossen

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Wow, what a fabulous boutique resort with only 15 private huts with plunge pools! The “huts” were spacious and high end. The resort also offered amazing food, an unbeatable location with access to a lake, the ocean, and Yala National Park, and lovely people who offered great service! The safaris were also wonderful. 5 stars just isn’t enough to describe Uga Chena Huts.
title: 5-Star Plus Experience

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing setting and facilities. The  staff were just fantastic. We loved the pre dinner sunset drinks overlooking the magnificent wild, natural beach.. being in such a luxurious place but with wildlife all around you is magic. We also loved the family of monkeys that came to see us off! 😂🐒
title: Luxury & pure nature

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Savor every moment.
text:
Without any doubt Chena Huts offered us one of the most incredible experiences of my 35 years of travels around the world.  Location, quality of the accommodation, staff, food, views, details, amenities, the safari guides and of curse the incredible wildlife and nature made every moment so, so special. It was truly the most remarkable experience.  
Uga Chena Huts is a collection of large half dome “huts” connected by elevated meandering path protected by thick vegetation.  The resort is located along a deserted beach facing the Indian ocean at the border of the Yala Wildlife reserve, one of the marvels of biodiversity of the world. 
The rooms are wonderful: large, unusual and architecturally interesting. The Huts all feature an open concept with large bathrooms, an incredibly spacious room filled with amenities, a wonderful deck (ours was overlooking the ocean) and a private plunge pool. During our stay we had a colony of playful, lovely monkeys living on the dome and we woke up to an elephant “nibbling” at the fresh leaves in the bushes right in front of our deck!!!!  It does not get any better than that. It was truly like living in a dream.
The restaurant and bar occupy two separate structures on the beach connected by a deck  with views of the Indian ocean. The food is very high quality, delicious and varied and the staff makes the place even more special.  
Everyone, from Indhi to the restaurant staff, was incredibly attentive, warm, welcoming and made us feel truly at home.  
Chena Huts has a team of naturalist guides on staff that lead the safaris. During our stay we took two safaris inside Yala with an exceptionally knowledgeable guide and super nice human! Yala is pure beauty.  Every corner, every view, every tree, field, lake and of course animal is just incredible and will leave you speechless. 
We saw leopards, elephants so close that I would have never imagined, a bear (!), water buffalos, deer, toucans, all sorts of birds, wild boars…..it was simply the adventure of a lifetime and every moment exceeded the previous one. Simply magical!! Hope to be back some day.
title: Simply magical!!

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Uga CHENA Huts 

A masterful combination of eco sustainable luxury in a harmonious coexistence with nature

Words will not do justice to this beauty hotel.

Everything was perfect!
The kindness of the staff! From reception, restaurant and bar, to the safari rangers, all work together in perfection like a well tuned orchestra to make you stay memorable.

Staying here is an all inclusive luxury experience. From gourmet meals, to sunset drinks with ocean views and safari drives with experienced rangers, all is taken care for. There are so many more details that this hotel will include in your stay, but I want make any more spoilers.

We had an ocean view cabin. These safari tent inspired rooms are luxurious. Beautifully simulating local huts but including all the amenities you could wish for in a five star hotel. The cabins are fully blended with nature and you might wake up to squirrels trying to invade or elephants strolling by. Make sure to follow staff recommendations keeping doors closed and not seeking direct contact with wild life.

Chena Huts has a lot of useful information on their website and we emailed them previously to our booking in order do make the most of our stay.

If we return to Sri Lanka we will definitely return to Chena Huts!
title: A masterful combination of eco sustainable luxury in a harmonious coexistence with nature

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Uga Chena Huts was nothing short of extraordinary! The combination of luxury, nature, and impeccable service made it a truly unforgettable experience.  

A highlight of our visit was the sundowner on the beach—watching the sunset with a refreshing drink in hand, surrounded by the beauty of the coastline, was absolutely magical. We also had the privilege of seeing the resident elephant and even a mother and baby elephant during our safari, which added to the special memories of the trip.  

The staff were exceptional, always going the extra mile to ensure we felt welcomed and cared for. Thank you to the entire team for making our stay so memorable. We can’t wait to return!
title: Magical

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
I may struggle to put into words just how much we have enjoyed the last few days staying at Uga Chenna Huts. It was deservedly voted best small hotel in the world in 2023 and as far as I’m concerned it may well receive that honour again in 2024. The standard of everything is literally top notch. Most of all the whole team as individuals and collectively genuinely make you feel as though you and your friends and family are the most important people in the world. 

Let’s start with the welcome - outstanding. 

We went on two visits to the National Park and our Ranger was so knowledgable and enlightening we all feel we have learnt a huge amount and to some extent experienced it for ourselves. We witnessed nature in action, close up in the form of Crocodiles spotting and securing their supper of wild boar. Horrible but fascinating to watch but impossible not to as we saw it live so to speak. We saw so many elephants, leopards, water buffalo and other animals and birds and received a terrific explanation of how things are working g in the national park. 

Our bedroom was literally fabulous and I believe all are the same and of the same high standard with incredibly comfortable beds and each with a completely private plunge pool and terrace. I will share pics. 

Each evening we were hosted to sundowners on the beach with delicious nibbles made there and then. 

The restaurant and the service is outstanding with a good selection of western and Sri Lankan dishes. 

Communal pool is beautiful with a waterfall if you wish and drinks served if you so choose. 

I literally cannot recommend Uga Chenna Huts highly enough if you are visiting Sri Lanka and can stretch your budget then do so with confidence.
title: Voted the best small hotel in the world in 2023 - for very good reasons

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms 1 and 3 have a sea view
text: This has to be one of the best hotels we’ve ever stayed at. Everything about it is amazing. The staff are all charming, polite and very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The rangers leading the included game drives were very knowledgeable and  excellent at spotting and identifying the multitude of birds and animals. The resort is right on the edge of the reserve and we were visited by monkeys,buffalo and an elephant. There is an excellent choice of both Sri Lankan and international food. Words are not enough to describe the wonderful place. Thank you to everyone for making our stay so memorable.
title: Not to be missed

placeInfo/address: Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Uga Chena Huts war eines der besten Hotels in dem wir waren. 
Unglaublich schöne Cabins, das Personal ist super freundlich und das Essen der Wahnsinn! Die safaris sind natürlich ein absolutes Muss und die guides sind sehr erfahren! 
Eine absolute 12 von 10!
title: TRAUMURLAUB!!!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent stay, food, beach. Marvelously smooth sea in bay, perfect for swimming. Staff are attentive and very friendly. Highly recommended for relaxing on Sri Lanka’s east coast, whether you’re alone, a couple or a family. Polonnaruva is also within easy reach to visit.
title: Great beach hotel!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Generally tip for Sri Lanka ,alcohol  is expensive,take as much duty free with you as you can if you have a favourite tipple.
text:
Very attentive staff,nice rooms,great part (best part) of the beach,Non of the other hotels had as good a section the beach , the beach attendants and beach bar staff where all very good. Good house keeping also by Balash.The grounds where we'll attended.
However, first impressions mean alot, the greeting area in the foyer /bar  is looking dated and a bit scruffy,could do with an update.Prices of food and drink are more than similar Hotels such as Sun Siam. We visited a few other hotels for dinning to give us some variation.We would recommend only b and b basis to encourage  you to try alternative hotels at night.Short walk along the beach or tuck tuck to Sun Siam 300lkr.Also everywhere else had some form of entertainment on (music),nothing  at Uga.
Non of the other hotels had as good a section of beach and the beach so would likely still choose Uga on that basis.
Only reason for 4 not 5 was condition of main foyer and bar and food prices for the quality of food and drink offered
title: A few improvements needed

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Uga Bay was amazing. It was great to escape winter and enjoy the sun. From the moment we checked in the staff were so welcoming and attentive to every need, making us feel truly comfortable. The luxurious room was unbelievably clean, with stunning views of the beach, and the high-quality amenities were amazing. The on-site dinning was superb, with a diverse menu and impeccable service.
The staff were incredibly friendly. Dasun Guest Relations made sure that we were comfortable, he went out of the way to bring both Chefs outside to talk to us, when we wanted specific Sri Lankan food. Executive Indika, and Sous Chef Lakmal spoke to us every single day took the order from us and cooked all what we wanted for dinner.
Assistant F&B Manager Sajeevu would always talk to us to make sure we are enjoying our stay. Went out of the way to setup a table separately for us to enjoy a nice family dinner Privately.
Anoja the receptionist and the others at the reception were always smiling and checked on us to make sure we were comfortable with our stay.
Anura the Barman (great sense of humour) and his assistants served us special drinks and was always happy to talk to us every evening when we came out for a drink or for a tea. I do not remember everyone's name, but honestly the entire staff were so pleasant and friendly.
I have no words to describe how happy we were during our stay. I would choose this hotel again specially for the entire staff who is always smiling, and we can't wait to return for another unforgettable experience.
title: Best Place To Be

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Uga Bay in Sri Lanka was simply outstanding! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm hospitality and impeccable service.  

A highlight of our trip was Nimal, one of the hotel's taxi drivers. He is not only an excellent driver but also a wonderful guide. His deep knowledge of the area and professionalism made every journey a pleasure. 
He always ensured a safe and comfortable ride on the day trips which were organized by the hotel.  

The service at the restaurant and bar was also fantastic! Sajeevu, one of our waiters, was incredibly attentive, always greeting us with a smile and making sure we had everything we needed. His recommendations were excellent, and his friendly personality made dining even more enjoyable.  

Anura, one of the bartenders,  deserves praise as well. His company was always very pleasant and he took a great interest in the guests. He always proved to be a very good conversationalist.

Beyond the outstanding staff, the hotel itself is a dream – breathtaking beach views, luxurious rooms, and delicious food. 

Highly recommended!
title: Exceptional Stay at Uga Bay – A True Paradise!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Мы были в отели в период с 27.02.2025 по 08.03.2025. Я мало где видела отзывы в период февраль-март, поэтому поделюсь своим мнением.

Погода. Прогноз погоды показывал грозы и дожди и запаслась настолками, чтобы не скучать в номере. Но оказалось все не так страшно. Дождь шел 15 минут 2 раза в день (честное слово) а дальше был рай, тепло (я ходила в шертах и футболке спокойно), влажно и пасмурно (если любите дикую жару и сонцепек вам может не понравится) Но я как уральский человек тяжело переношу сильную жару, поэтому была в диком восторге от погоды. В этот период мы гуляли по пляжу и окрестностям, наслаждались природой и отелем. Флаг был красный и мы купались в бассейне, хотя были и те кто купался в море. Но сгореть я умудрилась и через тучки 😁 на 4 день выглянуло солнце и начались дни купания на море, оно было теплое как парное молоко, вода голубенькая, песок белый. Пляж охраняемых и очень красивый. В общем, для себя отмечу это период сезоном для курорта Пасикуда острова Шри-Ланка 🫶

Про отель 🤔 Я выбирала между 3 отелями.
Первый был дороже, но у него были сложности с заходом в море. Сегодня прогулялись до него и правда, заход весь в обломках кораллов, хотя сам по себе отель красивый. 

Второй был дешевле и находится прямо рядом с нашим, но по отзывам там уставшие номера. Тоже сходила, посмотрела, визуально менее эффектный чем наш, но вполне уютный. 

А в этот отель я влюбилась с первых фото и окончательное решение мне помог принять высокий рейтинг отеля!! Я не ожидала, что такие рейтинги вообще бывают на более чем 2000 отзывов. 

Номера. Очень просторные и красивые. Уборка 2 раза в день 😱 без напоминаний, все было идеально чисто. У каждого дома стоит дерево Плюмерии, цветы, которого безумно вкусно пахнут. По утрам поют птицы.
Все номера стоят таким образом, что вы точно будете видеть кусочек море и много красивой зелени. 
 
Еда. Очень вкусная еда. Мы брали завтраки и ужины и для нас это было более чем достаточно. Я даже немного поправилась. 
Утром шведский стол (напитки входят в стоимость) Вечером у нас было по меню, но нереально вкусно и красиво. Бывали острые блюда, но вы можете перед заказом поговаривать, что не хотите острое и вам будут делать не острое 😁 все просто. Напитки оплачиваются отдельно (но это стандартно) вам приносят чеки, вы их подписываете и оплачиваете все при выезде.

Пляж. Не ну это просто рай!!! Прекрасный, широкий пляж. Который каждый день чистят. Белый песок, голубая водичка. Насколько я знаю белый песок не распространен на Шри-Ланке. А здесь именно он.

Территория.  Безумно зеленая, красивая. Бассейн, который визуально уходит в море. У лежаков бассейна вместо зонтиков изгородь из живых растений 💘 

Персонал. Я нигде не встречала настолько ответсвенных и доброжельных и отзывчивых людей. Ты прямо чувствуешь заботу и понимание со стороны КАЖДОГО сторудника. Все улыбаются, но не навязчивы. Я всегда выбираю отели 4-5* и очень критична к ним. Чаще отели мне не нравятся, чем наоборот, но тут даже я не нашла к чему придраться 🫶

Отель заботится о природе и не использует пластик. Все из бамбука, картона и бумаги, что тоже украшает имидж отеля.

Как оказалось отель Uga имеет целую сеть на Шри-Ланке. И я уже запланировала отдых в один из них.
title: Лучший отель. Очень рекомендую.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Ein tolles Hotel für alle, die Ruhe und Entspannung suchen. Unglaublich aufmerksames und freundliches Personal machte unseren Aufenthalt besonders schön. Allerdings sollte man wissen, dass die Anfahrt vom Flughafen ca. 6 Stunden dauert. Aber der weite Weg lohnt sich auf jeden Fall. Es gibt viel zu sehen unterwegs.
title: Klare Empfehlung

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The photos don’t do justice to the hotel - we weren’t sure what to expect but were blown away on arrival. The huge gates on the road open to a long and beautiful vista through a short tunnel, over the waterfeature and the swimming pool to the sea and it only gets better from there. 
We were  lucky enough to have room 44 which is only a couple of metres from the beautiful beach, the food is beautifully presented and imaginative and the staff were incredibly friendly and obliging - nothing was too much trouble.
title: Absolutely fabulous

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Super Hotel aber die Anreise vom Flughafen ist ca. 6Stunden mit dem Taxi.
text:
Super Hotel, Sehr freundliches Personal,schöner Strand ,gutes Essen und immer sauber (schöne Grüße an Shen Jerom…Koch und Zeichner.)Gesamtpaket 5 Sterne plus.
Traumhafter Urlaub.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
title: Super Hotel 5 Sterne ⭐️ plus.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Eine Wohlfühloase. Die Ruhe und Gelassenheit ist überall gegenwertig. Hochklassige Speisen und erstklassiger Service runden einen 3-wöchigen Urlaub positiv ab. Die Sauberkeit im Zimmerbereich und in der gesamten Anlage nebst Strandbereich sind Pluspunkte dieser Anlage.
title: FirstClass

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Very nice and friendly staff
The rooms are cleaned twice a day
The bed, linen and pillows are so nice and soft that even after you get sunburned it is very pleasant to sleep on them
Every morning, when I went to meet the sunrise, the gardeners, the guys who take care of the cleanliness of the territory and the beach from 5 am were already working like bees and at the same time the kitchen started working, which by 7 am prepared an excellent breakfast for us🙏By the way, when it comes to food, there is a huge selection of food, European cuisine and you can also try their local, which of course I spoiled myself with😊Everything is very fresh, waiters fly around you and constantly take care of you. By the way, even the chef sometimes approaches the guests and asks if everything is in order. The manager gathers the staff every evening before dinner and talks with them, apparently about the organization of everything, so everything works as it should watches. each of the service staff, from cleaners to managers, everyone greets you with a smile and asks how are you? what day have you had? they are interested in whether you are enjoying your vacation or everything is comfortable for you. I write a lot, because during my 10 days of vacation, I observed the details of the human attitude of the staff to the guests. they do not treat, because this is according to the rules, they have a soul and heart, they are really interested in you! They tell you and offer different opportunities, what you can see in their country or where it is better to go, what you need to pay attention to, and this is not for money, but just like that, without expecting anything in return! Everything is super in the hotel, I really liked it, I will be glad to return to them 🙏 the only thing you need to pay attention to if you choose this country is that you need to count on the fact that their alcohol is imported, that is why the price is high, plus they have a service percentage plus more something, so when you order something, it's better to clarify the final cost, so that you won't be surprised by the bills later😊But this didn't affect my wonderful vacation in this country in any way. Plus I got there on Valentine's Day, here of course the staff tried very hard to show the guests how they prepared for this day😊I'll definitely give photos and videos below.
title: I have extremely good impressions and I wrote everything else above in the reviews

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is well located right next to the beach . Unlike many hotels in that area it has a very wide beachfront area. It is set in a  well tended and manicured garden.
We had an ocean view room with a fabulous view across the beach and trees. The room was very spacious and comfortable and had everything you might need, including fridge ,safe, excellent A/C and a luxurious bathroom with plenty of hot water and a powerful shower.
The staff are very welcoming helpful and courteous.
The buffet breakfast was delicious and offered a whole range of Western and Sri Lankan dishes. 

If I were to offer any negative points it would be that the buffet dinner is quite expensive at 40$ per person. Also the beach bar plays music from 10.30am throughout the whole day. This can get pretty irritating when you're trying to relax and listen to the waves. Fortunately it is less intense if you go well off to one side of the beach. Maybe the hotel could offer quieter times on the beach?

All in all I do think this is a very good luxury stay and I would certainly return in the future.
title: The best hotel in Passikudah

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Ein wunderschönes Hotel mit sehr viel Liebe geführt. Das Essen ist einfach nur Spitze von morgens bis abends für jeden was schönes dabei. Die Zimmer sind auch sehr schön und werden täglich 2 × gereinigt. Der Strand mit der Bar ist super. Es werden vor Ort einige Ausflüge angeboten.
title: Ich kann es nur wärmstens empfehlen.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Sehr schönes und gepflegtes sauberes und ruhiges Hotel. Sehr zuvorkommendes Personal. Großzügiges Zimmer. Essen, Bufet top. Letzte Tage leider nur Menü. Menüauswahl könnte größere Abwechslung oder wechselnde Menüs vertragen. Strand top vor dem Hotel.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Отличный отель. Лучше брать питание Al или Fb, очень вкусно готовят. Номера убирают 2 раза в день.Пляж охраняемый, вход в море пологий. Вернемся снова точно! Анимации нет, детям скучно будет. А вот для уединения взрослым, самое то! Прикольные узоры крабы на песке оставляют)
title: Райский уголок!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Я бы назвал это место раем.  Уютно, тихо. Чисто. Два раза убирают номер в день. Сервис на высшем уровне.Персонал красивый, добрый, отзывчивый и внимательный. Улыбки чего их стоят. Пляж самый красивым на этом побережье

text: Место мечты))) Великолепный отдых. Чудесный отель. Очень большие, комфортные номера. Пляж- просто сказочный - чистый песочек, просторный. Особая благодарность персоналу- все улыбчивые, приятные в общении, стараются решить любую проблему отдыхающих. Всем рекомендую для спокойного, комфортного отдыха.
title: Место мечты)))

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
TollesResort zum entspannen und Kraft auftanken. Sehr freundliches und zuvorkommendes Personal.
Am Abend jeweils ein 5-Gänge-Menü mit wählbaren Speisen. Speisen geschmacklich absolut top.

Zimmer (Wohnung) sehr großzügig, sauber und modern. Ach hier alles Bestens.

Wenn Sri Lanka dann immer wieder dieses Resort. Fahrt zum Flughafen Colombo mit 4,5 Stunden sollte einkalkuliert werden.
title: Phantastisches Resort im Osten Sri Lankas

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Unglaublich nettes und zuvorkommendes Personal. Sehr schöner und sauberer Hotel-Strand und gemütliche Anlage.
Das Essen war unfassbar lecker und es ist für jeden was dabei. Vegetarisch, diverse Fleisch- und Fischarten.
Wir kommen wieder.
title: Erholsame Woche, es hat an nichts gemangelt.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Board Road, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir hatten einen wundervollen Urlaub im Uga Bay mit herzlichem Überraschungsmoment mit Kuchen abends auf dem Zimmer für unsere Hochzeitsteise :)
Hier ist der perfekte Ort um zu entspannen, den traumhaften Hotel-Strand zu genießen, eine Vielzahl an frischen Kokosnüssen zu vernichten (auch gern mit lokalem Rum drin) und die Seele baumeln zu lassen.

Unser Beachstudio hatte einen wunderschönen Ausblick, die Massagen im Spa waren wirklich toll (wenn auch verhältnismäßig teuer) und der Service ließ keine Wünsche offen. 
Minimalen Optimierungsbedarf an mancher Stelle gibt es ja immer, aber ein ganz besonderes Dankeschön möchten wir an Fazul ausrichten, der unseren Urlaub auf jeden Fall versüßt hat mit Freundlichkeit - ehrlichem Interesse - absoluter Service Orientierung :) vielen Dank für diese Bekanntschaft!

Das Team insgesamt war sehr zuvorkommend und freundlich und das freundlichste / aufmerksamste Lächeln geht auf jeden Fall an „Musan“ im Restaurant (wir hoffen er hieß so) - wir hätten ihm am liebsten gleich abgeworben. 

Lieben Dank für die tollen Erinnerungen,
Maxi & Ariella
title: Hier kann man es sich gut gehen lassen :)

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The suites are the best if you need larger spaces
text:
It was a nice and relaxing stay we had at Sunrise Pasikuda and it was truly amazing. From the point we checked-in, the staff was so friendly and helpful and attentive to guest’s needs. We stayed for 3 nights at the suite and the suite was spacious and comfy. The resort has direct access to private beach and it was the starting of the Pasikuda season so there was no rain and the sea was so quite and calm. The blue sea and the brown beach were like a beautiful painting and the views all around are breathtaking. I suggest visiting during the season though it is bit expensive as then you can have a sunny weather and the best climate to explore the stunning beach and water sports.  
The property has some water sport activities and you can book them as you wish, we did snorkeling and it was amazing, we saw lots of fish and corals too. Talking about the property it claims the longest swimming pool in Pasikuda which is 108m and its beautiful. You can have a swim up and down the pool for a real workout or the gym too is great for that. They have indoor sports like table tennis, pool and board games like chess and carrom. 
I suggest going for the suite if you wish to have a relaxing stay as the suit is spacious with a separate living area, 2 TVs, a bathroom and another washroom, bathtub and a large balcony. Unfortunately, we didn’t have the minibar filled and it’s good if we had that too. 
The restaurant staff were so attentive to guest’s needs and I should specifically mention Kavindu, Amaya, Udara, Anjana, Mahinda (team lead), Imesh (restaurant captain) for their great service. Not forgetting others too. The platters were mouthwatering and the portions sizes are great. We were offered a new dessert the chef has prepared and that was tasty too. Thank you for the tasty platters, the chef and the team. The room service staff is also helpful and kudos to Mr. Ruwan (general manager) and the whole Sunrise Pasikuda team for your amazing hospitality. 
Wish to come again soon!
title: A nice relaxing stay in Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: take mosquito repellent with you
text: Nice and clean resort. Very good and plentiful breakfast, dinner including wine selection was also very good. The staff was always very attentive, helpful, and friendly. Great massages in the spa area. Bicycles can be rented to explore the area. The beach is very beautiful and well-maintained, with fine sand and no stones. Ideal for splashing around and swimming. An amazing clean pool, over 100 meters long! We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back sometime.
title: Sunrise - Beautiful Resort in Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Wir waren begeistert! Eine unglaublich schöne und gepflegte Anlage, der Pool war der Hammer! Ein paar Schritte bis zum (müllfreiem)  Strand, einfach nur toll. Das Zimmer war sehr geräumig mit viel Stauraum, einem sauberem Badezimmer und einer tollen Terrasse mit ausreichend Privatsphäre. Alles war super sauber, das Essen war köstlich - ein Kompliment an die Küche! Besonders hervorzuheben ist das gesamte Personal, uns wurde jeder Wunsch förmlich von den Augen abgelesen. Ein rund um toller Aufenthalt, absolut empfehlenswert, gerne wieder!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: Such a beautiful experience. Friendly people and amazing atmosphere. The rooms are so clean and comfortable and everyday the staff comes to clean them. There are surprises every day and it is really fun and thoughtful. I am very impressed and would love to go back sometime.
title: Perfect place to relax and enjoy the beach and the nature around

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is wonderful, from the warm welcoming with a cold drink, through the spacious rooms, the nice facilities, the large and long pool and the wonderful spacious beach with white fine sand, sun loungers in the shade of trees and a comfortable beach. In the morning they offer a traditional European and local breakfast, at lunch on the beach they organize a fish market of lobsters, king prawns, squid and fish, which are prepared in the restaurant's kitchen and served directly to you on the sun loungers. In the evening there is a choice of good wines, beers and soft drinks, as well as a grill fish and meat prepared on site. Every evening there is also live music performed by local musicians. The staff is extremely kind and attentive. We highly recommend this hotel and we would come back again.
title: Wonderful hotel for its price

Last but not at least the variety of food for both breakfast and evening buffet was plentiful and tasteful.

placeInfo/address: Argyle Road Kudaoya Estate, Hatton 22000 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent two nights at The Argyle and were really taken by the serene hilltop location and the uniquely Scottish-inspired charm of the hotel. Nestled among the tea fields, it’s a beautiful and peaceful place to pause during a Sri Lanka journey — especially when the mists roll in over the hills.

The highlight of our stay was the way the hotel helped make our son’s birthday extra special. They surprised him with a birthday cake and a cheerful song, which was a really thoughtful and memorable gesture that he absolutely loved.

Our room was spacious, comfortable, and had lovely views — perfect for relaxing after days of travel. The boys enjoyed playing pool in the games area and exploring the hotel, and we appreciated the quiet, scenic atmosphere. It was also a good base for a brilliant day out whitewater rafting and canyoning in nearby Kitulgala.

While the hotel clearly puts effort into its guest experience, we did find the service a little over-attentive at times — well-meaning but not always relaxing. That said, the heart is in the right place, and the location and style make The Argyle a distinctive and memorable stop in the hill country.
title: Peaceful Highlands Retreat with a Thoughtful Birthday Surprise

roomTip: We had a room overlooking the pool in one of the pointed roofed buildings. Lovely views. Nice big room.
text:
We were on a tour of Sri Lanka and were very fortunate to have been booked into this hotel for two nights. We cannot praise it enough. The accommodation, welcome, staff and food were all well above most of the competition. From the arrival welcome with their exceptional spiced tea to our departure were we were waved off with a line off staff were were treated extremely well.
The room and hotel facilities were everything we could have wanted. Only the weather let us down a little having a period of unexpected rain during the dry season.
We decided to do a walk through the tea plantations recommended by the hotel. A great experience. We were phoned by the lady concierge, Srikonth I think, along the way periodically to make sure that we hadn't got lost. When we got back she greeting us warmly and asked about how we enjoyed it.
All the reception staff and indeed the restaurant staff could not have offered a wrmer experience. In addition to Srikonth, Udaya, Pasindu and Priya made us feel most welcome.
We were extremely pleased with our stay and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone in search of an exceptional experience.
title: A must place to stay. Fantaastic.

roomTip: Early morning walks are ideal.
text: A wonderful luxury hotel with beautiful views of the surrounding tea plantations. This was the fourth time my wife and I stayed at this hotel and each time, it simply gets better. Although we noted that the hotel was much busier compared to previous years, the service was faultless. The staff were exceptionally polite, friendly, helpful and always willing to go that extra mile to see to our needs. Rooms are spacious,  extremely comfy and well equipped. It is really living the life, sitting out on the balcony, sipping coffee and taking in the breathtaking views of the distant mountains, Tea plantations and Adams Peak, as dawn breaks. Breakfast and Dinners have always been sumptuous. The hotel also provides an excellent High Tea. The cleanliness of this hotel is second to none and whilst sitting out on the balcony we observed the gardener and other staff members busy at work.  The pool and the spar are additional facilities one can enjoy at this hotel. Whilst emphasising that the service provided to us by All staff members was exceptional, we would like to mention by name some of the staff who went over and above to respond to our requests. In the restaurant, Supervisor Udaya, Asst.manager Isuru, Manager Srikanth, Waiter Theagarajah,  Naomi and chef Tharaka Sanjeeva. Gardener Vijayakanth took pride in showing us his beautiful garden and naming all the plants. Others who we would like to mention are Baggage collector captain Sudarshan, Guest relations senior executive Subhorshini, Bell boy Gihan Siriwardena and of course the Ever amiable front office Manager Nadan who is always at hand to help you with the broadest of smiles - symbolising typical Sri Lankan hospitality. Thank You to CEO Mr Ayantha Indika and his Team Argyle for a wonderful holiday. We are already looking forward to our next holiday with you!
title: Amazing Hotel with Breathtaking Views and Unbeatable Sri Lankan Hospitality

text: We’ve just spent two nights at the Bellwood Manor and it really does live up to its luxury billing. The room is impeccable, the food (a fine dining western menu, although there  is a Sri Lankan option for breakfast which we didn’t try) was utterly delicious, and the staff incredibly attentive and friendly. My husband had a spa massage which he reported to be fantastic (he’s quite the connoisseur), and we both enjoyed the “mini spa” (hot tub, steam room and sauna) which you can book for private use. The hotel (a converted and refurbished Victorian private residence) is well situated overlooking the Turf Club and a short stroll to town in one direction, or Gregory Lake (not the musician!) in the other. If you’re looking to luxe-up your SL trip then this place is recommended!
title: A bit of colonial-style luxury in tea country

text: Accueil de très bonne qualité dans ce boutique hôtel avec vu sur le champ de course de la ville : thé, massage des épaules de 2 minutes et boîte de chocolats de qualité. Bonne wifi. L’hôtel propose un bar, une salle de billard, une salle de restaurant / petit-déjeuner, un sauna, hamam et jacuzzi sur demande pour une heure gratuitement et un spa avec massages classiques. Petit-dejeuner à table avec beaux fruits, corbeille de pains de mie et viennoiseries, oeufs et granola vraiment tout très fin. Nous n’avons pas pris le dîner trop copieux et gastronomique européen (nous aurions préféré avoir le choix avec un rice and curry de qualité) pour 50$. Nous recommandons cette belle maison au personnel souriant, très British. Franchement merci pour ce séjour.

text:
This is a beautiful and charming boutique hotel (8 rooms/suites only) set on a hillside, yet easily accessible from the highway. Recently renovated, it has all modern conveniences yet has an old world charm which includes a snooker table. The continental breakfast was a standout for us and the dinner service (6 course dinners) was excellent and hats off to Chef Don Pubudu. The hotel staff was polite, attentive and friendly and went out of the way to make our stay comfortable from the receptionists, Yamal and Stacy to the restaurant team of Janith, Hansika and Binuri. The internet speed could have been better as it was relatively slow and patchy in the room. 
Overall, a wonderful stay and will definitely stay here again!
title: An exceptional experience in a charming and beautiful property

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
We stayed four nights at Maalu Maalu and found it an enjoyable relaxing place to enjoy the beach.

I would recommend the snorkelling - especially the 3 hour round trip to elephant rock. We also enjoyed the paddle boards and jet skis. The beach is safe, the sea is warm and the hotel is literally on the beach.

We found the staff helpful and generally attentive.

The reason I haven’t given Maalu Maalu five stars is because there were elements of the stay where it felt more of a resort than a five star experience - the buffet was similar every day, the service was sometimes slow and the rooms were lacking some of the individual touches. Additionally, our bathroom also backed onto a very noisy area where the staff seemed to convene all day and night.
title: A beach paradise

text: This resort was breathtaking and had the most amazing food. So yummy. The infinity pool was just mesmerizing and they had unique chalets as well. The inside of the chalet had a large bathroom and the bedroom was not that much spacious but it was cozy and nice. I was so in love with the hotel but One thing I experienced was the bad smell that came out of the washroom as the room and the bathroom was kinda connected through a door. We informed the necessary parties about this and they came to fix the smell but the bad smell was still there. That was the only negative thing that I encountered. We went snorkeling in the morning and got to see the most insane beautiful unrealistic sunset that i have ever seen as the sky was blood red and orange. I wish I could capture that moment but couldn’t as my phone battery died. I would love to visit this hotel again as this was that good.
title: Pasikudah diaries

text:
We had an unforgettable experience at Maalu Maalu Resort, Pasikuda! From the moment we arrived, the service and hospitality were top-notch.

Special thanks to the *F&B team* – *Gayan, Madushan, Yogeshwari, the all trainee, and Janaka* – for being so friendly and attentive. Janaka even checked in with us during meals to make sure everything was perfect.

The Front Office team, especially *Sailanka* and *Kanthi*, provided excellent service throughout our stay.

A big thank you to *Arun*, the pool attendant, for being so helpful and friendly.

We loved the beautiful beach right in front of the resort – clean, calm, and well-maintained. The pool was stunning, and the food was absolutely delicious. The romantic bed decoration for our anniversary was a lovely touch, and the classical solo music during dinner created the perfect atmosphere.

Every staff member we met was kind, welcoming, and supportive. This resort truly made our stay special. We absolutely loved it and will cherish the memories. Highly recommended! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
title: Peaceful Beach Escape with Excellent Service – Perfect Stay at Maalu Maalu!

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
A peaceful beachfront location with a fabulous team of staff who are so attentive, professional, friendly and efficient. 

Absolutely loved our time here, relaxing by the pool, walking on the beach, enjoying the food and drinks and recharging! 

A highlight was definitely the snorkelling escorted by Bharathi who did a wonderful job and shared her knowledge and enthusiasm for conserving the beautiful reef. 

The staff all work extremely hard to ensure all guests have a good stay, from the housekeeping, to breakfast staff, pool staff and those in the restaurant and bar. Even the management come around to ensure all guests are happy which is a lovely touch. 

We were served a lot my Robinson, who was great, but it was also lovely to see how hard the trainees were working and being supported by colleagues. The little gift shop has some great items and a really kind and professional member of staff - hope to be back and also take advantage of some of the other excursions! Many thanks to all 🙂
title: Fabulous - Recharge, relax and enjoy everything!

placeInfo/address: Coconut Development Board Road Pasikudah Bay, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
We had a great experience here. Rooms were very clean. Service really tried their best to make us feel homely. From the amenities we used the Spa for massages and had a glorious time there. We also went snorkeling which was great. Beach was very clean and they provided for everything. The gym is small but it has some free weights and even a bench. Regarding the food we only had breakfast booked and ate dinner in the a la carte restaurants. (2 of them there). They really did their best to accommodate for my gluten free diet ( Including a very good gluten free bread for breakfast) Also they really went out of their way to decorate our room for my birthday.
They also have a separate room for activities such as table tennis and pool. 
Only thing to improve on: whenever there was a larger group we had to wait for service for a long time. Waiters as well as house keeping. They needed to be reminded several times for us to get more water for our room for example. (So that in the end we went and got it ourselves) The available staff is extremely kind however there are just too few of them. Dinner took us at least 2.5 hours - and not because we are such slow eaters. You are here for vacation after all so we were not stressed on time however you do need patience and reminders.
title: All in all we would really recommend this place. From food to cleanliness and the amazing beach!

This is THE most magical place I have ever been! I am almost at a loss for words to explain just how incredible our stay was with Wild Coast Tented Lodge... We have never experienced the level of service we were so lucky to enjoy that at the Lodge. The staff was impeccable and so sincere. From Avinker our Ranger, to Dilshan who waiting on us for our dinners, to our personal concierge, Hasindu - the attention to our enjoyment was paramount.

I could go on and on... We were travelling for 6 wks - this was THE highlight of our travels. 
Thank you to everyone @ Wild Coast Tented Lodge!!

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Αν αναζητάτε έναν προορισμό που συνδυάζει άγρια ομορφιά, πολυτέλεια και απόλυτη ηρεμία, το Wild Coast Tented Lodge στη Σρι Λάνκα είναι η ιδανική επιλογή. 
Από τη στιγμή που φτάσαμε στο ξενοδοχείο, νιώσαμε τη ζεστή φιλοξενία του προσωπικού, που ήταν ευγενέστατο και πάντα πρόθυμο να μας εξυπηρετήσει. Ο butler μας ROHAN  ήταν πολύ εξυπηρετικός και πάντα στη διάθεση μας όταν τον χρειαζόμασταν!  Οι πολυτελείς σκηνές σχεδιασμένες για να ταιριάζουν με το φυσικό περιβάλλον, προσφέρουν άνεση, κομψότητα και μια αίσθηση περιπέτειας. Το εσωτερικό τους συνδυάζει ρουστίκ διακόσμηση με μοντέρνες ανέσεις ενώ το περιβάλλον γύρω με τα δέντρα και την πισίνα, προσφέρει μια αίσθηση χαλάρωσης και ελευθερίας! Το εστιατόριο του ξενοδοχείου ξεπέρασε κάθε προσδοκία. Οι γεύσεις ήταν απίστευτες, πρωινό, μεσημεριανό, high tea κ βραδινό με πιάτα που συνδυάζουν την παραδοσιακή κουζίνα της Σρι Λάνκα με σύγχρονες γαστρονομικές πινελιές! 
Ο Chef CHINTHAKA ήταν πολύ ευγενικός όπως άλλωστε και όλο το προσωπικό! Και πολύ καλός στην δουλειά του! Απίστευτος!!! 
Οι κοπέλες στο σπα ήταν επίσης πολύ ευγενικές και χαμογελαστές, καλά καταρτισμένες με την ειδικότητα τους! Έκανα δύο φορές με την ARI η οποία ήταν η καλύτερη και αν ξαναβρισκόμουν στο ξενοδοχείο εκείνη θα ζητούσα❤️ 
Το ξενοδοχείο βρίσκεται δίπλα στο Εθνικό Πάρκο Yala, κάτι που μας έδωσε τη δυνατότητα να απολαύσουμε αξέχαστα σαφάρι και να δούμε ελέφαντες, (λεοπάρδαλη για πρώτη φορά στη ζωή μου 🥹), διάφορα πανέμορφα πουλιά και πολλά ακόμα ζώα στο φυσικό τους περιβάλλον.
Στα σαφάρι γνωρίσαμε μοναδικούς ανθρώπους, τον BUDDHI ο οποίος ήταν πολύ καλά καταρτισμένος με την ειδικότητα του και με ενθουσιασμό για τη φύση και τα πλάσματα της που μας το πέρασε κ εμάς! Νιώσαμε πολύ ωραία μάλιστα πρώτη φορά έδωσα τόση προσοχή στα πουλιά τα οποία ήταν πολλά και πανέμορφα! Ο οδηγός μας στο safari (συγγνώμη που δεν θυμάμαι όνομα) νομίζω ότι ήταν ο καλύτερος κ ο πιο γρήγορος αφού προλαβαίναμε να δούμε καθαρά τα ζώα πριν απ ‘όλους!! Κάναμε τρεις μέρες σαφάρι και η καθεμία ήταν ξεχωριστή!! Εμπειρία ζωής και με τους κατάλληλους ανθρώπους μένει αξέχαστη! 
Από την πρώτη μέχρι την τελευταία στιγμή, κάθε λεπτομέρεια ήταν προσεγμένη, κάνοντας τη διαμονή μας πραγματικά αξέχαστη. Μια εμπειρία ζωής που σίγουρα θα θέλαμε να ξαναζήσουμε!
Το προτείνω χωρίς επιφυλάξεις ✨

placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
We are currently on a world tour celebrating 25 years of marriage, and Wild Coast Tented Lodge was one of the true highlights of our journey. From the moment we stepped into our luxurious tent, we were completely captivated. The setting, the attention to detail, and the warm hospitality made us feel like royalty.

The entire team was exceptional—every single person was aligned in making our stay unforgettable. We joined two safari experiences, and on our very first outing, we were lucky enough to see elephants and even a leopard named James. It was simply magical.

Back at the lodge, we had some unexpected (and fun) visitors: monkeys lounging near our private pool. The connection to nature here is both real and enchanting.

And then… the food. Wow. Every single meal was exquisite, but the standout was a special Sri Lankan crab curry prepared for us by the chef on our final night—it was absolutely unforgettable.

We only stayed for three days, but they were deeply meaningful and will always hold a special place in our hearts. We can’t wait to return, explore more of Sri Lanka, and come back to this gem on the wild coast.
title: 🌿 Wild Coast Tented Lodge – A Magical 25th Anniversary Getaway 🌿

title: Comfort and excitement for all!

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Wild coast is a luxurious gateway to Yala national park.  It is at the end of a highway and local road and then a track that our driver’s Prius negotiated at 10kph. 

Although you are outside the national park, no one has told the animals. And it gets elephants (actually dangerous if they are pissed off- our driver said his insurance specifically excluded elephant damage at Yala and that every year a few cars were damaged by angry young bull elephants). 

There are 110 variety of snakes in Sri Lanka - 30 are in the water and of the rest, about a third are poisonous. So you really, really don’t want to leave your doors or windows propped open. Monkeys cavort, beautiful spotted deer wander through and a monitor lizard the size of a small child may shortcut through the dining room. 

It’s very safe. At night there are always “rangers” to escort you to your tent/cabin. And they won’t let you leave the dining/pool area alone. 

The Wild Coast is vaguely adjacent a Hilton and two private hotels - Wild Cinnamon and and another place with huts. But you feel
Very isolated. It is on the Indian Ocean but the beach is gorgeous and eminently instagramable but not swimmable due to riptides and rocks and crashing surf. 

Really you are there for the safari drives into the park. I didn’t totally get that when I booked. We initially planned for three nights there but we did two  safaris on the first day (morning and afternoon) and they were so amazing - elephants with a baby, a leopard 2m away ambling by  the vehicle (after 40 min watching another one 90% hidden in a tree behind branches). Mongoose. Crocodiles. Spotted deer. Water buffaloes. Amazing birds like honey eaters and hornbills and water birds and adjuvant birds. 

The wild coast has - in my limited sense- access to some of the best drivers. And I was surprised that while the ranger guides were useful - they provided tons of interpretation and background and all had been working in the area for years- the drivers are equally, if not more so, critical to your experience. Our drivers - literally as well as metaphorically drove circles around other drivers in similar vehicles. 

The afternoon safari is time limited as the park closes at 6pm. While you don’t necessarily have to stay overnight if it closes, I had the sense that the drivers face big fines. Our driver took us from the leopard where it was 90% obscured and drove - harrowingly but not insanely - as he heard from another driver in his network about a good sighting. It was one of the highlights of our entire experience in Sri Lanka. It was glorious. Like being in the midst of a planet earth/David Attenborough video segment. 

There are a lot of safari trucks zooming around (fast and slow) Yala’s tracks. What I think you are getting is very experienced and capable drivers (we saw others broken down with smoking engines) and knowledgeable and patient guides who work with them. It’s expensive and not absolutely necessary if you are a surfer on a budget/ but it is worth it if you can swing it. 

The lodging itself is cute. They’ve created a physical plant of “tents” - a sort of British colonial tent camp with slightly streampunk tweaks. It works butter than I’m describing it and it is beautiful not cringe. A highlight for my partner were the copper fittings and a copper bath in the centre of the bathroom. 

The rooms and pools are lovely but smaller than the website photos which I can now see were taken with a wide angle lens. They are spacious in actuality but we had come from cape Weligama - a sister property we loved- and it was a visceral adjustment - even though cognitively we knew we were in the jungle adjacent to a national park. The power went off a few times overnight but went back on quickly. There is wifi and it is as good as anywhere in Sri Lanka and better than most other than electricity issues. 

You aren’t allowed food in your room (animals). And no room service (animals). There is an electric cooler and drinks - which are included. There isn’t a lot else to do. There is a spa. There is a large central domed restaurant with a quite large and lovely pool. And a beach area. A bar and a library dome with games. But that’s it. You are there to stay while waiting for safari drives. They do offer other trips to temples and a sanctuary for orphaned elephants. 

I had to inadvertently leave a day early for work on another part of the island. And they were incredibly kind to swap our last night as there was availability. But in the end I think two nights is probably perfect. Although we were lucky - the first morning drive was fun and Interesting but not as many big mammals. The second drive was spectacular - but it was really blind luck. It’s a huge park and just chance if you can see animals by the road in the area you happen to be in. Knowledgeable drivers/guides clearly increase your odds however. If you really wanted to increase your odds, maybe a third night or two nights and pay for an extra game drive - you get one included per a night. We found two on one day was eminently doable however 

Food was lovely in the restaurant. All food and some liquor is included. Our server - a you man named Milan was lovely and thoughtful. But everyone was actually quite nice and responsive. The high tea was okay. There is a sundowners happy hour kind of thing every night by the beach for sunset and it was lovely. 

We chose a tent with a pool. I think it is probably worth it. Sri Lanka is hot. Really hot. And muggy. You can’t swim in the room pool but it was lovely at night and in the morning and when we came back to the room.
title: A beautiful lodge next to an amazing national park

roomTip: Organise your own transfers. The transfers organised by hotels, not just Wild Coast, are very expensive. We paid less than 1/5th.
text:
Where to begin... Wild Coast Tented Lodge is simply exceptional. The location is breathtaking, the wildlife/landscapes stunning, the food is five stars, and the staff incredibly welcoming. Yes, it's expensive, but it is worth every single penny. By far one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. Absolutely faultless. 
 
We stayed two nights and wish we could have stayed a week! The accommodation (tent) is beautiful. Luxury amenities and beautifully thought out. I highly recommend getting a tent with private pool (we were upgraded on arrival). That being said, the shared pool is stunning, not crowded, and close to the restaurant and bar with a fantastic view of the ocean. 

The food was exceptional, almost Michelin level in our opinion. You really can’t ask for much more. We just wish we were hungrier and could enjoy all the food on offer! You must try the Sri Lankan experience. 

Drinks were also fantastic, made even better by the exceptional service from Dulan in the bar. Sundowners were also fantastic. While you can’t swim in the sea, which is very rough, the view is simply outstanding.

You need to be escorted to your room each evening due to the wildlife. During our stay, a sloth bear and elephant were seen wondering through the grounds. On the way back to our room, there was a porcupine running around the edge of our pool.
 
The highlight was of course the Safari. Don't be put off by reviews that the park is over crowded and chaotic. Wild Coast Tented lodge thinks about every last detail, and we did not wait in long lines to get into the park, or to see the animals, unlike other tours operating in the area. Our guide, Buddhi and our driver Lucky made sure that we visited spots not frequented by other vehicles. Their expert knowledge of the animals meant that we still saw everything we wanted to see, but without any other vehicles, which was extra special. In some instances, we were some of the only vehicles to see Elephants, including several babies, and a leopard, which were proving extra elusive given rain the week before. We were able to track down leopards by their paw prints, and the sound of startled deer, which was an incredible experience. It is of course, still a game of luck, but we couldn’t be more thankful. The safari was completely tailored to what we were hoping to find and Lucky was far superior as a driver, allowing us to visit parts of the park that others couldn’t. He also had a fantastic eye for spotting animals. If I come back, I will be requesting the same duo for our safari! I should note, I believe that Wild Coast have trained people from the local fishing villages to drive the safari vehicles to up-skill and provide a better income. Overall, our safari team were exceptional, and we truly felt that we had the best of the best. They were so passionate about the land and animals. Buddhi should work for national geographic, he’s that good!
 
As mentioned, it is quite expensive. However, when you take into consideration the included safaris, quality and quantity of food, drinks, level of service, atmosphere, ambience and location, it completely worth it.

We also stayed at Cinnamon Wild next door, which was also great for the price and highly recommended, but if you can push the budget, this is non-negotiable and on another level! The hotel manager and staff at reception were also wonderful.
 
I simply cannot fault this place. It felt much more like an experience, where they have carefully thought about every detail. I almost never return to the same country, let alone the same hotel, but I will be making a trip back to Sri Lanka specifically to stay here again and experience Yala with their incredible team. I think it speaks volumes that every guest we spoke to felt exactly the same way. Next time, I will stay for much longer. I imagine the other properties Cape Weligama and Ceylon Tea Trails would also be amazing.

I would also note that if you enjoy safaris in Africa, or you're debating where to go, while this is a slightly different experience, the quality of safari/wildlife is just as good! The park is beautiful, and the tropical landscape offers something unique. Sri Lanka is a fantastic country, and there is so much more to experience if you're looking for an extended vacation. 
 
If you’re thinking of booking Wild Coast, just do it. It’s absolutely world-class.
title: Exceptional in every way! Flawless.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka

text:
From the moment we arrived, everything about Wild Coast Tented Lodge exceeded expectations. Gihan, our personal manager, was truly exceptional — attentive, thoughtful, and made sure every detail of our stay was perfect. The rooms are absolutely impeccable, with a level of design and comfort that’s rare to find. The popsicle upon arriving was delicious, don't miss out on it. 

The property itself is stunning — every corner is beautifully curated, and the attention to detail is unmatched. You can tell this place was created with care. The entire experience was nothing short of incredible, from the peaceful atmosphere to the warm hospitality.

The food is good, especially by Sri Lankan standards — flavorful, fresh, and well-presented. And a special shoutout to their exclusive body lotion — it's divine! Seriously, make sure you slather it all over — you won’t find it anywhere else.

Highly, highly recommend staying here. If you’re looking for a luxury retreat that delivers above and beyond, this is it.

placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
We had a wonderful time from start to finish. The staff will do everything to make you stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. On arrival your get a person appointed to assist you with everything you need. He will find you in the resort to check-in with you on occasion but you can also send him a message 24/7. We had Hasindu and he was the best. Nothing was ever too much and he was super-fast in his responses. 
We got a upgrade to a pool cocoon suite which was a lovely surprise. The suites are beautifully done and everything you need is there. You are in the middle of nature and its really private we did not hear or see any other guests when we were at our suite. You only hear and see nature. At night you fall a sleep with the sounds of a frogs and birds. 

The food is very versatile and there is plenty of choice. The quality is really high and we had some of the best curries here during our two week trip. We also loved all the different kind of non-alcoholic drinks that were available. 

For every night you get a safari to the Yala Park. We did one in the morning and one in the afternoon. Both were wonderful and included a driver and a ranger. The cars can take 5 people so it’s never a lot of people joining you. They get priority when entering the Park and this makes all the difference as it can get really busy in the mornings. They will bring snack and drinks in case you need it as well. 

The pool and beach are amazing to chill for days or just a couple of hours. We spend a day at the beach and although the hotel was fully booked it felt really sirene. 
Communication prior to our stay was excellent and they really take all your preferences seriously. After our visit we completed their internal review form but never gotten any feedback or acknowledgement on this unfortunately. 

To consider:
The Spa was not what we expect from this level of resort. But if you want to have a quick massage then it’s fine but if you are looking for a high level spa experience it’s not the place. 

The service was excellent and we would gladly stay here again and definitely look into their other hotels when going back to Sri Lanka.
title: Amazing Stay

text:
I rarely write reviews—but after staying at Kings Pavilion, how could I not?

We stayed in the Queen’s Suite, and from the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The name of the hotel truly speaks for itself—they make you feel like a royalty in every possible way.

I’ve stayed in many hotels around the world, but the service here is the best I’ve ever experienced. Every single staff member was warm, attentive, and genuinely dedicated to making our stay unforgettable. Their hospitality and attention to detail were simply extraordinary.

The property is stunning—a beautifully secluded, peaceful retreat surrounded by nature. It’s charming, quiet, and impeccably maintained. Perfect for anyone looking to relax, recharge, and escape the noise of everyday life.

The food was phenomenal—full of rich flavors and beautifully presented. Dining here was a highlight of the entire trip.

We also had the convenience of a personal driver throughout our stay, which made exploring Sri Lanka completely stress-free. The transportation was punctual, professional, and made the journey seamless.

A special thank you to the housekeeping team, who went above and beyond. The room was always spotless, and the creative towel animals left each day added such a thoughtful and fun touch—it truly brought a smile to our faces daily.

Kings Pavilion is more than a hotel—it’s a full experience. We left feeling refreshed, deeply cared for, and already dreaming of our return. If you're visiting Sri Lanka, this hidden gem is an absolute must. It sets the bar for luxury, service, and serenity.

text: A simply superb boutique hotel. Two nights were not enough. The room was extremely comfortable but the real highlights were the amazing staff, the fantastic food and the breathtaking views. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and am delighted that Trailfinders suggested it. A short drive into Kandy but a quiet and peaceful refuge from the busy city. We leave reluctantly as we could stay here much longer. I have not singled out any individual as that would be unfair, they are a great team. Thank you.
title: Fabulous small hotel near Kandy

text:
From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the warm welcome and personalized attention I received at this hotel. Every staff member went out of their way to ensure my stay was comfortable, making me feel like a truly valued guest.

What stood out most was the tranquility. Unlike many busy hotels, this one offered a haven of peace. It was the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle.

If you're looking for a hotel that combines outstanding personalized service with a calm, tasteful environment, this is the place to be. Food is amazing

Un posto magico.
