placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
What an amazing place. We stayed for 2 nights as part of our tour and didn’t know what really to expect. The tents are amazing and well kitted out with a 30s vibe.  You get your own little private pool in the jungle as well. Just lie back and listen to the sounds. 
Everything is of a great quality. 
The staff (Sashi especially) , were fantastic and looked after our every need. 
The game drives are amazing. We did an afternoon one and an early morning one. Great knowledgeable guide who explained everything.  You get the same guide so no overlap in the experience. The jeeps only hold 6 in the back so you all have a fantastic outside view. We saw just about everything bar the Sloth Bear. 
It is worth remembering the the site is in the jungle and there are no fences keeping wildlife out. You are escorted after dark for your own safety but that just adds to the vibe and the excitement. 
The food was delicious. Not your typical buffet fare when you stay all inclusive. You order from a menu and it’s cooked fresh. We had the seafood platter on the first night and it was amazing. Fillet steak the second night, cooked to a perfect medium rare. Absolutely not complaints here. 
Will definitely recommend to friends and will stay again when we are back to this wonderful country.
title: Luxury in the jungle

Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!
 

Thank you so much for your lovely feedback! It is very heartening to see how you have taken the time to appreciate details and tell us about it. It makes what we do so much more enjoyable! Positive feedback such as this, really make our day.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
This was our first visit to Sri Lanka, which we were looking forward to as part of our winter tour including Maldives, Sri Lanka, Thailand and a return to the cold UK through Oman and Quatar.
Wild Coast Tented Lodge was our final of three resort destinations owned by Resplendent Ceylon, after 11 days previously split between their Cape Weligama beach resort and Ceylon Tea Trails experience.
Arriving at this Relais & Chateau base for our Sri Lanka safari provided the usual personalised welcome that we had become familiar with, the General Manager was there to greet us and introduce our stay curator. This was to be a short one-night stay so after arriving by seaplane we had in mind a relaxed lunch followed by an afternoon massage, with a game drive early the next day.
On the topic of the massage, curiously my Balinese masseuse Manda appeared vaguely familiar. Coincidentally it was her Mum “Mega” who massaged me several times during our earlier visit to Cape Weligama! One does sense that the Dilmah family-owned Resplendent Ceylon Resorts prioritise employee wellbeing. At all levels of responsibility from the gardeners, housekeepers, restaurant waiters and management, their visitor facing staff seem very happy, enthusiastic, and proud of their work.
The tented “cocoons” are astonishing, comfortable architectural masterpieces. Constructed using the most sustainable processes and materials they comprise a bamboo structure, covered with insulated stretch tented fabric, are fully air conditioned with all the modern plumbing and sanitary functions, four poster bed with top quality linen and towels. Our cocoon featured a private swimming pool and deck area that was delightful to freshen up after our journey.
The safari was well executed, we previously experienced several in Africa against which the attention and quality of the game drive in Sri Lanka compared well. We had been a little spoiled having seen all the “big 5” animals in Africa, but the game drive whilst not offering such a huge variety of beasts as Africa fully met our expectations. Our nominated ranger, the six feet tall “Evinka” was very informative and passionate about his work, we always felt safe, and he managed to get us within 3 metres of a mother and baby elephant, he well communicated in such an enjoyable way.  Other highlights were beautiful Peacocks dancing, Crocodiles resting, and lots of colourful wild birds.
Back at the Tented Lodge we enjoyed a classic English breakfast, even served with my favourite HP source which I had mentioned to the Resplendent Travel booking agent at the time of our reservation. Resplendent facilitated the “vital sauce” was available for us at every breakfast during our multi-destination 12-night visit!  In general at Wild Coast Tented Lodge, we found the food quality and offering to be of an acceptable standard. Although not the level of fine dining we experienced at Ceylon Tea Trails where it is a major focus, here the “jungle” experience is the main feature and this fully met our expectations.
We were so inspired by our “cocoon bathroom” that we decided to incorporate the design and plumbing into our never-ending home renovation back in Mediterranean Europe!
title: Luxury in the jungle

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
roomTip: Ask to visit another block if you have three safaris included.
text:
An interesting stay and possibly not for everyone. Its location within the national park means that movement is very restricted on foot so if you enjoy a walk along the sand dunes you will not get far without being turned back by security. Elephants and other animals pass by regularly and you need to be escorted to your tent and back by staff. 

The tent pods and decks are cute and well kitted out although if you f joy the sound of the waves or fresh air turn tough, because you can’t open any windows. 

Our safari ranger was excellent and we visited two parts of the park. Block One is extremely busy with jeeps whilst the other was less so. We did see a leopard, friendly and unfriendly elephants; wild boar; grey monkeys; herds of spotted deer and the odd sambar deer. There were also a few fresh water crocs. We saw evidence of bears but did not see one. 

The food offering was excellent as was the service. We did have an issue with the range of red wine available on an AI basis but chose from the paid menu and were not charged.
title: Enjoyable experience but restricted

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
This is a spectacular setting for a truly special holiday. The common areas (restaurant and bar) and tents are all architecturally unique, the interior design is elegant and the entire aesthetic creates a gorgeous, one-of-a-kind integration with the surrounding landscape.  The service was speedy, friendly and efficient, and the game drive vehicles and conservationist guide were top notch.  
My only complaints (and the reason for a four star, rather than five star review) would be the live music on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day were overly loud, making it difficult to chat with family; the restaurant seemed understaffed for holiday dinners, and the limited menu could have provided better for vegetarians; and there was a lack of indoor common areas (beside the pool) to enjoy chatting with other guests, a feature we enjoyed at Ceylon Tea Trails.  But this is ultimately nitpicking; WCTL was truly a spectacular experience, and even though it is at (or over) the top of our price range, it felt like it was worth every penny.
title: A Truly Special Experience

We were on a half board package which we seemed best as we did not see any other restaurants nearby.  The food and service were excellent for the whole stay.
All in, a first class hotel and we will return.

roomTip: Our room was called Sakra, there were steps down to the bed and balcony area and in the bathroom to the toilet level.
text:
We chose this hotel for 4 days relaxation on the beach at the end of our busy trip. The pool area was well furnished and the pool and bar staff were very attentive, ensuring that your water glass was replenished and taking drinks or food orders. Life guards are also on duty. The beach was very empty while we were there, at this time of the year there is an under current which means that the beach shelves at the waters edge with a sand bank slightly further out. Swimming was only recommended in the mornings.

The food was exceptional and the waiters were very helpful and friendly. The room was spotlessly clean with a large balcony and the bathroom was spacious. The spa staff are experienced and we enjoyed two massages while we were here.
title: Relaxing boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Aditya is a modern boutique hotel on the beach not far from Galle. It is modern in design unlike many of the traditionally designed hotels in the area.  
The room we stayed in was enormous with a bigger floor plan than most UK terraced homes. The bathrooms we saw are unconventional with jacuzzis and similar instead of baths and are not fully enclosed. 
The dining room is good value and high quality and the absence of fixed dining times is great.
The pool area is compact though when we were there we had no problem getting a pair of loungers. 
All in all a great spot for a relaxing holiday by the beach.
title: Discrete Luxury

placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! What an amazing hotel! The minute you walk into the hotel you are surrounded by peace & calm, flowers & plants adorn every corner of the hotel making the distinction between inside and outside blurred, a veritable paradise. 
Our suite was stunning. We could see fish swimming in a shaded pond, our courtyard contained a private jacuzzi and our bathroom was tastefully sheltered, yet outside! We had a comfortable bed & spacious living room, which was well equipped with everything you need. 
The staff are kind and very attentive, they want your stay to be perfect; thank you to everyone, including Indika & Noyel, for taking such good care of us. 
The food is beautifully presented, tasty & generous; the cocktails are divine! 
The pool is fabulous and the staff provide clean towels, cold water to drink & comfortable sun loungers. The sea views are superb but the current was too strong for me to swim in.
Overall, this is one of the best hotels we’ve ever stayed in.
title: Just Heaven!

placeInfo/address: 719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I have been to many resort hotels in Sri Lanka, but how Aditiya 'welcome' their guests is honestly welcoming. I arrived late evening when it was already dark and the interior of the hotel with the cozy lighting was astonishing. Aditiya is a wonderful place to relax with a beautiful sea view during the day and of course the elegantly designed and lit up common areas at night.
The meals are prepared to your own choice and you are free to dine at any time of the day, which is a unique feature at Aditya. If you like SriLankan food, my recommendation is go for it and you will not regret.
The bedrooms are large and comfortable with all amenities included. However, I believe the interior of the rooms needs to be upgraded to align with the common areas and the toilets redone. This would help to maintain the overall standard of the hotel in one level.
title: Relax in Total Silence beside the Sea

text: We had a bumpy start to our stay at this hotel with regard to our first room, but after a meeting with the GM this issue was resolved amicably and after that everything went very smoothly.  We changed room 3 times during our 9 day stay and each one was unique with its own idiosyncrasies.  Our favourite room was the middle one of the three - a Pool Suite.  There is a Spa within the hotel complex and both my wife and I enjoyed massages there.  Be sure to ask for the masseuse Nyoman if you decide to go.  All of the staff we came into contact with were friendly and helpful.  And finally, the food is to die for.  We have been fortunate to eat in many restaurants and the food that came out of this one was as good if not better than any other we have experienced.  Superb is the one word to describe it.
title: So relaxing

text:
Arrived here after a tiring 9 day tour and feeling slightly ill. 5 nights in this amazing sanctuary left us fully restored. 

The staff couldn't be more helpful. Fabulous juices at the pool area, a huge and varied breakfast each morning, wonderful menu and amazing presentation with the best view into the jungle garden and its nocturnal wildlife.

Special mention to Indika, the head waiter. His suggestions to calm a weak tummy and delight the taste buds were brilliant. So thoughtful and caring. 

The hotel organised our tuk tuk to Galle and could have organised more. Even for a 5am departure they packed us off with croissants, fruit and cakes for the journey. Wonderful hotel!! Thank you 🙏
title: Aditya resort hotel - 5 star sanctuary hotel near Galle

roomTip: If you want seafood, just talk to the chef and he will deliver it to your table for dinner. They also have seafood menu at lunch.
text: Awesome place for a family vacation. Spent 3 nights. We had #11 and #12 rooms. Husband, wife, adult daughter and 10 year old son. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. Was worried it was going to be a hot room for us but with the airconditioning and fans, the room was cool/cold enough for a perimenopause person. The shower was nice, not airconditioning but it had a fan. Breakfast was great-must try egg hopper plus pork bacon. We asked the chef to have a seafood feast on our last night and they delivered. 2 lobsters, 8 prawns and some crabs. You can dine in the main dining area, no airconditioning but lots of fans. Overall a great relaxing trip. Everything was clean, our rooms are cleaned everyday, water refilled. The men came around at night to refill any water bottles and the mini fridge/bar inside your room. Ruchie the activities coordinator kept our 10 year old entertained, played cricket, volleyball, made sandcastles, etc. If you are looking for the elephant print pants, I only found it in one store. Had to have help from our driver Upul because they were up charging me a lot lol.
title: Relaxing Maalu Maalu for family of four

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
Ich habe dieses wunderbare Hotel im Zeitraum 20. Mai bis zum 02. Juni 2025 besucht. Der Aufenthalt war fantastisch. Schon bei der Ankunft wurde man super freundlich willkommen geheißen. Es gab zur Begrüßung einen Blumenkranz und einen traditionellen Farbklecks auf die Stirn. 

Die Mitarbeiter des Hotels sind alle durchweg super freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wenn man morgens nur in Richtung Pool oder Strand ging kamen sofort die Mitarbeiter an und tragen einem seine Handtücher nach. Immer wieder wurde gefragt ob man irgendwas zu trinken oder Essen haben möchte. 

Die Zimmer waren geräumig und alles was man benötigte war vorhanden. Die Sauberkeit war sehr gut. Im Badezimmer wurde man des Öfteren von Geckos besucht 😉
Das Essen war super lecker, morgens wie auch die meisten Abende gab es Buffet mit großer Auswahl auch an einheimischen Essen. Der Schärfegrad war teilweise herausfordernd 😉

Der Strand war wunderschön und super sauber, genauso wie das Meer. Keinerlei Müll am Strand oder im Wasser, das war ein tolles Erlebnis. Für mich einer der schönsten Strände die ich bisher besucht habe. 

Zuletzt noch ein herzliches Dankeschön an ALLE Mitarbeiter diese hervorragenden Hotels. Hier kann man keinen herausnehmen, sondern alle waren einfach nur Klasse.

Dieses Hotel mit alles seinen Mitarbeitern ist einfach nur ein kleines Paradies.
title: Tolles Strandhotel mit super Service

The organised trips are also reasonably priced and I would thoroughly recommend the short bicycle trip as a way of seeing the local region, as this was expertly led by our fantastic concierge. 
Needless to say we found our stay here truly amazing.

roomTip: The birds are very noisy and rooms quite bright in the morning, so bring an eye mask if you like it dark and maybe some white noise.
text:
We had a lovely restful stay at Malu Malu and this all came down to the amazing resort animator Rutchira!! He was the absolute best activities organiser for the Kids we’ve ever encountered. 

From the moment we arrived he had the kids smiling and from sun up to sun down they were entertained with creative arts, board games in the games rooms, themed adventures and outdoor play including cricket and volleyball. 
Every day the kids came back with huge smiles each day full of stories, smiles, and excitement. 

The activities were thoughtfully planned and age-appropriate, balancing creativity, learning, and fun perfectly and we loved that it included many local childhood games that Rutchira played as a child.  

His energy, smile, warmth and genuine care for the children was immediately apparent. He went above and beyond to create a safe, engaging, and joy-filled environment where every child felt special and included.

If you have children and are looking for somewhere to go as a family then I highly recommend recommend this resort as Rutchira will make you feel like family.

The rest of the staff were incredible also.  The rooms were cleaned each morning with great care and fresh water supplied at a call whenever we needed it.  A special mention also to Rupan who had laid out our towels each morning at the pool in our preferred location without even having to ask and he knew our names from day one.  He always had a lovely smile for us.
title: Paradise location with Fantastic staff

Als einzige kleine Kritik wäre anzumerken, dass die Anlage sehr schlicht und clean gehalten ist, es könnte hier und da noch ein bisschen Deko/ Pflanzen vertagen.

placeInfo/name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa - Thema Collection
text:
Wir waren im Rahmen unserer Rundreise drei Nächte im Maalu Maalu Resort in Passekudah mit unserer Familie. 

Bereits bei der Ankunft merkt man den besonders aufmerksamen Service der Mitarbeiter. Alle sind unglaublich freundlich, aufmerksam und hilfsbereit. 

Besonders möchte ich Ruchira hervorheben, der als Animateur einen tollen Job macht. Er bringt selbst unsere schüchterne Tochter mit anderen Kindern in Kontakt, lässt sich immer neue Spiele einfallen und ist dabei nicht aufdringlich. 

Das Hotel ist im Stil eines Fischerdorfs aufgebaut. Die Zimmer sind geräumig und stilvoll eingerichtet. Es gibt kostenlos Trinkwasser, das bei Bedarf nachgefüllt wird. 

Die Anlage ist komplett mit Sand aufgebaut. Neben dem großen Infinitypool gibt es einen kleineren im Schatten gelegenen. Außerdem lädt das warme Meer mit einem tollen sauberen Strand zum Baden ein. 

Wer möchte kann Wasseraktivitäten buchen. Haben wir allerdings nicht gemacht. 

Das Essenangebot ist vielfältig. Wir haben à la Card gegessen. Es gibt aber auch Buffet. 
Im Umkreis sind einige weniger Restaurants ebenfalls erreichbar. 

Erwähnen möchte ich auch das ayurvedische Spa-Angebot. Auch hier sind kompetente und freundliche Mitarbeiter tätig. Ich kann die Fußreflexzonen-Massage besonders empfehlen. 

Fazit: Wir kommen gerne noch einmal länger wieder!
title: Ausgezeichneter Service in tollem Hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 6 Wadumunnegedara, Marawila 60200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for two nights in this very excellent hotel- we were met by Isuru who was so helpful and informative throughout our stay. Our room was very spacious and the hotel is set in its own very peaceful grounds with swimming pool and lots of areas to sit and relax. It is also part of a much larger agricultural estate majoring on coconut production but with a rich mix of herb and plant life. There are organised tours which added to our stay and were a great educational experience. Overall though it was the very personal service that we will remember from Akash and other members of the team of 7. The  cuisine too was excellent  with 80% of the ingredients coming from the estate cooked with great expertise. This is a boutique hotel based on an older style of property with great quality- really recommend for 2/3 nights to unwind.
title: A really excellent place to relax and unwind

text: Absolutely beautiful! Highly recommend you start your stay in Sri Lanka at Horathapola Estate. An old restored Colonial Coconut Plantation. Excellent service from Isuru who greeted us well after midnight on our arrival from Sydney. Guided us on our first full day bike riding through the villages and local markets, bullock ride on the Horathapola plantation, finishing with a cooking demonstration and the full enjoyment of delicious foods from their talented cooks. Horathapola is more suited for couples or families with older children. Our visit was too short, but we intend on a longer stay our next visit to Sri Lanka.

text: Wow what a beautiful location and gem of a place to stay after a long night flight. The hotel was beautiful , the location tranquil and the hospitality/staff second to none. We also really enjoyed a trip to the market with Thamara, and the bullock cart ride around the estate.  A perfect first place to relax into our holiday.
title: Beautiful, characterful hotel with amazing staff and food

text:
Horathapola Estate was our first stop on our two week holiday to Sri Lanka and what a delightful way to start our experience!
We were greeted with cold towels and a cooling drink and shown to our fabulous room overlooking the stunning gardens and swimming pool. Tea and homemade cake was on offer while we settled in.

The food and hospitality were the highlights of our stay. My wife is vegetarian and this was easily accommodated. My evening meal was incredible  and a real taste experience with much of the ingredients grown or sourced from the estate. If I thought the evening meal was substantial then the breakfast was exceptional and just kept coming! 

We could not fault Horathapola. All the staff were exceptional and went the extra mile.
We were made to feel so welcome here.
Thank you to the whole team. Thank you for the bag of black pepper, again from the estate. 
We would highly recommend this to anyone.
title: A beautiful start to our holiday

placeInfo/address: No. 6 Wadumunnegedara, Marawila 60200 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren nach einem Nachtflug für 2 Tage in der Kolonialvilla zu Gast.
Ein aufmerksamer Empfang um 05:30 a.m., großzügige, luftige Zimmer, wir bekamen ein hervorragendes Frühstück um 06:30 und konnten uns inmitten tropischer Gartenanlage bestens entspannen. Die Kokosnussplantage  wird seit 15 Jahren ökologisch bewirtschaftet, das gesamte Essen kommt aus eigener Produktion! Wir haben einen begleiteten Rundgang über das Areal unternommen, eine Einführung in diverse Obst-, Gemüse- und Gewürzsorten erhalten. Das Abendessen war sodann ein Beispiel sri-lankischer Kochkunst. Ein magischer Ort, um Anfang oder Ende einer Reise zu genießen!
title: Ein Beispiel für vollendete Gastfreundschaft!

roomTip: Enhancement of professional cookery.
text:
We as the ex retired Flag Officer’s, checked in to Cinnamon Life City of Dreams on 27 June 2025 to celebrate our comradeship…

The introduction to the property was given by your staff (our comrade Rajendra Wattowita). This introduction & the package made us to select your property for our event.

Though this is a new property…
From the inception, it gave a different perspective.
The hotel security staff guided us correctly to our parking spots in an orderly manner & guided us correctly to the vast property.
Front Office: 
Staff were courtier and did the checking in /out fast. Guided us to our rooms. Good job.
House Keeping:
Staff were professional and attended to all our requirements. Good professional work.
F & B:
Staff was good & the spread was large,  but the taste of the food has to be improved… 
In the morning breakfast certain items in continental / English breakfast were not available in the spread. When inquired the answer given was not suited for a five star property (but later on the requested item was provided). Good attempt…
Hence professional cookery aspect has to be enhanced to suit the client’s tastes.
Especially as a new property to achieve the desired objectives and goals.
title: Overall a good property with lots of potential.

text:
My stay at Cinnamon Life was truly outstanding – everything from start to finish was absolutely perfect. The entire team was exceptionally kind, professional, and attentive.
From the front desk to housekeeping to restaurant service – every member of staff made us feel genuinely welcome and well taken care of.

A special thank you to the lovely receptionist who greeted us so warmly, and especially to Ricky, the Hotel Manager – truly outstanding. He was present, approachable, and ensured everything ran smoothly throughout our stay.

Honestly, I’ve never experienced this level of hospitality, service, and attention to detail – not even in many top hotels across Europe. Cinnamon Life has set a new personal benchmark.

The room, the view, the food, the atmosphere – all easily a 10/10.
I can wholeheartedly recommend Cinnamon Life and will definitely return on my next trip to Colombo.

Thank you to the entire team for this exceptional experience!

roomTip: Swimming in the sea is not an option due to currents,
text: If you are looking for a hotel where you feel that you ‘fit in', where you are instantly made to feel 'at home' and where your every need can be catered for...look no further than Buckingham Place.   It sounds like a bit of a cliché, but this place really is a home from home.  The rooms are spacious, the beds large and comfortable, air conditioning excellent (and quiet), the gardens are quite extensive, well maintained and home to various interesting birds and animals all of whom seem to quire enjoy being photographed. The pool is also well maintained, the surrounding area is a wonderful place gather and make new friends. There is a swim-up bar in the shallows, and they are always happy to make cocktails to your specification as required.   The breakfast, lunch and evening meal menus offer a wide variety of cuisine styles, and, in the unlikely event, you don't see something you fancy, the chefs will happily cater for your needs. The hotel is located  within the Rekawa village, and if you take a late afternoon walk (when the day is a little cooler) you will be able to observe village life where people are often happy to chat and to direct you to points of interest. The hotel provides bicycles (free), so you can venture further afield if you wish. As a base for excursions, Marissa for whale watching is close by, as is the local turtle watch, Yala safari park is also easy to get to and Galle is great for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel manager, Kalpa, and his team will be happy to advise you and arrange for transport. The evenings are always fun at BP, the restaurant transforms, it has an enticing, sophisticated atmosphere where you can dress up or down, enjoy a quiet table for two or, as quite often happens, join with other guests to celebrate a birthday or anniversary.  Nick Buckingham (the owner) is always around to ensure that any celebration becomes an ‘occasion’ whether you are a first-time guest or a ‘returner’ like us.   Finally, a word about the staff, the service at this hotel is first class, every single member of the team at BP work hard to ensure guests have everything they need, and they always do so with the warmest smiles. And, if any maintenance issues do arise Chamadu and his housekeeping team work quietly and efficiently to address them.   By the way, there are also a couple of canine members of the team (Bella & Gracie), both are very used to meeting new people and will let you pat them - when they feel like it!   We have, of course, booked for next year.
title: Love this place

ownerResponse/text:
Wow - Perfect - Thank You!

Thank you very much for including Buckingham Place in your itinerary, and, for your perfect thumbs up for the hotel and its team. To read, ours was ‘Possibly the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at’ humbles us and makes us proud. Your review will surely inspire confidence in travelers following in your footsteps.

Perfect guests and reviews are a blessing, so naturally we’d be thrilled to welcome you back to your ‘home-from-home’ one day soon. In the meantime, thank you for your valuable custom, great praise and excellent company – we deeply appreciate your patronage and kind support.

On behalf of all, happy travels and a blissfully happy life!
 
Warm regards & respect,
Nick, Kalpa & the Team

ownerResponse/text:
Laying down some Chardonnay for next time…

Or was it, laying down with some Chardonnay?! 

Notwithstanding tempting bribes of other guests in the meantime, Madams name is scrawled across a couple of cases in the cool room for your next visit. Will you please convey my humble apologies for running out mid-stay? I fall on my sword for our faux pas, heads will continue to roll. Further, at Buckingham Place the customer is ALWAYS right - Mongooses it is, or they are, plus, if you really want to call Buckingham Place your ‘home’ I am delighted to concur. 

As ever, it was a pleasure to welcome you back. Time did fly, which hints perhaps at a much longer stay next time? Goodness knows how you’d fit a longer stay into your hectic non-stop-travel schedule, or how much Chardonnay we’d need to ship in, but we’ll happily do the needful to make it happen.
 
Thank you for coming back, and for yet another great review. A little less from the superlative factory this time but of equal eloquence and substance, and a perfect read to boot. I’m not sure if I told you this but for me your stays all morph into one. Like it or not, you have become part of this place now and we’re all as happy as can be with that too – indeed, long may the Chardonnay flow! 

Until next time and always, I wish you endless happy travels and a blissfully happy and healthy life.      

Heaped thanks!

Warm regards and big hugs,

Nick, Kalpa & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Our third visit to Buckingham Place and to our home from home. It's always great to catch up with Nick, Kalpa and the team to learn what has changed and more importantly, what has not.
The weather was a bit changeable but it just didn't matter. All of the extensive array of wildlife that we enjoy seeing was in evidence. More mongooses (yes, it really is) around this year we thought and more peacocks too. The lemurs swung by, many with young, as they often do. 
On the domesticated front, Bella ensured that she got around to see the guests every day even accompanying some guests down to the beach in the mornings but Gracie has become reclusive.
A new welcome addition is Sanjaya who comes in to play the piano every few days in the evening. He can add a blues spin to anything and has his own natural and improvised style. 
When we needed to obtain some asthma medication unexpectedly, the staff swung into action. They quickly located a product with the correct active ingredients and obtained it from a pharmacy in the local town in double quick time.
We will undoubtedly be back at Buckingham Place in the near future. Long may the Chardonnay flow!
title: Home and Away

ownerResponse/text:
Special guests adding the magic...

Having read your review again, I’m as bowled over as I was the first time, by its depth, integrity and reassurance for those in your footsteps. I believe however, whether I would be bowled over or not was irrelevant, you use Trip Advisor as it was intended; not to be nice or mean to an establishment, but first and foremost to advise travelers as they do you, with their own submissions. We are extremely fortunate therefore, to be viewed so favorably by an expert, with nearly 900 reviews under your belt you should be taken seriously!

Reviews aside, although yours is spectacular – thank you, it is no more so than the two of you, whom we have come to know well, respect, and are privileged to call friends of Buckingham Place, ‘returners’ you call them or as I do, the lovely folk who come back.

Two more gentle, classy, old-school travelers are impossible to imagine. You stay long enough to absorb and be absorbed, finding something in which to participate or instigating something yourselves. You add your own magic, lots of it, being as warm, friendly and sociable as anyone who has ever arrived on our doorstep.

Your interest in the team touched all of us, you took time not only to learn staff names, but also about their lives and roles they play at the hotel. You engaged with them as you did me and other guests, with everyone enjoying your company and feeling at ease in your presence. 

I’ll leave it there for now but say this, any hotel would be improved with you two in residence; thank you for coming back to this one - please, keep on being those lovely folk who do! 
   
Big hugs and thanks,

Warm wishes from us all

Nick & The Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you want frequent tea and coffee you can ask for a kettle and cups in your room.
text:
Well this small hotel has a lot of magic to enjoy.  We are one of the very many 'returners' to this warm and friendly hotel.  The staff are a real delight and really go the extra mile to make sure all works well with  your stay, as does the owner Nick who is ever present - and he enjoys a good chat whilst hosting the very 'house party' feel.     
The rooms are deliciously spacious all with nice views over the lake. Each room is nicely equipped with comfortable beds, good linen, a TV, little fridge with a few goodies to welcome you and wonderful bathrooms.  Early morning tea can be ordered to deliver to your room.    There are a mix of guests - with all ages loving this place. I think there is restriction on young children under 12.    It is a place to come and chill and truly relax, perhaps have a stroll on the beach, sit and watch the birds and occasional monkey, mongoose or lizard, but especially I adore the pool which is about 24 metres long and a place where people chill and relax.   The breakfasts are superb and there are lots of good snacks that can be ordered throughout the day and then a wonderful evening in the dining room is not to be missed.  The food is interesting and the team work hard to develop new dishes - but there are many great favourites as far as I am concerned.  The bar is a great place to meet before supper to meet other guests and have a good chat.  If you don't want to be sociable it is easy to relax too.  There is a simple but good Spa and there are nice walks around the local area.
title: This is a hotel with its only special unique magic - with plenty of return guests

ownerResponse/text:
Sorry you had to go home!

Your friends returned for a few more days as you know, and as I write, they are completely ‘with the program’ – the last ones down for breakfast bless them! 

I am so pleased your second stay measured up to your first, especially as you arrived with the friends you had kindly recommended the hotel to. I am also delighted that added an extra night to your stay, I only wish we could have offered you more availability in the first instance. 

I’m proud to say, we have welcomed so many familiar faces this season, in fact, not a day has passed without there being several former guests in residence – on some days occupying half the house or more. It’s great to now add your names to our long list of returnees, aka Friends of Buckingham Place, and I thank you on behalf of us all for your loyalty and for recommending us so highly. All of you together were a joy to host, it really was a pleasure to meet you again and welcome you back. With an abundance of ornithological and other experiences to be had, I hope you’ll keep on coming and that Sri Lanka keeps on giving. I can promise this, so long as you return soon, your wife won’t need an entirely new wardrobe - I don’t plan another repaint (just yet!).

Thank you for your good custom, smashing review (and photos), and your excellent company. Until next time and always have a blissfully happy and healthy life.

Warm regards & respect,
Nick & the Team.
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Gloriously quirky with imaginative use of vivid colours. No grey or beige in sight. Immaculately clean with excellent service and easy going friendly atmosphere. The man himself, Nick Buckingham, is a most interesting character and engages individually with all his guests. 
The breakfast is "bottomless" and the cuisine is very satisfying classy with a varying menu. All in US$ and definitely not overpriced.  
Relax and enjoy the lovely pool and the surrounds. The bar is small but with quality beer, wine and cocktails. 
This is the perfect base to visit the Lagoon Bird Sanctuary. Go early in the morning and enjoy the glorious sunrise. Right in front of the hotel you may time it right to watch turtles coming ashore to lay eggs on the beach.
Our second visit to BP and equally pleasant both times.
My wife Rani inadvertently blended in with the decor on our first day there.
title: Delightful, colourful and  electic antidote to greyness!

ownerResponse/text:
Another perfect review!

I pinch myself even now, more than 14 years since reading our first perfect review. I didn’t imagine then and almost can’t believe it now, how frequently and highly the hotel, its team or myself personally are praised. Moreover, I am so touched to realize that Buckingham Place has found a place in so many hearts. Some have asked whether I tire of replying to guest reviews but always, my answer is the same, how can I? Reading a perfect review is a great way to start the day – any hotelier will tell you! Therefore, sending my thanks as I do herewith is as natural and rewarding as reading the kind words you’ve written. Reviews this good are tremendously important to a hotel and, especially for us, being as we are somewhat off the beaten track and an independent local business without the back-up of an international or Sri Lankan ‘brand’. 

I’m delighted because you enjoyed yourselves so much and we measured up well enough for you to consider coming back. We would be delighted to welcome you back as I you must realize. The moment you’re in need of a ‘fantastic relaxed atmosphere, extreme comfort, mouth-watering food and exquisite staff’ please, just get packing!

Thank you for your valuable good custom, perfect review and excellent company. On behalf of the team, I hope you will give us the pleasure of welcoming you back soon.

Warm regards and respect

Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Buckingham Place for 4 x nights  and  we absolutely loved it. The reception area and spacious dining  room are warmly decorated in welcoming blues greens and  yellows  There  are plenty of  sun-beds beside the huge pool with stunning views of the sea beyond.  .The hotel is run by very friendly and attentive Nick who goes out  of his way to make sure you are well looked after by himself and his 
fantastic team of staff.  Our good sized  room was perfect with a very comfortable bed, bathroom with both and shower  plus a balcony where we enjoyed looking at the lagoon. The food was totally delicious with a great  breakfast choice  and a different dinner menu each night during our 4 x nights stay. I particularly enjoyed the seared tuna and green curry.  With a fantastic relaxed atmosphere, extreme comfort, mouth watering food and exquisite staff we definitely hope to return .
title: More like Buckingham Palace!

ownerResponse/text:
A Very Happy Anniversary!

Thank you for including Buckingham Place on your grand anniversary tour, and for adding extra happiness to our week. It was a privilege and pleasure hosting the pair of you, indeed, a whole lot of fun!
 
Your review is perfect so thank you again, and I love the photo’s, but it’s your empathy for the team and me personally that I find most touching. Those you single out for special mentions are absolutely delighted seeing their names in lights.
 
That our Watermelon martini measures up for an aficionado is surely high praise, as is your every kind word for us all. So yes, do come back please and for longer if you can, at least long enough to wander a little further down memory lane to try and discover where our paths met?

Once again, congratulations to you both on 30 happy years. Until next time and always, may the next 30 be as blissful! 

Warm regards and respect,

Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Remember to ask about the turtles. Adults might be laying or babies hatching on the pristine beach.
text:
We arrived to a torrential downpour and despite mixed weather during our brief two day stay, my wife and I had a terrific time at this colourful and luxurious hotel.   

Our huge open plan room (12) overlooking the large lagoon, was beautifully appointed with a very comfy bed, inside/outside bathroom and polished cement ‘titanium’ flooring with ‘Happy Anniversary’ thoughtfully spelt out in tiny flowers on the floor.

Our first evening at dinner was a rather raucous affair as it was a fellow guest’s 60th birthday, complete with a lively performance from the house pianist and an impressive display of beautiful and dramatic Sri Lankan folk dancing topped off by fireworks.

Our meal the next evening was also lovely and the restaurant decorated our table with flowers, candles and a beautifully stitched, ‘ Happy Anniversary’ silk banner.  It was very touching indeed.

Nick, the very kind and interesting English owner, quietly floats around in the background meticulously ensuring that everything is just so. The hotel - with its funky, minimalist architecture, vibrant artwork and exceptional infinity pool -  is very much his baby and he has a wonderful Sri Lankan team to pamper each and every guest.

The kitchen is a delight and the wine list thoughtfully selected and reasonably priced.  The cocktails in the attractive, poolside bar are superb.  My wife deemed her Watermelon Martini the best she’s ever had and trust me, she’s had a few!

Finally, many thanks to the hardworking team, in no particular order; Sheehan, Ruwan, Aruna, Swee anee (excellent massage therapist), Maru and Madu.

We very much hope to return one fine day and stay a little longer. 🙏🏼
title: Warm welcome and cool vibes at Buckingham Place.

ownerResponse/text:
Teamwork....

Thank you for coming to stay and then following up with this spectacular review. I’m proud to say it’s our second one today, and although there are never enough hours in my day, I shall enjoy replying!

Your review is a fitting and timely testament to a hardworking team, and whilst I thank you graciously for humbling me too, yours and every perfect review underline teamwork, secure and year-round, as the essential ingredient to the hotel's sustainability, as it enters its fifteenth year no less. As you know, many who work here joined during the construction phase, pre 2010 opening, and so long service is commonplace. For all 57 of them, I take this opportunity to thank you and every other kind guest for your empathy and immense respect towards those who served and cared for you during your stay; without its team the hotel is but a pile of bricks.

Thank you for your valuable good custom and spectacular review, it’s as perfect and thoughtful as you were as guests, so please come stay with us again!

Until next time (?) and always, I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life!

Warm regards & respect,
Nick & the Team

text: I have to say this hotel is exceptional, from the moment we arrived we know it would be. The staff, every one of them are truly amazing, such care and attention to detail. The owner Nick clearly goes above and beyond to ensure every single aspect of the hotel is designed to make your stay amazing, the rooms, the surroundings, the playlist whilst you are eating and the food which is absolutely delicious. We really enjoyed a beach walk each morning which sometimes Bella would also join us which was lovely. This hotel is magical and a testament to the hard work that all of the team clearly put in to make it the standard it is. Of course I can highly recommend it.

placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Buckingham Place is perfect and has a charming atmosphere amid the incredible setting.
I realise that is a bold statement but I honestly couldn’t find anything I didn’t like
First and foremost Nick and his team go out of their way to ensure you have the best holiday ever, it’s relaxing and really friendly
The rooms are well equipped and spacious, the bed was really comfortable and waking up with spectacular views of the lagoon was truly breathtaking, it’s also the little details that make this place amazing, like the rechargeable torch  in your room to light you on your way back after dinner.
The staff at Buckingham Place was awesome, nothing was too much trouble, their attention to detail was incredible and they really made us feel at home.
The food was excellent, every meal felt gourmet. I’m a vegetarian and will admit to being a little bit fussy but every day we had different delicious choices which I loved, well done Chef and team 
The pool area is lovely, and swimming in the infinity pool stopping occasionally to take in the back drop is a little slice of paradise
The grounds are kept immaculately clean, the staff work really hard to keep everything looking amazing, we really enjoyed seeing the wildlife with monkeys, peacocks, mongoose, water monitor and the most fantastic birds, there’s even a book in the room to help you identify them
I could go on, but I hope by now you’ve got the gist, this place is amazing and the only thing left for you to do is decide when you’re going to book it ❤️
title: Amazing hotel with fantastic location

Buckingham Place is a wonderful boutique hotel with views of the sea and the lagoon. It’s tranquil, calm and colourful ! The rooms are spacious and cool , the grounds are immaculate and the staff are wonderful. From the moment you check in you feel nurtured and cared for in every possible way and 
nothing is too much trouble !

ownerResponse/text:
A Happy Valentines Day…

A dog that can speak is rare I agree, but a hotelier that barks is nothing new!

When guests return so many times, staying up to a month at a time, there’s an inevitability that friendship will blossom but also, that things will go wrong occasionally. How many times have we all experiences a disastrous overnight hotel stay or a dreadful meal or service? Therefore, despite 1,190 unbelievably fabulous Trip Advisor reviews (as of today), there are 12 that are not, suggesting things go wrong here too, occasionally, and we are only human.

So firstly, thank you in heaps for what is surely the mother of all reviews?  I can’t recall one written deeper from the heart. But moreover, thank you for your spectacularly loyal good custom, empathy and friendship, plus the sublime Belgian chocolates and forgiveness always for occasional (if inevitable) small disasters and us being human - and thus fallible, albeit rarely!
 
There are simply not enough words to express how highly we regard the pair of you. You are in the DNA of Buckingham Place through and through, and in our hearts and happy memories, always. 

Thank you.

Love & respect 

‘Mr Nick’ & the Team
Ps. please come again - and again.
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Perfect place for long(er) stays.
text:
A dog that can speak is rare

So does the proverb go. Well a boutique hotel in Sri Lanka where one can sip Champagne with the owner, Mr. Nick, whilst listening to live music being played is even rarer. 

No wonder I returned for the 12th time to this little gem hidden near Rekawa (Tangalle) beach (where the giant turtles come to lay eggs) in the southern part of the island. 

It is a kind of heaven for those travellers looking for something extra. Your own private villa, a beautiful garden, 2 pools, no horrific music or tacky plastic chairs. No, here you get an army of professional staff catering for all your wishes. 

The villas are superb. You have your own balcony, a full complementary minibar, fully equipped bathroom, a safe, tv, huge bed, airco and VERY VERY CLEAN. Even so, if you want something extra they gave you a phone to call reception to bring an extra towel, water kettle, bottle of wine or whatever you can think of.   

One of the things I particularly like is the breakfast till late. You only woke up late morning? No problem at all. I’ll have that macchiato with a freshly squeezed (with a whatever you like) juice now please.  

There is a path next to the huge infinity pool that leads directly to the beach. Where,  with a bit of luck, you could see a huge mama turtle laying eggs or even sweeter a nest of mini turtles hatching from their eggs running towards the sea. 

Another prime bonus here is the professional spa. It is clean, has airco, a complete program of treatments and really good therapists. Discuss the treatment you want, choose the oil of your liking have the pressure adjusted… it is all ‘normal’ @ Buckingham Place. 

All day long you have an open kitchen, so whenever you are peckish call one of the waiters(yes they all speak English) or have their mixologist surprise you. 

Culinary highlight is the diner. Proceed for a pre diner cocktail in the bar or go direct to the table, oh the agony of choice. The kitchen is good and uses local ingredients. Fish is caught right in front of the hotel so any fresher is impossible as it will swim back to the sea it came from. Veggie choices are also available. 

There is a wine list available with wines ranging from 35-50 usd a bottle, wine by the glass is also possible. If you are not into alcohol a whole range of possibilities are also available. I strongly appreciate the availability of several sparkling waters. 

Mr Nick has been a hotelier for over a quarter of a century on this island, and runs his hotel like a Swiss clock. Thanks once again for a wonderful stay.
title: A dog that can speak is rare, Buckingham Place is even rarer

ownerResponse/text:

I also thank you for humbling me mercilessly but, do so on behalf of the team doing all the hard work here. I thank you again for being smashing guests - it was a delight and privilege to host and serve you, your valuable good custom, perfect review and excellent company are appreciated beyond words. 

Finally. That you’ll be back is the ultimate accolade, and a day that could not possibly come too soon - thank you for telling the world here on Trip Advisor! 

Until next time and always, I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life. 

Our respect and fond regards,

Nick, Kalpa & the Team

text:
From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, Nick and his team of 55 Sri Lankans made us feel very special.
So much thought has gone into what Nick wants his clientele to get out of their stay at the hotel. The food in the restaurant is excellent, the views out to sea are outstanding and the 33 metre swimming pool is welcome on hot days.
My wife and I treated ourselves to two spa treatments and they were the best we had on our trip to Sri Lanka. The staff were very professional.
Our room was delightful, very spacious and the bathroom with an outdoor shower and bath a real treat.
This is how a small boutique hotel should be run. Thank you! We will be back.
title: A very special place.

ownerResponse/text:
Outstanding guests in every way!

I'm overwhelmed by your very special review this morning and will share it with the team. Thank you very much for your kind support.

Every so often something touches my heart, and this is exactly what happened on the evening we helped the pair of you celebrate your anniversary. Your obvious, very genuine appreciation for everything the team did was in abundance, as was your kind respect for me that evening. You expressed this so sweetly at the time, making any effort we put in all the more worthwhile. Simply, it is so nice to give folk a treat that makes them smile all night, and, to know when they return home it will be with an enduring fond memory.  Often the simplest, most spontaneous ideas work best and are remembered.
 
It was our pleasure and privilege to host you, we'll remember you fondly and be delighted to welcome you back – soon hopefully, and for a longer please? For now, I take this opportunity to thank you for your valuable custom, this special review and your excellent laid-back company. I send my thanks and respect too for your civilized, commonsense view over a meal that may have upset you. We will never know and can’t rule it, so on behalf of us all I’m sorry if it did.

Until next time, I wish the both of you (and mum!) safe and happy travels and a blissfully happy life, always.

Our warm regards and respect,

Nick, Kalpa and the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you stay as long as you can to enjoy this piece of paradise.
text:
Of all the places we’ve stayed in Sri Lanka this sets the highest bar and we couldn’t praise it highly enough. From the greeting on our arrival, to the beautiful presentation of our room for our wedding anniversary, to the food, the views and the staff, everything was 100% perfect. We were personally approached by the owner Nick (an English man) on many occasions who took a genuine interest in all his guests. The staff were 100% attentive, knew the guests by name and took the utmost care with everyone. On the evening of our anniversary the staff had hung a ‘happy  anniversary’ banner above our table, decorated it with flowers and gave us a handmade card signed by all the staff, a beautiful touch.
The rooms are, as Nick described, a sanctuary for his guests and they a very roomy, very comfortable and styled beautifully. The bathroom featured an open air shower and a covered tub area. We had a balcony where we could sit and look out over the lagoon.
We thoroughly enjoyed the live piano by Sanjaya a local musician and the atmosphere was relaxed. We truely felt like we were being looked after in the best way possible, everyone made us feel so comfortable and at home.
We couldn’t recommend this place any higher, if we could give it 10 stars we would. Thank you so much Nick and the crew for making our time so enjoyable and special; we will be back!
title: Outstanding in every way!

ownerResponse/text:
Our happy place too.

Where to start? 

A little potty perhaps, but I still hold my breath as I read a review. I then pinch myself if they are as perfect as yours, so thank you for making me pinch myself.

Before becoming a hotelier, I could never have imagined guests taking us into their hearts, supporting us with regular good custom, or heaping praise on us afterwards as you’ve done - again. As ever, rarely do I know what to say when good folk say nice things about me but I will try again. If you see me at my best, it is because the both of you bring it out in me - not only in me but in everybody. 

This may be your happy place, but you make it everybody else's too. You are huge fun to have around and have become part of the place, as much for your sense of humour as your fascination with wildlife - even our frogs are missing you!

I’m thrilled - we all are, that you still come to stay and enjoy yourselves so much, and, that your stays are getting longer. Thanks for assuring me that as the place evolves it changes for the better and still feels like home, and that you still find interesting critters to follow around the garden and something nice on the menu after four visits.

Thanks again for coming back, for being great sports, and for your loyal support for the fourth time. We hope you’ll keep on coming as others do and continue doing your bit to keep this place a happy space for all.

Thank you, have a great year and stay blissfully happy.

Respect & big hugs

Nick, Kalpa & the Team xx
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get in touch if you have questions
text:
This was our 4th visit to the incomparable Mr Nick's (😉) amazing hotel, each time we have stayed for longer, this time for 2 solid weeks. As soon as we recognised the familiar surroundings we were back in our happy place. Familiar faces amongst the amazing team were warmly greeted and we settled in. The food choices, quality and service were, as ever, excellent. The dinner menu has changed since our last visit, giving more options for those staying for longer than the 5 day menu rotation. We have our menu favourites  and to be able to choose these on multiple occasions made us happy. As always all food is fresh, well cooked and presented, having pre-dinner nibbles and drinks in the bar talking to other guests was nice. Both pools are immaculate, bed chairs and towels are clean and comfortable. The evening frog and toad journey through the pool, restaurant and bar kept me entertained. The rooms, we stayed in 2 due to availability, were cleaned daily, large and perfectly adequate, if you need anything just ask!
There are plenty of places to walk to see the wonderful wildlife that Sri Lanka has to offer, do ask Kalpa to arrange a visit to the Rekawa Turtle Sanctuary next door, or Kalamatiya bird sanctuary both are great value. There's a reason that people return, we met several that have whilst we were there, and it's the familiarity and comfortable atmosphere that Nick has created. It's our happy place...make it yours!
title: Our happy place

ownerResponse/text:
Please excuse errors in translation...

Thank you very much.

Many thanks for your wonderful review, I’m delighted you enjoyed a relaxing stay and felt good! From myself and on behalf of the team that does all the work, thank you for your sharing your observations and great compliments, it was a pleasure and privilege to host you, and to ensure you got the best from your stay. Thanks too for a timely swimming advisory, which, can never be given too many times. We include one on our website; the online booking platforms; and advise all travel agents that whilst our beach is one of the most spectacular on the south coast, its waves are not for swimming! Accessible sea and a good swim are never far away however, if Rekawa’s rock-pool (c15-minute walk) or our swimming pools don’t quite meet ones needs.

Your review is second to none, very helpful, and genuinely appreciated. Thank you for sharing your experience and so positively, and of course for your valuable good custom and excellent company.

Please come again, until then and always I wish you happy and safe travels, and a blissfully happy life.

Warm regards and respect,
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Tolles Hotel mit direktem Zugang zum Strand. Leider kann man auf Grund der starken Strömungen nicht im Meer schwimmen. Es gibt aber zwei schöne Pools.
Der Inhaber und das gesamte Personal sind extrem freundlich, aufmerksam und zuvorkommend. Es herrscht eine angenehme und entspannte Atmosphäre, einfach zum wohlfühlen.
Das Essen und das Frühstück sind ausgezeichnet.
Man übernachtet in freistehenden Bungalows, in denen jeweils nur ein Zimmer mit Bad untergebracht ist. Die Zimmer sind sehr geräumig und sauber. Das große Badezimmer ist verfügt über eine Freiluftdusche mit einem seitlich offenen Glasdach.
Alles in allem hatten wir einen fantastischen Aufenthalt.
title: Entspannen und Wohlfühlen in einer herrlichen Anlage

ownerResponse/text:
Just fabulous - thank you!

I am very happy to say, Sri Lanka tourism has finally rebounded, and the hotel has remained in full swing since mid-December, thanks in very large part to fabulous recommendations like yours – thank you. Since early December and until the end of season, not a day will pass without us meeting folk we’ve hosted before. Many like you, rarely return anywhere, let alone to a destination far from home. But, many do, as I hope you will – if you are already thinking about it then you are halfway here!

Thank you for your respect and lovely compliments for the team, they will be chuffed to be recognized, when they eventually get a moment to catch up with reviews for the season. Your kind words for me too are humbling (I never know what to say but thank you) and I accept them graciously on behalf of those who pull out all the stops to make Buckingham Place a standout memory for all the right reasons – and a key reason to return to the Paradise Isle.         

Your good custom and fab review are genuinely respected and very much appreciated. Above all, however, thank you for your excellent company. It has been a pleasure and privilege to host and serve you.

Until next time (?) and always I wish you safe and happy travels and a blissfully happy life!

Our warmest regards,
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here as part of our trip via Rickshaw Travel/Heritage expediciones for 5 nights. 

The thing that stood out at this hotel was the amazing staff and atmosphere.  It wasn't your typical boutique hotel that concentrates on style alone.  It has a vibrant and welcoming feel and the service was first class.  The staff were friendly and Nick the owner made you feel part of the family as soon as you arrived.  If you wanted to be left to yourself that was not a problem either but if you needed anything it was not a problem and always done with a smile.

It was my birthday while I was there and my husband arranged a number of surprises on the day with the help of Kalpa that made the day all the more special.

The room (standard) was comfortable with a large bathroom including shower and bathtub and balcony.  The breakfast menu was extensive and included lighter options (such as fruit and toast) as well as good mains.  We also ate here in the evening and the menu varied daily and had a selection of meat, fish, veggie dishes.

We also had a massage while we were here (arranged as part of our trip) which was fantastic.

We aren't generally people who go back to the same hotel/resort but think we might be making this the exception to that!
title: Amazing stay - we're already talking about a return visit!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review.

I am delighted you enjoyed your stay so much that you review the hotel so enthusiastically and aim to return - like so many do I'm proud to say. Your aim to return is obviously the ultimate compliment and so reassuring, as it is only the continuous kind patronage of local and overseas travelers that sustains 55 permanent jobs at Buckingham Place including mine, plus an estimated 200 livelihoods in this and surrounding communities. 

I take this opportunity to send warm regards to all our Australian friends, including those in the hotel as I write. We look forward to seeing you all back in Sri Lanka very soon.

Best wishes
Kalpa Nuwan (General Manager)

text:
What a beautiful hotel. The owner Nick is very welcoming and the entire are all fabulous! They are all very attentive and helpful. As a beauty therapist and ex massage therapist, I had the 1.5hour Aryuvedic Massage and it was the best massage I have ever had! Thank you. Even after falling ill for one day I still enjoyed my stay and was well looked after. As an Aussie, I definitely value the beach and what a beach/coast Nick's hotel sits on! A little added bonus are Nick's dogs. Bella joined us on our morning walk. 
Thank you all, hopefully see you again 😁
title: Australian in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Happy New Year!

With the fabulous festivities behind us, we settle into 2025, our 15th year. Your smashing review, the first this year, reminds me how blessed we are to still boast some of the best guest lists on the island; lists not of big celebrities but of bright stars; not of millionaire jet set types but more discerning ones, for whom, the value of sanctuary is greater than its price tag and opulence, and that contribute so much to the conviviality of a gathering of likeminded souls.

In short, Buckingham Place is for folk like you two; laid back, interesting and a joy to be with. I am so delighted you came, I and everyone you met enjoyed meeting you, and Christmas will be all the more memorable for your presence. So, thank you for coming, and for writing so eloquently about your time with us. Thank you for telling the world you can’t wait to return (that would do it for me) and for your respected, valuable good custom. Above all… thank you for your excellent company, it was a privilege and joy to host you.

Please return, the sooner the better is fine with us, in the meantime (and always) I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life.

Warm regards and respect - and a big hug from us all!

Nick & the Team
Ps. thank you, for your good wishes for us all and me personally.
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay longer !
text:
Stay here for longer than you intend!  We enjoyed an unforgettable 9 night stay over Xmas in this most wonderful gem of an hotel in a breathtaking setting with hospitality and service that surpassed our expectations. The warmth, friendliness and efficiency from everyone was truly outstanding. 
It’s the kind of place you can check out from but you can never leave. The level of service surpasses most 5* hotels by far.  Stunning grounds, glorious pools, wildlife galore, delicious food, lovely rooms. What’s not to like?! 
It doesn’t really get any better than this. The invitation is to truly kick back and enjoy yourselves. 
The beach in front is absolutely stunning with the thunderous roar  of the crashing waves. 
We did an amazing day trip to Udawalawe park. 
A pleasure chatting to Nick the owner and wishing you a speedy recovery. Your Place  is amazing and can’t wait to return. 
Thanks to Kalpa,  Madu and all the staff 🙏
title: A twinkling Gem of a place

ownerResponse/text:

Reviews don’t come better and recalling you both, guests don’t come kinder or more respectful and appreciative than you. I’m delighted and very proud to read your unequivocal ‘thumbs up’ for Buckingham Place; delighted because it couldn’t be bettered or better timed, and proud to be told that my team and hotel lived up to expectations and made you smile. Thank you for stopping off to spoil yourselves and for being a joy to host. roomTip: Buckingham Place is near a local Turtle experience, where you can visit the beach at night to see Turtles laying their eggs.
text:
We stayed at Buckingham Place for the last 5 days  of our nearly 4 week travels around Sri Lanka. The rest of our trip had been pretty budget, so we decided to splash out and spoil ourselves at the end. Buckingham Place exceeded our expectations in all ways. 
Rooms are spaced out in the gorgeous grounds, ensuring peace and quiet and privacy. They're well appointed, very spacious and beautifully clean. The bed was comfy and the open air bathroom was a cool feature.
Staff are quietly attentive, anticipating what you need, whether it be a foot stool for your feet, another drink, or a fresh towel for your poolside lounger.
We had breakfast provided as part of our deal - a lovely variety of choice, so we worked our way through the menu.
The dinner menu was of a high standard and changed nightly, with both Sri Lankan and European/fusion choices, so the food also become one of the highlights of our stay.
The pool is gorgeous, the swim up bar well tended and all in all, we couldn't fault our stay. Well worth the cost for a relaxing, pampered time.
Buckingham Place sits at the crossroads of friendly, personalized luxury and owner Nick and his team do it very well.
Thank you for my little birthday celebration, too, guys!

Irene & Mike, NZ
title: Friendly, personalized luxury

roomTip: Try the cooking night.
text:
Walawa is an exceptional place to stay with staff who are extremely helpful and grounds that transport you to a sanctuary within close reach of Colombo Airport. It is not however just a place to stay when you land or before you depart but a great place to explore from and the hotel can arrange transport to Colombo Town or other nearby places - our driver Selvam was fantastic.
We booked the cooking night which was amazing as we cooked with all the fresh ingredients in clay pots on a stove and got to eat the delicious curries the chefs helped us to cook. The food was really good and a good variety offered. Family of 4 - children and adults had lots of options they enjoyed. Rooms were large and very clean. The whole experience was amazing and Saliya, the manager, was always on hand to ensure we were well looked after throughout our stay. Thank you to all the staff and we will definitely be back.
title: An amazing place to relax and stay in and not just an airport hotel!

placeInfo/name: Sigiriya Forest Edge By Marino Leisure
text:
A lovely experience at Sigiriya Forest Edge with me and my girlfriend for two nights. The bed and room were very comfortable with great A/C. The restaurant, swimming pool and gym/table tennis/pool facilities were all very nice. A great selection for breakfast with Sri Lanka authentic cuisine alongside some more Western options. It is 30 minutes into Dambulla, with a visit to the cave temples a very good experience. The taxi/tuk tuk there is about 2,500 LKR each way (£7ish). Sirigiya rock and town are much closer, we hiked up Pidurangala rock for sunset and stopped off for some dinner with a tuk tuk driven by Lahiru which was arranged by the hotel. Highly recommend arranging this through the hotel for transparent prices and good driving! 
All in all, a fantastic way to start out 2 week adventure in Sri Lanka
title: Great Couple of Days

text:
We spent 4 nights here in February 2025 and our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. 
Large spacious rooms with a very comfortable bed and complementary snacks (I love a complementary snack)

The pool and hot tub were spotlessly clean and a decent size.
We had breakfast and dinner here each day. Both were excellent. Particular thanks to our waiter - Shehan - who was very professional and engaging.

We did two trips out - Dambulla Cave Temple & the Lion Rock but passed on the long trip to Polonnaruwu & its off-putting entrance fee (US$35) and were just happy to enjoy the tranquility of the hotel. And the table tennis.

I made use of the hotel's bicycles - lots of easy traffic-free roads (albeit watch out for the crazy dogs). A cycle ride to Lion Rock is flat and straightforward - about 40 minutes each way.
title: Highly Recommended
