Sakuni Wisanperuma
placeInfo/address: Minuwangoda Road, Kotugoda Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for one night at the start of our visit to Sri Lanka and for two at the end. What an absolutely beautiful property; a true haven tucked away yet so close to the airport making it the perfect place to relax after a long journey from the UK and likewise after a busy tour of Sri Lanka.

Our first night was in the Mountbatten suite, the latter two in the family room. Both rooms were immaculate, spacious and comfortable. The hotel has such a relaxing, peaceful atmosphere. The staff here are all so helpful and kind. 

The hospitality in the restaurant is first class. The dining is so flexible, the menu is varied with a good mix of western and Sri Lankan cuisine. We throughly enjoyed every breakfast lunch and dinner that we ate here. We’d like to give special thanks to Kapila, Rick and Lishanth in particular for taking such good care of us. Remembering us from our first night and asking how our tour had gone when we returned. We were so grateful to Rick for giving us a tour of the garden, definitely try to do this if you have chance during your stay. 

We were extremely grateful to have had a late checkout which allowed us to make the best of our last day in Sri Lanka, enjoying the pool and gardens here. Thank you so much!

We are already planning our return to Sri Lanka next summer, of course beginning and ending our journey here at the wonderful Wallawaa. In fact we have been so impressed by the property, food and incredible hospitality here, we are planning on staying at two other Tear Drop properties during our tour next year. Thank you to everyone in the team here we are counting the days until we are back.
title: A beautiful haven.

roomTip: Book in for a spa treatment!
text:
Wallawwa is a beautiful wellness focused hotel located about 15-20mins from the airport. It’s the perfect way to start or end your visit to Sri Lanka. We stayed on the way out and my only regret was not staying longer and not staying there on our first night as well! It’s run by the Teardrop Group who have the most incredible properties across Sri Lanka (definitely look into them for your holiday) and we were lucky to stay at most of them during our 2 week honeymoon. The food and staff are the best of the best and they really know how to make you feel comfortable and looked after. The massages/spa treatments are also amazing! Highly recommend. 

Special thank you to the chefs and staff who put on a private dinner by the pool for our last night of our honeymoon - it was a really special way to end out the trip!
title: A must stay on way in or out of Sri Lanka!

text:
An airport hotel with a difference, you will never want to leave!
This is our second visit to wonderful Wallawwa. 
We have recommended this property to countless family and friends over the years. 
Regardless if your arriving at Colombo airport Sri Lanka, or on your way home, don't miss a stay at this boutique hotel which is only 20 min from the airport.
We stayed two nights this trip so we could do a day trip to Colombo and really enjoy the property.
Our first visit 8 years ago was purley transit so we only stayed for one night as a family. We did not want to make that mistake again, one night is not enough. 
This trip was in conjunction with our daughters destination wedding so Wallawwa had many of the extended and immediate family staying at various times. 
All family members who stayed at Wallawwa could not believe how special it is. 
As with all the Teardrop Hotels, Social Hour is a great time to enjoy an evening GnT in the beautiful pavillions or garden. Wallawwa boasts an impressive bar with 5 star service. 
We especially love the relaxing pool area. It is lovely to soak away a long transit in such an amazing property.
title: Historical tranquil Wallawwa, an airport hotel that is different from all the rest!

placeInfo/address: Idigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Sigiriya Forest Edge By Marino Leisure
text:
A++++. Best place we have stayed in Sri Lanka. Stayed for 2 nights. Wish I could have stayed for a week. 

Service is impeccable. Its currently a smaller place (due to expand) so you feel
so well known and cared for. They anticipate your needs and delver with joy. 

Rooms (villas) are amazing. So spacious. Beds are comfortable. Minibar is free- yes, you read right. Super safe (gated). The walk down from your villa is beautiful. And who doesn’t want to wake up to monkeys crossing your roof in the morning. 

Food is a standout. Please try their pastries- could have eaten them al day. Curries are divine. Breakfast is substantial (remember the pastries!). We tried to eat the whole menu. They have their own herb, vege and fruit garden on site so you know it’s fresh! Definitely eat in and give the food a go. 

Activities are plentiful. We had a ball trying out the air rifling and archery. Billards and table tennis. The pool
and spa. We didn’t use the gym - climbing up Sigiriya was enough exercise.

Location was fabulous- easy to get to the main sites and they can assist with transport if you need.  We also used their laundry service - done perfectly and in time. 

Traveled with family in a group of seven. Two week tour of Sri Lanka mainly staying at 5 star properties. This is a standout.
title: Perfect stay. Standout service and food.

ownerResponse/text:
Please excuse errors of translation.

I am so pleased to have had an opportunity to thank you in person for this perfect review. Nothing I could write here could possibly express how much we all appreciate your gracious support, valuable custom and fine company. 

Over the years, I have become less frustrated by my inability to speak a language other than English. I have learned, the spoken word is only part of the story, conversation is about so much more. Actions, expressions and body language are generally enough to tell me and most people about someone – and I have become an expert! So, despite not sharing a common language it was easy to determine we were hosting two genuine, gentle, delightful, highly appreciative guests, both of whom with an empathy and immense respect for my team. Without language we figured out what you needed and how to get along nicely, and our week with you here was a happy one as it was for you. So, I thank you for choosing Buckingham Place, for bringing good custom to us and, supporting us magnificently with a ‘big thumbs up’ review. It was a pleasure and our privilege to host you both so it could go without saying, we would be happy and proud to serve you again. I am so pleased the hotel gave you what it gives me each day; the calm serenity of nature, the honest warmth of a welcome, and people who genuinely care. 

Thank you on behalf of us all, please do come back, in the meantime I wish you both a healthy, safe and blissfully happy life! 

Warm wishes & respect,

Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Невероятно красивый, уютный, просто чудесный отель, который однозначно заслуживает 5 звезд и оценки 10 из 5 баллов!
Наслаждение природой, прекрасно продуманной посадкой растений и цветов на территории, где вы можете наблюдать множество птиц, пальмовых белок, милейших обезьян, попугаев, павлинов, варанов, белок, бабочек, а также на пляже огромных черепах и их малышей. Номер просторный, роскошная ванная комната с тропическим душем под открытым небом. Чай и кофе на террасе с потрясающим видом на лагуну, панорамный ресторан с вкуснейшей кухней и видом на океан, чистейший инфинити-бассейн - все это великолепно организовано Ником Букингем, именем которого назван отель и который делает все, чтобы ваш отдых был незабываемым, все продумано до мельчайших деталей с любовью! Команда отеля- высокопрофессиональные люди, от чуткого внимания которых ничего не ускользнет. Чистота везде и во всем! Территория ухоженная, ни один листик не останется без внимания, идеальный газон, свежее белье и полотенца! Я -люблю путешествовать и для меня ленивый отдых неприемлем, но это место заставляет расслабиться и забыть все проблемы и отвлечься от суеты! Завтрак лично для вас приготовят в любое время дня, ужин ежедневно абсолютно разный, в течение дня предлагают вкуснейшие коктейли и воду.
Всегда с заботой вас ждут с пляжа со стаканом ледяной воды. Кстати, калитка на пляж закрывается в 18:00, но это не проблема, можно пройти через проход, где находится экскурсионное агентство .
 Дизайн отеля - это отдельный вид искусства! Яркая палитра, фантастические картины, атмосфера уюта, умиротворенная музыка, живые цветы, свечи -  создают  незабываемое чувство радости и тепла! Слово депрессия здесь будет искоренено!
Магазинов рядом нет, есть множество кафешек, но желания в них есть нет, кухня отеля настолько изысканная!
Можно посредством менеджера вызвать тук тук, водитель которого учтет все ваши желания и остановится, чтобы вы смогли сфотографировать птичку или варана, чтобы вы смогли купить фрукты или кокос по дороге. В целом все рады быть вам полезны!
А какое трогательное прощание- вся команда выходит и ласково вам машет в дорогу…
Я искренне рекомендую этот отель, где вы себя ощутите самым желанным гостем!
title: Райское место, умиротворение, безмятежность  и комфорт!

ownerResponse/text:
Heartwarming…

I never cease to be amazed by the sheer enthusiasm of our guests, and their heartfelt appreciation for what do - which is simply to encourage everyone to relax, enjoy a self-indulgent few days, and to not feel guilty about it! 

Your review truly is heartwarming - thank you; you compliment everything I also like about being here; a friendly and helpful team, the hotels calm ambience, abundant wildlife and verdant gardens – and not forgetting the dogs, but you praise me mercilessly too! To be truthful it is a loyal committed team of 55 that does all the hard work and deserves the accolades, but I accept graciously and thank you on behalf of them all. 

I try not to forget how fortunate I am to live here year-round and promise readers of my reply, one rarely tires of being here, not even after 22 years. So go ahead, book a long stay with confidence, and reach a level of relaxation we rarely treat ourselves to.        

Thanks again for bringing your valuable custom and good selves to Buckingham Place, and for your kind words of support which I’m thrilled to see on an online booking website this morning - twice as helpful. Your support comes at a critical time of year, the commencement of our winter season. Thank you, you reassure us we are ready, while instilling confidence in those in your footsteps to come. 

You were delightful guest, so we would be over the moon to welcome you again, preferably for longer as you say! In the meantime and for always I wish you a healthy, peaceful and blissfully happy life!

Sincere thanks for your patronage and kind support.

Warm regards & respect,
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Buckingham Place is a little piece of paradise. It's such a peaceful place with amazing staff and an extraordinary owner who really looks after his guests and ensures the best quality in all areas: Our room, the tree house (honeymoon suite), was very spacious, super clean, with a good bed, a comfortable sofa and views of the lagoon. The open-plan bathroom is wonderful, with a palm tree towering into the sky in the centre. Bathroom amenities smell so good and are provided in ceramic bottles. No plastic in the whole hotel! This is how it should be 👍🏼 From the balcony, you can watch the peacock dance and countless birds. The birdsong is the only thing you can hear here. If you are looking for absolute peace and relaxation in a perfectly manicured tropical garden, this is the place for you. There are two pools, we had the smaller garden pool all to ourselves - only an iguana kept us company. An attentive member of staff even brought us a delicious fruit juice. 
In general, the hotel offers a ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️star service. The guest is really looked after here, always with the utmost discretion. Many thanks to the whole team! The food in the Oceanfront Restaurant is excellent, you eat in stylish & colourful surroundings, quiet and private. Room service and fresh coffee in the early morning are free of charge. 
Everything is just right here, the attention to detail makes all the difference. Nick, the owner, runs the hotel with passion and skill. Never before have we experienced such a committed hotelier - and we travel very often. He has an exceptional personality and is a pleasure to talk to. The whole team is top professional and always with a warm smile. Special thanks also to Kalpa for being such a friendly, reachable and reliable manager! We also immediately took Bella the dog to our hearts, she accompanied us on the wonderfully wild and deserted beach. Thanks to Nick and his team for two unforgettable days. We'll be back - but for longer! 💖
title: Heaven of peace & nature

ownerResponse/text:
Hola!

Thank you for staying with us, and, for your wonderful compliments and kind congratulations. You reward us all, noticing the details (many are ideas from our guests) and expressing gratitude for the dedication of my Team. I do wish I was multilingual however, so I might converse fully with everybody I meet - this very much came to mind when we met. A guest said recently “smiles on our faces is all the communication you need”. So, I will judge by your smiles and this perfect review, that the hotel speaks in other languages including Spanish, and is as welcoming of all nationalities as rightly it should be!  

I am delighted you were satisfied with the hotel and all of us. Thank you for telling fellow travelers of Spain, and indeed all travelers of the World! Finally, Thank you for your valuable custom and delightfully kind words, we much appreciate both.

Please come again, in the meantime I send Seasons Greeting and wish you both, a blissfully happy life.

Warm wishes and respect
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Experiencia completamente satisfactoria ,con servicio impecable,
comida excelente y Spa magnífico.
La decoración funcional y muy alegre está cuidada al máximo ,los textiles destacan por el tejido de loneta y combinación de colores perfecta.
Buena política de propinas que se aporta en el check out y se reparte entre el personal.
Felicitaciones al propietario por el cariño que se ve en todos los detalles ,tanto organizativos como de confort.
title: Satisfacción plena

ownerResponse/text:
I think you were ready…

Thank you for making us smile (again) with your second fabulous review, another in a long series, I hope?

Having been well and truly through the mill over recent years, you arrived at Buckingham Place more than ready for a holiday. In fact, I swear had we allocated a broom cupboard you’d have been happy with it, just to have the past behind you and two blissful weeks ahead – which they certainly were for us.

Those of us in the house from your previous stay looked forward to welcoming you back, and any new members soon discovered for themselves that to host and serve you is a joy and a privilege. Always ready to share some lighthearted banter or engage fully, you make everyone around you feel at ease and genuinely appreciated. Then there’s the generosity, and your enthusiasm to help out. I can’t thank you enough for answering my prayers with the sherry, but as if that wasn’t enough, many thanks for arriving laden with Christmas goodies to surprise us. I absolutely promise not to share them!! Simply, you are non-stop lovely to us all day long, even before the airport check-in counter and after your hols, by going to considerable lengths to write a comprehensive review to support us and help fellow travelers. Everyone one you’ve made mention of by the way, is chuffed to bits!

Thank you again for your valuable custom, two fabulous reviews (so far), two weeks of excellent company, and, for being such thoughtful heroes. We thoroughly enjoyed your stay and look forward to the next, the question is, have YOU packed yet? 

With fond regards, respect and great big hugs! 

Ayubowan

Nick & the Team xx
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay as long as you can.
text:
We visited BP 5 years ago and you can see our thoughts  “A Haven on Earth” dated  April 2019 in the long list of fabulous reviews below.
When we left in 2019 we already knew we wanted to return. This is unusual as we generally take the view that there are so many places to visit all around the world. Also, in instances where we do thoroughly enjoy ourselves there is a concern whether a second visit would be as enchanting and do we risk spoiling the first visit memories. Fast forward 5 years, through a pandemic, retirement, losing family members and life in general and we were ready and able to return.
On arrival to this 5 acre site, you are immediately greeted by genuine, warm, friendly smiling staff whose sole aim is to ensure you have the best possible stay. The sense of tranquillity is immediate, and we were taken straight to our large accommodation comprising open plan bedroom and seating area, with separate room containing a wardrobe, safe, storage area for luggage and fridge (stocked daily with water, ginger beer, complimentary nuts and sweets). There is also a huge bathroom area with sink, w.c., bidet, sunken bath and separate shower, the latter two being open air so you can bathe or shower and look at the stars.  Many of the rooms enjoy the benefit of views across Rekawa Lagoon.
Although the entire property has been repainted and refurbished since our last visit, many things remain the same. The staff are still attentive and keen to look after you. The restaurant still produces a wide range of breakfasts, which can still also be enjoyed in a location of your choice and at a time that suits you. There are also snacks available during the day and evening menus catering to vegetarian, local and European tastes. The menu changes over the course of a few days. Additionally you can request a starter be made into a main course. We were fortunate to be staying 14 nights on this occasion and found no difficulty in choosing interesting dishes each day, all of which were freshly cooked and delicious.
As you will gather from reading a number of reviews of BP, this is a place to relax, unwind and allow others to take care of you. The owner, Mr Nick Buckingham has created a well thought out, serene , boutique hotel, ably and willingly supported by a team of between 50 and 60 staff. Nick fell in love with Sri Lanka and made it his home. His staff and their families reliant upon the success of BP.  We intend to continue our support as we are already planning the next visit.
Our gratitude and best wishes to Nick, Kalpa, Chamindu, Madu (day 6 when we arrived), Deepal (No.1 Commander), Ruan (No.2 Commander), Assan, Arsan, Aruna, Niluka, Madu, Sharnika (accounts), Vajiray and Srianne at the Spa.  We apologise to the Garden, Housekeeping and Restaurant Teams, some of  whom we met but whose names we do not know.  Collectively, you have succeeded in delivering a truly memorable holiday that felt like a loving, warm embrace.
We are off now to start packing for our return.  Ayubowan.
title: Have You Packed Yet?

ownerResponse/text:
Heavenly Honeymooners...

After reading your spectacular reviews (with great pics) this morning, our day can’t possibly get better. Thank you, your kind words are pinging around the hotel as I reply.

A more enthusiastic or empathetic couple I struggle to recall - you are remembered fondly for being so. When we first met, I did wonder whether our slow pace would suit you but clearly, I needn’t have worried at all. The sanctuary of Buckingham Place was just what you needed. As for me, I was in my element having cool, interesting folk to natter with. I appreciated your interest in the hotel and its back stories as much as your genuine kindness towards us all. For the team, every member who met you, your warmth and admiration for them all were in abundance, simply you made everybody's day. Some travelers overlook or worse, lack patience for hotel staff who work their socks off adapting to our culture and language, invariably as they indulge our peculiar whims! Not so you, far from it, taking time to ‘shoot the breeze’ with everyone regardless of status, genuinely, with empathy and respect, touched us all.

Your unequivocal thumbs up for what we do warms our hearts and makes us smile, and your good custom is highly prized. That you chose our hotel for a week of your honeymoon was a pleasure and privilege for us, but that you made time for us all makes you truly memorable, so I thank you for this above all else.

Please return someday soon, in the meantime and always, I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life together.

With respect and affection

Nick, Kalpa, Chamindu, Madu and the entire team.
Ps. Madu (recently joined us) was especially chuffed with his first mention!
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
If you’re reading this you’re considering a stay in Buckingham Place. Don’t waste your time with these reviews - book it now, book if for sooner than you planned, book it for longer and let yourself be blown away by the level of service and stunning surroundings. 

This is a 5* hotel with all the charm of a luxury boutique hotel whilst being warm, welcoming and unpretentious. We stayed for our honeymoon and ended up extending our stay as we loved it so much. Never been much of a beach dweller but Buckingham place allows you to truly switch off. Waking up to the lagoon and lying on the Indian Ocean through the day. The place is a menagerie with peacocks, monkeys and mongooses trotting around the property - amazing to watch their routine from the terraces. 

The team led by Madu, Kalpa and Chamindu couldn’t do enough for you, whilst not being overbearing but preempting your every need with minimal fuss. Just heaven. 

The owner Nick and his lovely dogs Bella and Gracie gave the place a homely feel and their love of Sri Lanka was infectious. 

The food was excellent and a great balance of local and European food and the team were so accommodating of any dietary preferences. 

Especially enjoyed my spa treatments- definitely factor this in to your stay.
title: Exceptional luxury boutique hotel in stunning grounds with the best staff

ownerResponse/text:
Please forgive errors in translation.

Perfect guests, perfect review...

The team and I were thrilled to read your perfect review this morning. On behalf of us all, thank you for your kind praise and for taking time to bring smiles to our faces! 

Every single review helps. We deeply appreciate yours, along with all of the incredible support we’ve been blessed with since 2010. Recent and unqualified recommendation however, from an experienced traveler, can help that little bit more. Reinforcing what others say will reassure fellow travelers making plans for the upcoming winter season, and underlining our website swimming advisory helps keep everyone safe! On this, throughout the year we suggest safer beaches for swimming nearby, although none are quite as empty or quite as beautiful as Rekawa’s, nor prime nesting grounds for 5 species of sea turtle. 

I’m delighted you enjoyed your stay (as did we all) and add personal thanks for being such sociable guests. Thank you for your valuable custom, a perfect review and your excellent company - I hope we have the privilege to welcome you back one day but until then and always, I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life.
   
Warm regards & respect,

Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Auf unserer Sri Lanka - Rundreise haben wir auch ein paar Tage im Buckingham Place verbracht. Wir kennen schon sehr sehr viele Hotels, aber dieses Hotel hat unsere Erwartungen weit übertroffen. Der Service ist aussergewöhnlich gut, die Mitarbeiter sind dermaßen serviceorientiert, das haben wir bisher kein zweites Mal bei unseren vielen Reisen erlebt. Man merkt, dass es ein Inhabergeführtes Hotel ist und Nick Burmingham kümmert sich selbst um das kleinste Detail. Beeindruckend. Das Essen - Frühstück und Abendessen - ist auf Top Level und hat schon Sterneniveau. 
Wer hier einige Tage verbracht hat, sieht die Schwächen der anderen Hotels umso mehr.
Uneingeschränkte Empfehlung. 
P.S.: wer im Meer baden möchte, wird enttäuscht sein. Die Wellen sind so mächtig, Steine im Meer, da ist Baden unmöglich. Auch der weiter entfernt gelegene Felsenpool ist kein wirklicher Ersatz.
title: Paradiesisch

ownerResponse/text:
REVIEW MASTERCLASS – SINCERE THANKS

Thank you for coming to stay, and for your eloquent, resounding thumbs up for us all as well and the hotel itself. Your review could not be better or better timed to be frank, with winter season almost upon us. All praise, even constructive criticism is welcome and greatly appreciated, however, your masterclass review could not be more so nor make us happier!

To have created a place that in its fifteenth year is still on point and making people smile has become the pinnacle of my working life (so far), but I’m not finished yet, not by a long way. To their credit, it’s actually the team that does all the hard work at Buckingham Place. So, whilst I graciously accept your fabulous praise I do so humbled, and on behalf of them all.

I believe you discovered, spending just a couple of days with us can leave some folk wishing they’d booked for longer. We’re lucky to host every traveler we meet and for however long, but I do hope next time sees you kick of your shoes for a lot longer, if for no other reason than to swap more stories! It was a pleasure meeting you both and our privilege to host you. Thank you for your valuable good custom, sublime, masterclass review and excellent company. 

Until we meet again and for always, I wish you happy travels and a blissfully happy life,

Warm regards and respect
Nick, Kalpa & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is truly a feast for all the senses and one that should be experienced by everyone who appreciates a one-off, special boutique hotel. When you arrive, the first impression is the eye-catching candy colours of the buildings. Then the roar of the ocean and the vivid pinks and oranges of the handbook soft furnishings.
I did not know what to look at first.
Nick and his team are a tour de force. Other hotels especially in Europe could take notes from here. THIS is how you do it.
Our room with the palm tree in the bathroom was sublime. The food and drinks were outstanding. Get the breakfast chilli fried eggs with curry bacon and pol sambol. 
Meeting and chatting to Nick was the cherry on top of the icing on the cake. 
I am not a beach person but we wished we had given ourselves more time here. We had two nights and loved every second.
Go here and go soon, lest Nick decides to take a well-earned retirement. We will try hard to return soon. Thank you all from Una and David.
title: Sublime beach boutique hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Brilliant, thank you (I think!)

We’ve been called worse but add, by none better; if ever we’ve hosted a couple whose stay was too short you win hands down.

In a world of beige, mainstream mundane, daring to be different is a little risky I admit, a tad bonkers even - but then again, is it? So long as we continue being blessed by great guest lists, fill the house each season, and still enjoy what we do after 14 years, why sell-out?

Heaped thanks, for your valuable custom, this bonkers (but fab) review and for choosing us, we could not have wished for better company albeit it too brief. Please forgive me for saying however, for a pilot you’re a lousy route planner - taxi less and stay grounded longer next time please, I promise you’ll come to love us even more!! 

It was a blast...

Respect & warm wishes
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Treat yourself to at least a few days
text: If you want eccentric and loud (and that’s just the owner) look no further! From the moment you enter the grounds you know it’s going to be different with loudly painted (bright yellows and blues) villas to the eclectically decorated dining room. This is definitely not your standard boutique hotel and it doesn’t pretend to be. The staff are excellent and the food is wonderful. There are no real timings just have breakfast when it suits, the chef is there from 8am till the last man falls! Rooms are simple and comfortable with bathrooms the size of a British apartment. Two swimming pools and a path on to the stunning beach. This place has it all, it’s slightly bonkers, eccentric and eclectic- we loved it
title: Bonkers but fab

ownerResponse/text:
Unforgettable? Me too.

Unexpected moments often remind me of my good fortune and privileged life as an hotelier. One privalege, loafing around in the bar with a glass of wine in my hand, swapping stories with the interesting folk that I meet, came to the fore spending time with you both. We are kindred spirits in many ways I think, so thank you for sharing your time, you are a joy to host. 

Your eloquent praise on this forum and in person is heartwarming, humbling and second to none and I sincerely thank you for it. But, it is your superb company and old school good manners (a rarity these days) that I shall remember always. Needless to say, you will always be welcome at 'Oceanfront @ Buckingham Place' (cheeky, but please feel free to copy your fab review to our restaurant listing!) and I shall look forward to your return.

By no means their spokesperson, I thank and toast you both on behalf of Rekwa’s nesting sea turtles and human community. Whilst many in the community are yet to fully appreciate your conservation initiative and, your effort I know seems akin to having teeth pulled, progress does come with each visit, slowly but surely, visible or not. Rome wasn’t built in a day but it turned out just fine!

Until next time gentlemen…

Warm regards & respect
Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: I recently had the great pleasure of dining at Buckingham Place. It was an unforgettable experience in the most breathtaking surroundings. It was apparent as soon as we arrived that a great deal of thought and love has gone in to creating such a magical place. From the luscious tropical gardens to the glorious design and decor of the dining and bar area it managed to feel exclusive yet extremely welcoming. It is the kind of setting where I imagine Bond and Hemingway would happily settle. We started the evening with superb cocktails in the bar/lounge area to a soundtrack of the Indian Ocean and some magnificent jazz. Unobtrusive yet wonderfully atmospheric. We then moved to the airy dining room which looks out onto one of the pools surrounded by palms and the white sands below. I ordered the sesame crusted tuna salad with fresh mango and a miso/wasabi dip which was one of those dishes I will forever try to recreate but will never come close to succeeding. It was exquisite and I would return to Sri Lanka for that alone. The service was also superb. The staff were attentive but not overly so. They seemed to appear when we needed something but were not watching our every move. I can not recommend Buckingham Place highly enough. I plan on returning there as soon as I can. Magnificent.
title: Unforgettable experience.

ownerResponse/text:
Please come back!!

Thank you for coming to stay, and then taking time to post a truly helpful stand-out review. We are proud to read it this morning and I am reminded personally, how fortunate we are to still boast the best guest list on the island in our 14th year.

Many one night stay guests have become regulars over the years and folk we see as friends. Most tell me they rarely or never return to a hotel only ours, so I hope you will as they have, and you’ve found a sanctuary that remains in your hearts always. 

Thank you for your valued custom and good company, moreover, thank you for your respect and kind empathy for us all. Until next time and always I wish you happy travels and, a blissfully happy life!

Warmest regards,

Nick, Kalpa & the Team

text: This is the place to be whilst in Rekawa. Well worth staying in this fabulous place. Had the pleasure of meeting  the owner, Mr Nick Buckingham himself, and enjoyed our conversation. The staff made sure we had everything we needed in this fabulous hotel. The room was excellent, the only drawback was that we only spent one night. Will stay here if we return to the area.
title: Excellent and then some

ownerResponse/text:
Perfect couple… perfect review...!

Thank you very much for sharing your joy with us at Buckingham Place, and for this perfect review.

You were a delight to host and it is so rewarding to know you embark on life together with happy memories of us in your hearts.

We are privaleged to work at the hotel of choice for many honeymooners, Sri Lankan and foreign nationals alike. We know well, their moment with us must be as perfect as can be as their memories will last a lifetime. So… we take our responsibility very seriously and, I thank you for telling the World we got it right!

On behalf of us all, thank you for choosing our hotel and for your kind compliments here on Trip Advisor. I wish you a wonderful, blessed, and blissfully happy life together, and hope you’ll visit again one day soon.

placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Highly recommend place for a memorable stay. Kind staff with great service and hospitality. They provide the service in high standards and they are very much attentive to the guests. They make you surprise with lovely memories at your special events. Very delicious freshly cooked meals with authentic taste. Lovely rooms with all facilities and large area.
title: Lovely place for a memorable stay…

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you…

Thank you, for coming to stay and then following up with a helpful review, one both complimentary and objective as one expects from seasoned travelers. I’m delighted by your positive comments and will try addressing your observations by means of explanation.
 
First, especially through rainy seasons, Sri Lanka’s fascinating (to me) bio diversity can occasionally come too close, irrespective of the lengths those of us with open air facilities go to in order to sanitize and prevent it. Even during hot dry periods in the tropics, wildlife can present challenges to guests and hoteliers alike; often we can fear the unknown in my experience. To give you perspective and reassure others, I have lived on the property for 22 years and to my knowledge, nobody has experienced more than minor insect stings and thankfully mosquitoes are rare due to regular fogging and frequent inspection of gutters, gullies, rooftops and drains.
      
Boarding options. I agree with you, B&B is (generally) best option, unless one normally eats heartily three times daily or prefers travel with a fixed meals budget. Extensive breakfast and lunch menus are complimented by five short varied menus rotating over five nights, with bespoke cooking an option at every meal time. We encourage guests to take advantage of a late breakfast and all day dining and often, due to this and generous portions, some find two meals more than adequate. As all meals are al a carte and prepped/cooked freshly to order from scratch, timing can be an issue I agree, but most dishes can be ordered and eaten within an hour except for some of our local options. I’m sorry you missed desert so as not to miss a turtle, during peak nesting months (Feb-Jul) turtles are more plentiful and thus, one need not let one get in the way of desert! I have made note to provide more clarity on this in future so thank you for raising it.

Thank you for taking time to share your experience here on Trip Advisor. I hope overall you felt comfortable, safe and and at home with us, and have returned home with fond memories of your stay. Finally, thank you for your valuable custom, kind feedback and fine company, please come again soon - hopefully the pool will be a bit warmer next time!

Warm regards and respect,

Nick & the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
A very colourful hotel, which provides a beautiful view of the lagoon. The room is extremely large, with an even larger bathroom - which had both a round tub and a large shower. The shower area is open-air, which can be definitely romantic, however, we did have some friendly birds get trapped inside the bathroom, and some insects roaming around as well. 

The staff and owner (who lives on site) are very friendly, and there is a snooker table as well as board games for those rainy days in. Dinner and breakfast are a la carte, so it may not make sense to purchase half board, as opposed to just ordering what you want to eat on the day, as the menu is the same. If you want to go watch the turtles after dinner, make sure you ask for an early dinner slot. We were told that 1 hour was enough, but we had to skip dessert because 1.5hrs into the meal we were still not served. 

The infinity pool is gorgeous, and very relaxing (although a bit cold).
title: A very colourful place to stay

ownerResponse/text:
The place is abuzz…

I proudly share your heartfelt review with the team this morning, as it underlines for us all that we are still ‘on-message’; that a hotel can be more than a bed for the night if only it tries.

Your kind words of support touch us all, thank you, and will surely inspire others who seek a sanctuary aspiring to send everyone home with fond memories, memories of a country I am lucky to call home.

Keeping everyone happy all of the time is a lofty aspiration to say the least, given the diversity of a travelers needs, their age, expectations and past experience, so, when we see it on their face and are told that we have our efforts are all the more worthwhile. Thank you for sharing your happiness with us and the world on this forum.
 
Lastly, thanks again for your valuable good custom and great company, we enjoyed your time with us but wish it had been longer. I wish you and your family a very healthy and blissfully happy life – and hope you keep us on the ‘must return’ list always - and yes please, for a longer stay!

Until next time…

Our warm regards and respect,

Nick and the Team

roomTip: Don’t hesitate to go
text: I wanted to be back to the uk before writing this review to give credit to this amazing place. We spent 2 weeks in Sri Lanka. After staying 3 nights at Buckingham’s place we could not avoid comparing any hotels we stayed to Nick’s place. Buckingham’s is more than an hotel. It’s a place where you feel at home. You are not clients… you are guests invited to share this little place of paradise. You can’t fault anything: the amazing rooms, the open sky shower, the attention to details, the food but most importantly the staff. They will be at the same time discreet but attentive to your any needs. We enjoyed so much our stay, listening to Nick’s story and passion for Sri l and for his life project. Would we come back… any time but for longer. Thank you Nick, Talpa and all the staff. You have made our stay so special.
title: Unique

ownerResponse/text:
Exceptional review, exceptional guests...

Sincere thanks on behalf us all. Thanks for returning, bringing your friends, for supporting us magnificently with your custom and this second, truly exceptional review – above all, thank you for becoming part of this place and our lives.

We all use hotels, have our favorites and occasionally return, but rarely do we expect or find more than a bed for the night and (usually) something to complain about! Often, our ‘baggage’ goes before us to make us cynical and wary of what to expect of the hotel, its staff and fellow travelers. Thus, we keep our guard up and ourselves to ourselves, invariably missing what’s in front of our eyes including the good company of others. Not so with you! From the minute you arrived for your first stay to the end of your last, you made yourselves at home in every sense, endearing yourselves to the entire team, other guests and me personally. To read your remarkable accolade ours is your 'second home and the absolute benchmark by which we judge elsewhere’ I am genuinely moved. Yes, we see you as regulars already, but there was no question by the end of your first stay you would become so, and I look forward to sharing Christmas with you both and then welcome you back next July. You are the very first to book another two stays before leaving the hotel – this is an amazing compliment, I thank you again.            

All guests are special, nothing is too much trouble and everyone deserves to go home with fond memories has become our ethos. Some folk however, as you do, sprinkle a little magic of their own to make their holiday happier, both for themselves and others. You bring out the best in us with your empathy, sensitivity and not least, sense of humour, especially when we get it wrong as inevetbly we do at times. Personally, sharing time with you is not just ‘my job as host but a privalege – even when you’re a grumpy old man!!    

Thanks for your valuable custom, great company and OUR happy memories. Until next time, take care of yourselves, keep living life to the full while sharing the magic you are as a couple with every soul that you meet.  

Big hugs from us all
Nick, Kalpa and your Team xx

text:
Our second time visiting and loving this utterly fabulous unique boutique hotel! Everything from the setting to the location is perfect! Nothing, absolutely nothing is too much trouble and every member of the excellent staff give 100% to looking after you and making you feel wanted, part of their lives and in every moment looked after and valued to such a fabulous level! They make me smile inwardly and outwardly and the pleasure they generate is just .. well just exquisite! You are engaged with on every single level. Room staff / garden staff / stewards / leads absolutely everyone work tirelessly to seamlessly make your stay extra special.
What do I love most? Everything! The resident dogs Gracie B  and Bella even welcome you (Well when Gracie B warms to you). The rooms are spotless. The bathrooms are unique and I adore the open roof touch that even when a rainfall comes adds to the specialness of this place! The Spa is likewise a fabulous moment in this extraordinary place! 
Thank you all so very much!!
We are coming back and are privileged to be now called regulars!
We love it!!!
title: For us it’s our second home and the absolute benchmark by which we judge elsewhere!!

ownerResponse/text:
Please Do…

The title of your fabulous review says it all and made me smile this morning! Thank you for this and for going on to share why a repeat visit might be required. For us it it was a pleasure and privalege to host you, so quite naturally we too wish you could have stayed longer. Hopefully there will be a next time and, an opportunity for us to shine once again.
     
Sri Lanka surprises most on their first visit, and for many, continues doing so time after time. My own early experiences of the islands glorious diversity, idiosyncrasies and welcoming spirit are what brought me back and hefted me to the island for the last 22 years. There is so much to do, even within a short radius of the hotel, and the same can be said of pretty much everywhere here. I’m delighted you’ve sampled this for yourselves with a wonderful holiday, but also that this was only the first of many equally wonderful visits.

Thank you for your excellent company and kind empathy for us all. Thanks for your valuable custom and again, your fabulous review. Until we hopefully meet again and always, I wish you happy ad safe travels and a blissfully happy life - with enduring fond memories of Sri Lanka and Buckingham Place.

Yes, please do come again!

Warm regards and respect

Nick, Kalpa and the Team
placeInfo/address: Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Buckingham Place was our final stop on an action packed 2 week itinerary around Sri Lanka. I only wish we could have stayed for longer than 3 nights as it is the perfect place to kick back and relax. The rooms are extremely spacious (the large redundant space in the bathroom is calling out for a freestanding bath!) and comfortable. 

We loved the pool area and the pool table in the games room was well used by my sons. The beach is accessible through the hotel grounds - although the sea was too rough to even paddle during our stay, it’s a lovely stretch to walk along. We were even accompanied by Bella the very friendly hotel dog on one of our walks!

The food in the vibrant restaurant is fantastic - there were some great alternatives to curry which we’d rather had our fill of by the end of the trip. The breakfast crepes and the seared tuna were delicious and my boys were very appreciative of the Marmite and Heinz Ketchup! 

The staff at Buckingham Place are a real credit to the hotel - attentive, accommodating and hospitable throughout. 

Thank you Buckingham Place for a magical end to a wonderful holiday in Sri Lanka.
title: Repeat visit required!

Daggi und ich hatten das Vergnügen, einen traumhaften und entspannten Urlaub im Buckingham Place zu verbringen. Von der ersten Sekunde an fühlten wir uns willkommen. Nick und sein Team sind unglaublich freundlich und aufmerksam, ohne dabei aufdringlich zu sein.

Das Hotel ist ein wahres Paradies. Die Zimmer sind stilvoll und geräumig, und der Pool lädt zum Relaxen ein. Besonders hervorzuheben sind die vielfältigen Frühstücksvarianten und die flexiblen Zeiten, die es uns ermöglichten, ganz entspannt in den Tag zu starten.

Der ideale Ort um die Uhr abzulegen, zu entspannen und eine tolle ruhige Zeit zu verbringen.

Viele Grüße aus Köln

Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for sharing your experience  at Wild Coast with us.  We truly appreciate your wonderful review. We are delighted you had 'the best experience ever' with us  and that you not only enjoyed not only the safaris but the cocktails as well!

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
The food, including breakfast, lunch, and dinner, was delicious and of highly satisfying quality.

While swimming in the pool, the bar staff approached me at just the right moment to offer a drink. I had an arrack-based cocktail, which was absolutely delightful.

The evening sundowner was a luxurious experience, sipping cocktails while watching the sunset and the campfire. At night, I was able to see countless stars, creating a very romantic atmosphere.

The safari tour was also incredibly enjoyable. A knowledgeable ranger, well-versed in the behavior of the animals, guided us to many wonderful encounters. Although it was disappointing not to see a leopard, I felt very fortunate to spot a rare sloth bear.

One small issue was the communication with the hotel’s dedicated staff via WhatsApp. Responses were not always timely, which caused some inconvenience during luggage handling at check-out.

However, overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I would love to stay for multiple nights if I have the opportunity to return.
title: The best experience ever

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Truly one of a kind and utterly unforgettable. From the moment we stepped out of our transfer vehicle we were greeted with smiles and the warmest of welcomes, and this heightened level of hospitality continued throughout our entire stay. Our curator was Rohan, who made our stay even more exceptional.
The rooms: we had a family suite which consisted of a master lodge and a smaller adjoining lodge. Both were decadent, and gave us and the kids a sense of being an explorer in times gone past. Leather and copper abounded the rooms, and clever designed and opulent furniture made the room not just aesthetically pleasing, but also functional and not in the least cluttered. So much so that we barely used the second room. The deck was lovely and contained a nice sized 1.3m deep pool which had an extra ambience in the evening. The kids and us loved it, and it was the perfect spot to read and take a refreshing dip.
The food: excellent, even for the harshest critics. A great variety for both adults and children, with options that changed each day. Sri Lanka staples and international fare ensured a difficult decision each meal, as I could have had every meal a second and third time, but forced myself to try a new dish each sitting. The seafood platter was exceptional, and contained locally caught lobster, prawns and crab - to name just a small portion of its contents.
The bar: a great place to enjoy an ice cold beer or a cocktail whilst the kids enjoyed the iconic pool which adjoined the bar and overlooked the stunning beach.
The Safaris: amazing. We had small children and did the early morning one and the evening one, and saw an abundance of wildlife on both, including what everyone comes to see - a leopard. Irrespective of seeing the leopard, the whole experience was unforgettable as we had the most amazing guide Saranga, who had such a wealth of knowledge on not just the animals, but the country as a whole, and truly engaged with both our children and us. The safari experience is tailored to each guest, and this made it even more perfect.
Extra facilities: the didn’t use the spa, but did so at the sister resort in Weligama, and had a fantastic experience there. I can only imagine it would be of a similar high quality. The library was cute and contained plenty of local literature which I found fascinating.
The beach: rugged and beautiful, but you don’t come here to swim in it. There are sundowners each night on the grounds leading up to the beach where you can catch an amazing sunset and whilst being visited by monkeys, spotted deer and even an elephant if you are lucky! We had both of the former, but not the latter. There is also a special beach dinner provided by an open fire where you can experience the delicious food, whilst stargazing and being soothed by the sound of the sea. An amazing experience.
I could continue on, but the above is a small summary of our experience.
Would I return? Yes, in a heartbeat, as would the whole family.
Would I recommend the resort? Yes, to solo travellers, families with our without kids of any ages. This resort is for EVERYONE!
Will we return? I can only hope we do one day, as it is one of a kind and a highlight for even the most well travelled
title: Rugged and decadent, truly unforgettable

The food??? Included and INCREDIBLE. The Safari in Yala National Park??? Also included, private and SOO GOOD. title: Greatest Hotel Experience EVER

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
This polished resort seems unlikely at first read but it is not an illusion. Clever gardening and ponds shield accomodation pods from one another. It is misleading to call the air conditioned, insulated, double glazed, bug and crawly proof comfort capsules 'tents' but they do feel like it. Just not like tents you would carry on your back. 
We enjoyed a driving safari and on day two a morning nature walk. It's a special skill to interpret a foreign landscape to a visitor. Not merely to guide a safari but add layer upon layer of insight and meaning. Suranga has it. 
And the sharp eye. I had not really expected to see a leopard AND a pangolin on the first pass. 
But the real treat was a simple walk along the foreshore and back into the dunes where he added layers of scent and flavour 'here try it - we use it for diabetes' superimposed on the tracks of a leopard, crocodile close up (it was still a cool morning and we approached from the rear), scat analysis and why it was a leopard and what he had been eating. Then there was the geology, the botany, the sociology of poaching and cultural change. I hadn't realised I was interested in ornithology - but thanks to Su I am now.
title: Most comfortable tents

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
Our experience at Wild Coast Tented Lodge was a mix of highs and a few challenges. Before our arrival, there was some confusion around the payment process, as the lodge requested full payment despite our deposit already being made. It took several emails to resolve this, which was a bit frustrating. However, once we arrived, any lingering irritation melted away—the lodge is truly extraordinary.

The tented lodges are a masterpiece of design, both inside and out. Stepping into our tent felt like stepping back in time, yet with every modern comfort imaginable. There wasn’t a single thing we needed that wasn’t already thoughtfully provided. The attention to detail is exemplary, making it a luxurious retreat unlike any other.

Now, let’s talk about the food—just delicious! Each meal was a culinary delight, and the quality was consistently exceptional. While the cost per night is certainly on the higher end, it’s genuinely worth it. You’re well taken care of, with food and drink provided to such a high standard that you never feel the pinch of the price.

The only downside to our stay was the safari experience. Unfortunately, our ranger didn’t seem very knowledgeable, which detracted from what should have been one of the core highlights of our trip. That said, Yala National Park is breathtaking. We were lucky enough to see elephants, spotted deer, buffalos, and a variety of birds, though no sloth bears or leopards.

Even with the safari disappointment, I would still highly recommend Wild Coast Tented Lodge for the quality of the tented accommodation alone. It’s an experience I’ll remember for years to come. If you’re considering it, go—you won’t regret it!
title: Luxury Redefined: A Stunning Stay at Wild Coast Tented Lodge

We look forward to welcoming you again in the future!

text: A truly unique place. The safaris offered as part of your stay were terrific and I suspect they're the main reason people stay here. The guides were just terrific: knowledgeable, helpful, engaging, friendly, and courteous.  But the lodge itself is a great destination in its own right. The service was top of the line.  And the food was also just terrific. I opted for one of the rooms with a private plunge pool and was so glad I did. The area teems with wildlife and I was even joined one morning on the deck by a family of monkeys. A wild elephant also made an appearance within view of the main lodge. I had a simply wonderful time and would love to go back.

Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for sharing your husband and son's experience  at Wild Coast  with us.  We truly appreciate your wonderful review.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
My Husband & Son went on a boys trip to wild coast tented lodge for the weekend. We last visited this amazing resort in 2020 and my husband & son were amazed at how they have maintained the resort so well that it still seems as if it is brand new. 

However what always impresses us at every Dilmah hotel / resort is the incredible people working  there and the amazing attention to every detail they put in to giving you better than world class service. 

The team at wild coast has always pampered & spoilt us and this trip has been no different for my husband & son. 

They were warmly greeted at the hotel by Sanduruwan & Sashi the curator who organized their stay. Aishira kept them both entertained with his charm  and ensured they were always looked after with food & drinks in abundance. Aishira’s special & unique fruit mocktails which he makes off the menu is simply fabulous and a must try. No 2 mocktails are ever the same!! Mostly my Husband & son were incredibly happy to have met Chef Chintaka who made them fabulous customized food for their exact dietary requirements which was simply divine. They were overwhelmed by how kind and attentive he was. He spent time talking to my son and understanding his food preferences and helped introduce him to new foods which is something we really struggle with!!

Honestly we keep coming back because no other hotel treats us this well where we feel like we are surrounded by family. The kindness & joy is infectious. You feel better about everything after a night here. 

We can’t talk about wild coast tented lodge without talking about the incredible safari into Yala park. My husband & son had the adventure of going on 2 trips into Yala with the well spoken, highly experienced, extremely entertaining and incredibly knowledgeable Ranger Kasun. With his incredible tracking skills of listening to monkey warning calls and observing tracks on the ground my husband & son managed to see leopards on both trips into Yala. On the 2nd trip they had the rare privilege of seeing a female leopard with her cub drinking water together at a watering hole. 

This place is a must visit for any vacation to Sri Lanka. Be it for family’s, couples or singles. It’s an experience of a life time. 

Many thanks to all the incredible staff who make this experience possible.
title: The best Yala experience

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text: My husband and I had an amazing time glamping in one of the cocoon pool suites at the resort. Regarding the overall accommodations, all I can stay that it was stunning. The cocoon suite accommodation was so unique and we enjoyed our pool time in the private pool. Staying in the middle of nature, waking up to bird calls was so beautiful and much needed after living in the urban jungle. Watching the mighty Indian Ocean beat against the beach and rocks was mesmerizing; we could have watched this for hours. Secondly, we had the all-inclusive package and had 2 game drives. We did an afternoon and a morning game drive. Our guide, ranger Kasun, and driver, Kumar, did an excellent job showing us Yala National Park and the various animals, including quickly getting us to a leopard sighting one morning. You can tell how passionate Ranger Kasun was about the animals and preserving nature. Lastly, the service and food at the resort was truly exceptional. We had some long drives and the staff made sure that we always had water and to go snack boxes with us.  All the staff at the bar and restaurant went above and beyond in making sure we were taken care of. All the meals - definitely try all the curries - and drinks were delicious. While we did not do the afternoon tea (because we were so full from breakfast and lunch), we did have the amazing Sri Lankan tea. The canapés at the sundowner were also very flavorful. Unfortunately it rained both afternoons we were there so we did the sundowners at the bar rather than the cliff overlooking the ocean. We would love to go back and stay here!
title: Amazing Glamping Experience in Yala National Park

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
roomTip: Pour les familles mais pas avec  les petites enfants à cause de proximité des annimaux sauvages.
text:
Excellent hôtel,probablement un de meilleur sur l'île,près de la réserve Yala.
Nous avons séjourné dans une suite familiale composée d'une grande tente reliée par le  pont à  une petite tente et une piscine privative.
Les  tentes très desinges dans l'esprit safari de très belle qualité.Le personnel sans faute,attentionné,excellent service et la cuisine exceptionnelle.Notre guide Boody pour le safari  a fait son possible pour qu'on voit le maximum des annimaux.Très belle plage et happy hours l'après-midi avec le personnel.L'endroit magique.Je conseille cet hôtel à tous qui désirent vivre une aventure safari .
title: Un endroit magique.

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for sharing your experience  at Wild Coast with us.  We truly appreciate your fantastic review. We are delighted your  first safari experience as well as your birthday wasa special one with us!

It’s especially heartening to know that our team, Tharanga in particular made a significant impact on your stay. We have shared your positive feedback with the team and thanked them on your behalf.

We look forward to welcoming you again in the future!
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
roomTip: Get a cocoon with pool and bring your own binoculars
text: This was our first safari and on a birthday trip so we splurged to stay at Wild Coast.  Yes, it’s expensive but it ticked off all of our boxes: near Yala National Park, on the ocean, private and comfortable rooms with personalized service, sustainable mission, and all-inclusive safaris and delicious food and drink.  The facility is beautifully designed to blend into the park flora and fauna with as little environmental impact as possible. The unique cocoon suites (most with private plunge pool) are located around watering holes that attracts wildlife.  We watched monkeys frolicking in the trees and watering hole from our cocoon.  Yes, there can be other wildlife around since this is a fence less property: elephants, leopards, snakes, buffaloes, etc.  That is why you have to be escorted by a staff person around the property at night.  But the main reason to come here is the private safaris., and you get one each day. Since you are staying at the Resort, you bypass the line of jeeps waiting to get into the park (and there can be as many as 100 jeeps in that line).  Tauranga was our ranger/guide for our two safaris as well as a late afternoon walk to a nearby tank.  He freely shared his knowledge of wildlife, birds and trees of Yala with us and best of all has an excellent eye for wildlife.  With his help,  we were lucky enough to view a leopard watching a crocodile eating a boar during our afternoon safari, and lots of elephants and birds.  There is no guarantee to see wildlife,  but it’s still a fun and unique experience.  Bring your own binoculars, water and a scarf (it can get dusty on the open air jeep).  After our safaris, we were welcomed back with cool towels, drink and dinner in the restaurant.  It’s a Relais & Chateaux so we were not disappointed by the delicious and varied food and drink selections.  I was celebrating my birthday, so we were surprised by a dinner on the beach on our last night.  This is the luxury way to experience a Yala safari; highly recommended!
title: Safari glamping to the max!

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
text:
We stayed here as a family of four for 3 nights from 16th to 19th August. Our family Cocoon had incredible interior and was spotlessly clean. The cleanliness was maintained brilliantly despite the jungle location by our lovely housekeeper Chathuranga who came twice a day ,morning and evening for turn down. We noticed everything being freshened up and details like slippers and water being put by our bed. The best turn down we experienced  in Sri Lanka. 

The restaurant was fantastic, dining there one would never believe that you were in the middle of the jungle, the choice and presentation of foods was incredible. As vegetarians we were well catered for. The croissants at breakfast were the best we’ve ever tasted outside of Paris!! Our teenage sons are both autistic and they prefer more simple foods. After conversation with restaurant manager Chamika, he kindly allowed them  to eat from the kids menu and allowed any modifications they needed to be comfortable. Chamika is a genuinely warm and caring gentleman and really put us at ease regarding these requests. Thank you so very much Chamika this was really appreciated by all of us as a family. 

Through no fault at all of the hotel one of our sons was unwell during our stay, twice in the restaurant as it happens. The staff were incredibly kind to us, in particular I wanted to mention Tilshan. He walked with my son and I back to our room both times, helped him to freshen up outside of the restaurant and was just generally caring and accommodating. He was often our sever in the restaurant and carefully remembered all of our particular orders, we really are so grateful to him. I also wanted to mention Rhunini in the restaurant, as we understood she is new to the team and currently in training. We found her to be an incredibly kind, attentive and proactive young lady who is so mature and we have no doubt a bright future in hospitality ahead of her. 

We were on the all inclusive package and as a result we had 3 game drives included in our stay. We were extremely fortunate to have been allocated Shani as our ranger. At present the only female ranger in Yala national park!! What an inspiring lady, who was so kind and patient. Shani was so concerned the morning that my husband and son were missing from a game drive after my son had been unwell, thankfully he was better for our final game drive and she went out of her way to make sure he was happy and comfortable that afternoon. Shani has a vast knowledge of all the wildlife, despite being relatively new to this position. Her passion for her country’s animals and birds was infectious. We thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent with her on all three of the game drives, she answered all our questions and along with the two drivers we had; was so patient in allowing to watch, listen and take as much time as we needed to enjoy a moment whenever we stopped. 

We were fortunate to see leopards twice on our last day (morning and evening) Shani was genuinely so happy that my son who had been unwell had also managed to see one after missing out that morning. We also saw a pair of the very rare black neck storks during our final game drive. This was all incredible and we felt so lucky, however we have to say it was such a privilege to see every animal, bird and reptile that we did. Shani we can never thank you enough for 3 amazing drives; giving us an introduction to Sri Lankan wildlife; making us want to visit Yala again and allowing us to create many happy family memories. 

One small negative was the pressure we felt at the end of the stay here by our host to provide a review. We completely understand the importance of reviews particularly in Sri Lanka, however an email to both my husband and I in the middle of our final game drive about this really wasn’t the time! When we returned to the property to finally relax at the sundowners;  with our son feeling much better, wishing to enjoy the moment and reflect on our game drive,  we were approached by the host and asked again to complete a review! In my opinion it would be better to allow guests to enjoy their holiday moments and discuss this at check out. I don’t know if this is happens with every guest or if it was just us at these timings?There were numerous WhatsApps around that time in the group set up by host, for communication during our stay which made us felt it was all about a review. Yet the same gentleman hadn’t cared to check in with us to see if our son was ok the morning after being quite  unwell the night before, when everyone else we saw immediately asked if he was alright. When it was review time the texts were numerous!! We personally don’t appreciate this kind of pressure. As a family we will be the first to give thanks, praise and give feedback verbally when it’s deserved. We almost always write reviews too, but in our own time. We prefer to relax and be present in the moment when on holiday and leave the reviews until we are home. Please take this into consideration! Other than this we really had a lovely stay, thank you to all of the team for your hospitality.
title: Beautiful Yala.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux
