placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
roomTip: All rooms are wonderful. I have never slept so well or so charmingly.
text: This is the most beautiful & rewarding holiday I have ever been on. The warmth & expertise of the people & the raw unspoilt  natural beauty of Ulpotha was transformative for my health & well-being. I can’t wait to return.
title: A unique wellness, cultural heritage and eco tourism experience

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text:
Sounds a little over the top but I have just returned from a week at Ulpotha and I can honestly say that it was one of the best weeks of my life. Everything about it was perfect, the food, the yoga, the treatments both the ayurveda and from the visiting therapists, the accommodation and above all the wonderful people: not only those that looked after us so brilliantly but the other guests too. I met some truly fantastic people who I am sure I will know for life. I did a lot of laughing last week!! 
I have come away feeling calmer, stronger, happier and deeply grateful for the experience. I also feel so much better equipped to deal with the madness of the world we currently inhabit.
 Living so close to nature and the removal from the modern world can take a bit of getting used to for some people but it is the best thing for the soul. Sit back, relax and let Ulpotha work her magic.
The only two questions you will ask yourself upon leaving is why didn't I come here before and how soon can I come back?
title: One of the best weeks of my life!

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text: This is not just any place and it is hard to make it justice. Ulpotha offers a wonderful combination of basic living in huts, great  and beautifully presented food, beautiful surroundings and fantastic possibilities to relax from the stressful everyday life at home. What makes Ulpotha so unique is the mixture of other nice & interesting guests, the hosts, the villagers gently guidance and care for us throughout the stay and the world class yoga. Beautifully designed, located in the jungle a stay here means being in the nature, close to animals, sleeping and waking up to the sound of the jungle, outside showers and no electricity. I grade it as  one of my very top  travel experiences that I will carry with me for a very long time. It feels like a privilege to have visited Ulpotha and I hope to be back one day,
title: This is true luxury to me!

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text: Ulpotha felt like a world away from my usually hectic life. Everything done for you and nothing to think about. Amazing food, super nice and helpful staff, beautiful jungle setting and swimming in the lake. Simplicity at its best.
title: Magical Ulpotha

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text: Ulpotha is so much more than a yoga and Ayurveda retreat.  This is truly a place where you can disconnect from the world and re-connect with Mother Nature and yourself on so many levels.  Yes, the yoga twice a day is incredible, the food is truly organic, in-season and very tasty, there are plenty of quiet spaces for me-time, swims in the fresh water lake, meditation on Sunset Rock, no plastic, world-class body work therapists and showers under the stars.  But the real beauty of this place lays in the incredible people who live and work here and who embodies the true spirit of Ulpotha.  There is always a smile and a willingness to help.  I had a medical emergency during my stay and had to spend a couple of days in hospital.  The villagers insisted on visiting me daily - even though it is a 2-hour drive one-way - bringing me healthy Ulpotha food, clean linen, moral support and also helping me to navigate the intricacies of the Sri Lankan hospital bureaucracy.  They did this even when I said it is not necessary.  This is just what they do!  There are not enough words to express my endless gratitude to them, as well as the owners of Ulpotha, for their kindness and care.  I urge you - go and experience Ulpotha for yourself.  You will receive so much more than what you expect!!
title: Beyond Expectations

placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text: Reading all of these glowing reviews, you might naturally wonder if Ulpotha is as good as everyone says. Well, I can assure you that it REALLY is.  I’m a 60-year-old American who has travelled quite a bit.  And I’ve gotta say, Ulpotha is magic. The lake and mountains that surround it are … AWEsome.  I don’t mean just great.  I mean that every time I looked at them or swam in the water – probably 4 times day for two weeks – I was in awe. It would just about take my breath way.  Profound. Healing.  Genuinely magical.  Add to that a daily plethora of spectacularly delicious REAL Sri Lanka food (ah, the coconut balls!), with ingredients grown on the local community land (oh right, and the fried garlic!).  And beautiful and extraordinarily comfortable accommodations, genuinely friendly and generous staff, and a bunch of like-minded other guests from around the world.  And that’s not even mentioning the WORLD CLASS yoga instruction (for real) and visits to incredible and little-visited renowned sites. The two weeks were among the most fun and transformative in my life. Thank you, Suzie, for your kindness, generosity of spirit, and hospitality!
title: COMPLETELY MAGICAL

roomTip: The best room is the one I had, an earth and palm leaf roofed mansion on the rock that sleeps 3.
text:
This piece of heaven on earth is like no other retreat. If you want a complete digital detox,to reconnect with what actually is important on our planet as a species,and to do deepen your yoga practice with like minded people,this glorious place is for you.The care,kindness and uncontrived way of being in Ulpotha is truly a tonic for the senses and the soul.The absence of electricity means the food is cooked over fire,giving it a quality not often tasted in our switched on world.The accommodation is beautiful and really the entire place has been crafted with such attention and sensitivity to the geography I just loved every moment of my stay.
   I will be back, I actually want to live there for the rest of my life.
The highlight of my stay was doing breathing up on a huge rock,watching the sunset whilst the full moon rose in front of us.Oh, and swimming by the full moon in the lake was the icing on the cake.
title: Full nature immersion

placeInfo/address: Near Dambulla & Sigirya In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle, Ulpotha Village 21100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: In The Heart Of The Cultural Triangle
placeInfo/name: Ulpotha Yoga Retreat And Ayurveda Resort
text: From the minute we arrived at Ulpotha for our yoga retreat, we were taken care of with great warmth and care by Susie and her wonderful team of local villagers. The twice-a-day yoga schedule taught by the unparalleled Mick Barnes; treatments from the highly credentialled visiting international massage therapists; the consultation with the local Ayrvedic doctor and subsequent program of treatments; and the locally sourced, traditionally made, delicious cuisine throughout our stay made for a wholly unique and authentic experience. Ulpotha offers a real, jungle experience, enabling a digital detox of the best kind. The traditional hut-style accommodation is basic and without electricity, however, each hut is beautifully designed and serviced daily. The cold water, outdoor showers hidden from view in inventive constructions within rock crevices, are both liberating and invigorating. It's amazing how quickly it's possible to adjust to needing very little and embracing this opportunity to simpy 'be' in this jungle paradise. Swimming in the freshwater lake was one of the highlights, along with walking to the top of the nearby rocks to meditate and take in the panoramic views and sounds of nothing but nature. Another highlight was the opportunity to meet many fantastic people from all corners of the globe who came together to participate in the retreat and share in the Ulpotha experience–beautiful bonds and ongoing friendships were founded. To fellow yogis from anywhere, I cannot recommend this experience highly enough, and I very much look forward to returning in the not too distant future.
title: Yoga in jungle paradise

text: Ulpotha has been the MOST SPECIAL retreat place I have ever been too. The place has its very own soul based on unconditional love, its luxury is made out of nature with all its trees and flowers, the diversity of animals, the most heartily local people caring for you and the founders team with the greatest attention to detail. At its core sits an enchanted lake, open to swimming for the guests as well as a meeting space for the locals in the early evening. The lake is surrounded by a diverse forest and rocks to climb up to for the best views for sun set and sun rise. Spending two weeks there and you feel deeply connected to your core essence again. Ulpotha founders & team have really understood how to live luxurious with and in nature with the minimal human footprint. A place all of humanity should get to know as an inspiration on how to live in balance with mother earth again. Thank you Ulpotha, see you again!
title: A place of unconditional love

placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Colombo City Centre Mall and Residences
text:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel, which is directly connected to the Colombo City Centre Mall—very convenient for shopping and dining. It’s also just a 5-minute walk to the beach area, where you can enjoy a gorgeous sunset along with delicious food and drinks at nearby restaurants.

The hotel features a lovely rooftop poolside restaurant, perfect for relaxing with a drink or enjoying a peaceful dinner with a view.

The staff were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and always ready to help—true Sri Lankan hospitality. One small area for improvement is the response time when calling the main operator (dialing 0); it sometimes took two or three calls to get through.

Breakfast was also enjoyable, offering a good variety of international and local cuisines.

If you’re visiting Colombo, I highly recommend staying at—or at least stopping by—this beautiful hotel.
title: A Beautiful Hotel with Stunning Views and Excellent Location

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
Subject:** Wonderful Experience at Jaffna Heritage Hotel  

I recently visited **Jaffna** with my family, including my twin kids, and we stayed at the **Jaffna Heritage Hotel**. It was a simple yet superb experience. The staff was incredibly friendly, attentive, and maintained a neat environment.  

What stood out the most was the **authentic Jaffna cuisine** they served. The food was outstanding—prepared naturally without any artificial colors or additives. They’ve done a fantastic job of preserving the **traditional Jaffna flavors**, which made every meal a delight.  

The hotel is conveniently located **very close to Nallur**, making it easy to get around. Architecturally, the hotel is beautiful, well-constructed, and showcases a prestigious design that reflects Jaffna’s heritage.  

One thing that surprised me was my mother’s reaction. She’s usually critical about food wherever we stay, but for the first time, she genuinely appreciated the **authentic food heritage** offered throughout our stay—it was truly mind-blowing for her.  

I also noticed that the hotel operates with great routine and discipline. The pool, located in the middle of the driveway, adds a refreshing touch to the overall ambiance.  

I am extremely satisfied with my stay, and without a doubt, I will choose **Jaffna Heritage Hotel** again for my next visit. I highly recommend this place to everyone—it’s truly worth the experience!  

Best regards,  
Kiriharan S  
Crown Trading Company
Dam Street
title: Wonderful Experience at Jaffna Heritage Hotel

text:
I had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel in Jaffna. The service was excellent, and the calm and peaceful environment made my stay truly relaxing. The hotel's location is ideal, being close to many must-visit places in the area, making it convenient for sightseeing.

A special mention goes to Vijay and Pratheep for their exceptional service. They were quick, attentive, and ensured all my needs were met with professionalism and a smile. Their efforts truly enhanced my stay.

The breakfast buffet was enjoyable with a good selection, but I would suggest adding more variety to the dinner menu for an even better dining experience.

The rooms were equipped with all the necessary facilities, and I had a comfortable night's sleep throughout my stay.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing and convenient place to stay in Jaffna. I would definitely return for another visit!
title: A Pleasant Stay in Jaffna

placeInfo/address: 195 Temple Rd, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
The best bit about the place is the lovely staff, they looked after us so well, in particular Pratheepsan who helped with luggage, arranged to have the mango we bought in the market prepared for us and restocked our water on request. 

The triple room we had was huge, lovely comfortable beds and pillows and a very powerful shower. 

The room had a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. There was a smallish pool which we did not use but looked nice. There was a good breakfast included in the price with local curries but also fruit, bread and yogurt. 

The hotel is attractive with a colonial feel and large first floor balcony. The location is good, near to the temple but a little way from the centre. Transport is good and cheap around the area.
title: Lovely hotel and staff

placeInfo/address: Kandalama 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Im Jahre 2014 waren wir schon einmal hier und kamen wieder, weil das Hotel in einem riesigen Gelände ist, ich glaube 45 Hektaren, malerisch an einem See gelegen, mit Holzausgucken/Baumhäusern zum Tiere beobachten, Tennisplatz, zwei Swimming Pools, unzähligen Vögeln, Eichhörnchen, Affen... Letztes Mal hatten wir einen Bungalow, dieses Mal eine Suite in einem zweistöckigen Haus, ein wunderbares grosses Zimmer mit grossem Balkon und sehr schönem Badezimmer. Beide Pool-Anlagen sind wunderschön. Eines der schönsten Hotels von Sri Lanka zu einem super Preis/Leistungsverhältnis. Freundliches Personal und guter Service. Auch viele einheimische Gäste, nicht nur ausländische. Sehr sauber.
title: Eine der schönsten Hotelanlagen inmitten wilder Natur
